Red Candle,I289,Flame on,"Throws out a flame that damages everything in its path, diminishing in size as it hits enemies or blocks shots.",2,Red Candle," - On use, Isaac raises the candle above his head. On pressing a fire button, a red flame, similar to a red fire place, will fire in the chosen direction. It can pass over pits, but can not travel through obstacles.
  - The flame deals 23 damage per tick, and can hit up to 5 times for a maximum of 115 damage per flame.
  - The flame also destroys enemy shots it comes into contact with, which decreases its size each time being hit until the flame is entirely extinguished by this process.
  - (Removed in Repentance) The flame projectile is persistent and will remain active in the room until it deals a set amount of damage.
  - (Added in Repentance) Flames will disappear automatically after 10 seconds.
"," - While Isaac holds the candle above his head, his movement speed is reduced.
 - {{Dlc
column2:
nr}} There is no limit to the number of fires that can be active. This is useful in situations where mob spawning can be controlled: for example, beating Boss Rush or Greed Mode as The Lost. This is time-consuming but can be viable if other sources of damage are weak or unreliable.
 - {{Dlc
column3:
nr}} It will block Isaac's tears but won't burn him. Isaac's tears can also shrink the size of the flame.
 - (Added in Repentance) Flames do not block Isaac's shots, nor are they put out by them.
 - Flames will destroy shopkeepers.
 - (Added in Repentance) Flames will turn certain enemies (such as Hoppers and Clotty
column4:
display=Clotties) into their flaming variants, making them stronger. The flame is unable to damage these monsters.
",True

skull marked with a small ""X"" in Depths will drop Telepills instead of 0 - The Fool.

column6: Devil Deal would. This ''does'' affect Angel Room / Devil Room chance, so if Isaac takes this item, no Angel Rooms will appear for the rest of the run unless he has Act of Contrition, Book of Virtues, Duality, or Eucharist. Alternatively, playing Sacrifice Rooms and {{Machine

item}}
"," - (Added in Repentance) Bosses with set drops aside from Mom will still drop their normal item, but at the cost of one Heart Container.
 - (Added in Repentance) On XL floors, both items will become Devil Deals, even if Satanic Bible was only used once.
 - (Added in Repentance) The Lost, Tainted Lost, and Tainted Jacob in his ghost form can safely take any Boss Room item pedestals and it has no effect on subsequent devil deals.
  - This also applies to the Lost form granted by the white fire on Downpour / Dross II. Taking a deal in this form will not remove hearts, making the player able to get at least 2 Devil Room items for free on that floor.

Devil Room item pool for purposes other than direct boss rewards as well. This works even if the boss does not normally drop items, such as Mom, Satan, or ???.
  - Rerolls such as The D6, Rune of Perthro, or Soul of Isaac will generate Devil Room items.
  - Using Satanic Bible ''after'' the Boss Room item has spawned, followed by any reroll, causes the new item to be drawn from the Devil Room item pool, but it will have no heart cost. Taking this item will not prevent Angel Rooms from spawning.{{dlc-}}

item}}

column1: Tech.5,I244,It's still being tested...,"Isaac occasionally fires an unlimited range [[piercing tears
column2: piercing]] laser alongside his normal tears. The laser can glitch, mimicking the effects of certain items and trinkets.",3,Technology .5," - Grants an unlimited range piercing tears
column3:
piercing laser with random rate of fire that does not replace tears.
 - The laser has a 1/6 chance to fire every ~0.07 seconds (4 frames), firing at an average rate of 2.5 times per second.
 - The laser occasionally fires with the effect of a random item or trinket, including:
  - Hook Worm
  - Spoon Bender
  - Tiny Planet
  - (Added in Afterbirth) Mysterious Liquid
  - (Added in Afterbirth) Rubber Cement
  - Brain Worm
"," - The damage of the laser scales directly with Isaac's damage.
 - Unlike Technology or Technology 2, Isaac can still fire tears from both eyes in addition to firing the laser.
 - The laser can be fired independently from tears by slightly tilting the right analog stick, just like shooting familiars.
 - {{Dlc
column4:
r}} Unlike Technology, Tech.5 Lasers do not have momentum, and fire exclusively in the cardinal directions unless Isaac has an item like Analog Stick, Eye of the Occult or Marked.
",True

tear effects]]. Each tear shot by Isaac increases item charge by one.",0,Isaac's Tears," - Each tear shot by the player increases item charge by one.

tear effects.

column1: The Negative,I328,Fate chosen,"If Isaac has half a red heart or no red hearts after taking damage, all enemies in the room take significant damage. Allows entrance into the {{s

Home}}.",2,The Negative," - If the character has half a red heart or no red hearts after taking damage, it triggers The Necronomicon effect, damaging all enemies in the room.
 - Allows entrance into the Dark Room after beating Satan in Sheol by touching the chest.
 - (Added in Repentance) +1 damage.
 - (Added in Repentance) Opens A Strange Door
column5:
n in Depths II and its variants that leads to Mausoleum/Gehenna II.
  - Unlike with the Dark Room entrance, The Negative gets consumed by the door and vanishes from Isaac's inventory.
"," - This item is a guaranteed drop from Mom, if unlocked. Will drop alongside The Polaroid, provided they are both unlocked. However, they are mutually exclusive: Once one of them is picked up, the other one will disappear.
  - With the use of a teleportation item and either a 5 pip Dice Room or a Forget Me Now, or R Key, both The Polaroid and The Negative or multiple copies of The Polaroid or The Negative can be obtained.
  - With (Added in Repentance)Jacob and Esau, proper alignment of both characters can enable picking up both The Polaroid and The Negative.
 - The Negative always triggers when taking damage as characters who lack heart containers, such as Azazel and Tainted Azazel (by default), ??? and Tainted ??? (permanently), (Added in Repentance)Dark Judas and Tainted Judas (permanently) The Forgotten (only as the soul), Tainted Forgotten (permanently), Dead Tainted Lazarus(by default), Tainted Bethany (permanently) or any other character who has chosen to trade away their heart containers in Devil Room
column6:
deals with the Devil, Black Markets, or with Guppy's Paw or Potato Peeler. It will also trigger if the character has only half of a red heart left.
 - The Negative will be the rightmost item after defeating Mom, in case {{cu
column7:
blind}} is active.
 - (Removed in Repentance) It is possible to obtain two Negatives by obtaining one as an Eden starting item.
 - Obtaining multiple copies of The Negative does not cause its effect to stack.
 - As with all items crucial to story progress (Key Piece 1 and Key Piece 2, Knife Piece 1 and Knife Piece 2, Dad's Note, and Dogma), this item has protection from full-run rerolls. It does not, however, share the immunity Dad's Note has to D6-type rerolls and Void.
",True

 - (Added in Repentance) +0.5 fire rate.
 - The head orbital deals 7 damage per tick or 105 damage per second ((Added in Repentance) 56 damage per second).
"," - (Added in Repentance) Isaac's body will spew a fountain of blood like a Gusher. This is purely cosmetic.
 - While Isaac's actual hitbox (his body) does not change, the position of the head can easily confuse the player on the body's exact position, making some tasks such as dodging tight bullet hell patterns or collecting pickups more difficult.
 - Items that apply contact damage and effects (The Virus, Aries, etc.) do not apply to the head.
 - The head orbital ignores the normal three orbital cap used by items such as Cube of Meat and Sacrificial Dagger.
 - The orbital is larger than most other orbitals, making it easier to use both offensively and defensively.
  - Despite changing size with Isaac, the orbital's hitbox does not change, which can be deceptive.
 - Using this item while near a wall may cause the head to go inside the wall while rotating and block tears shot.
",True

column1: The Soul,I335,I am all,Grants two {{E
column2:
Soul Heart}}s. Isaac gains a pulsing aura that repels enemies and projectiles.,3,The Soul," - Grants two Soul Hearts.
 - Isaac gains a pulsing blue aura that repels enemies and projectiles.
  - The power of the repel force alternates in strength at random, sometimes strong enough to counter a projectile well before it hits Isaac, sometimes only strong enough to slow it down.
  - Ground-based enemies will overcome the counterforce easier than flying enemies and projectiles.
"," - (Added in Repentance) A stronger effect of this item is given temporarily by I - The Magician?
column3:
x.
 - (Added in Repentance) When playing as Tainted Forgotten, this item works only on the Forgotten's body and not the soul.
 - (Added in Repentance) When playing as Tainted Jacob, Dark Esau is unaffected by this item's repelling properties.
",True

column1: The Mind,I333,I know all,"Reveals the entire map, including all special rooms and {{R
column2: Secret Room}}s.",3,The Mind," - Grants the combined effects of the Blue Map, Treasure Map, and The Compass, revealing the floor layout and all special rooms, including Secret Rooms and Super Secret Rooms.

column1:
== Synergies ==
 - (Added in Repentance) Book of Secrets: Immediately gives the X-Ray Vision effect for the floor upon use.
",,True

column1:
???'s Only Friend,I320,Controlled friend,Spawns a controllable [[familiar]] that deals 37.5 damage per second on touch. It can be moved using the shooting directional keys,2,???'s Only Friend," - Spawns a controllable familiar that damages enemies on touch. It can be moved using the shooting directional keys, similarly to The Ludovico Technique and Robo-Baby 2.0.
  - (Removed in Repentance) ???'s Only Friend deals 2.5 damage per tick, and ticks 15 times a second, dealing a total of 37.5 damage per second.
   - (Added in Repentance) ???'s Only Friend deals 3.5 damage per tick, and ticks slower.
 - {{transf
column3:
item}}
"," - Unlike The Ludovico Technique, it cannot be controlled with the mouse, even with mouse control enabled.
 - Holding two opposite fire keys (both left and right or both up and down) at the same time will keep the familiar in place, while making Isaac fire in the direction of whichever fire key was pressed second.
  - This can help during combats with bosses who do not move a lot, as the familiar can continuously damage the boss when kept stationary.
  - On some keyboards, holding opposite fire keys may cause other keys to become unresponsive.
",True

column1:
D4,I284,Reroll into something else,Rerolls all of Isaac's [[passive item]]s.,3,The D4," - Upon use, re-rolls each of Isaac's passive items into new ones.
  - (Removed in Afterbirth+) The new items will be drawn from the Treasure Room (Item Pool)
column2:
Treasure Room item pool.
  - (Added in Afterbirth+) The game attempts to match the new item to the pool where the item it replaces was acquired but this is glitched, see the Bugs section.
   - {{dlc+
column3:
r}} If health upgrade items are removed by a reroll the health they granted is subtracted.
    - Tainted Isaac can avoid this health subtraction by dropping health items for full inventory before rerolling.{{dlc-}}
"," - (Removed in Repentance) Items rerolled away from Isaac do ''not'' return to circulation and can't be encountered again.
  - (Added in Repentance) Items rerolled away are returned to circulation and can be encountered again later in the run.
 - The D4 does not re-roll Dead Cat
column4: nr, Halo of Flies
column5:
nr, Key Piece 1, Key Piece 2, Missing No., The Negative, The Polaroid, or Tonsil.
  - {{dlc+
column6:
r}} The D4 can reroll Dead Cat and Halo of Flies, but will not reroll Dad's Note, Damocles, Dogma, Knife Piece 1 and Knife Piece 2, in addition to the above.{{dlc-}}
 - The D4 does not remove traits or abilities inherent to a character, i.e. Azazel's Brimstone-like attack, Lilith's Incubus or The Forgotten's Bone club.
  - Starting items from Challenges will also not be rerolled
 - Items that grant pickups (like Pyro or A Dollar) do not remove their bonuses when rerolled.
 - (Removed in Repentance) The D4 does not remove gained hearts from health up items.
 - {{Dlc
column7:
r}} The D4 does not give hearts that would be otherwise gained from item pickups.
 - (Removed in Repentance) If Isaac has a transformation, its effects will not be lost upon re-rolling.
  - (Added in Repentance) Transformations are removed with the items being rerolled.
 - The D4 can grant items that have not yet been unlocked.
 - The items gained by the D4 count towards the collection page.
 - (Added in Afterbirth, Removed in Repentance) If it is unlocked, The Lost starts with this item along with spectral tears and flight. Using it ''will'' reroll Holy Mantle.
  - {{Dlc
column8:
r}} The Lost no longer starts with the D4. If used however, it will no longer reroll their Holy Mantle.
 - (Removed in Repentance) Every Cube of Meat produced using Potato Peeler count as an item for rerolling to the D4. Because health usually is not removed in rerolling items this is useful to increase the number of items at the expense of the item pool.
 - Multiple copies of the same item (as generated by Diplopia, the Debug Console, or gathering them from multiple item pools (e.g. Steam Sale from both the Shop and Greed) will each be rerolled into a different item, (Removed in Repentance) even though the duplicates are not present on the pause screen.
 - There is a small chance that D4 will not reroll every item: the game makes a number of attempts to reroll each item, but if they all fail to produce a new item that is available and applicable, the original remains unchanged.
 - (Added in Repentance) If used while playing as Jacob and Esau or Tainted Lazarus, it will only reroll the items on the character that used it.
 - Smelted/Swallowed trinkets (via Marbles, Smelter or Gulp!) will not be rerolled.
",True

column1:
Mongo Baby,I322,Mongo friend,Spawns a [[familiar]] that copies the tears of Isaac's other familiars.,2,," - Spawns a familiar that cycles between the tears of Isaac's other familiars.
  - If no familiars are present, Mongo Baby will fire normal tears that deal 3.5 damage.
  - (Removed in Repentance) Mongo Baby shoots once every half second.
  - (Added in Repentance) Mongo Baby shoots once every 1/3rd of a second, shooting at the same speed as Isaac at base tears.
 - {{transf
column3:
item}}
"," - Familiar
column4:
Familiars that Mongo Baby can copy include:
  - Brother Bobby
  - Ghost Baby
  - Harlequin Baby
  - Little Gish
  - Little Steven
  - Rainbow Baby
  - Robo-Baby
  - Rotten Baby
  - Sister Maggy
  - demon baby
  - Freezer Baby
 - Mongo Baby will not copy the tear effects of trinket familiars (Isaac's Head and ???'s Soul).
 - Mongo Baby will not copy the tear effects of the level 2 Cube of Meat or Ball of Bandages.
 - Mongo Baby will not copy the tear effects of Buddy in a Box, Fate's Reward, Incubus,Lil Monstro or Seraphim.
 - With Lil Loki, Mongo Baby's tears will become red, but Mongo Baby will not fire in four directions.
 - If Isaac has Demon Baby alongside other familiars, Mongo Baby's behavior switches between the two. When Isaac is firing tears, Mongo Baby fires alongside him with a reduced fire rate. When Isaac is not firing tears, Mongo Baby copies Demon Baby's effect and automatically fires at nearby enemies.
  - If Isaac only has Demon Baby and Mongo Baby, Mongo Baby behaves like the Demon Baby exclusively.
 - Mongo Baby will not copy familiars spawned by Monster Manual.
",True

column1:
Crack the Sky,I160,Holy white death,"Summons 5 beams of light in random locations on the ground, dealing large amounts of damage to any enemies that touch them.",2,," - Summons 5 beams of light in random locations on the ground. Each beam lasts for 0.8 seconds and deals large amounts of damage to enemies that touch them. They have a hitbox in a 3x3 cross shape.
  - Each beam can hit the same enemy up to 8 times, and deals Isaac's tear damage plus a flat 20 damage per hit.
 - {{dlc
column2:
na}} The beams tend to gravitate towards the enemies, unlike the original game.
  - (Added in Afterbirth) The beams have a high chance to directly target enemies, unlike the original game.
",,True

Blended Hearts either replenish two Red Hearts or replenish one Red Heart and add one Soul Heart, depending on how many empty Red Heart Containers Isaac has.

 - Does not affect Rotten Hearts.

column1: Isaac's Heart,I276,Protect it,"Isaac himself is now immune to all damage, and a heart [[familiar]] follows him. If the heart is hurt, Isaac is hurt. {{dlc
column2:
r}} The heart charges up as Isaac shoots, firing 8 blood shots, knocking back enemies, and leaving a puddle of [[creep]] when released.",0,Isaac's Heart," - Isaac's body becomes immune to all damage.
 - A heart familiar appears and closely follows Isaac. If the heart is hurt, Isaac is hurt.
 - (Added in Repentance) The heart tries to position itself in the opposite direction of where Isaac is shooting.
 - (Added in Repentance) The heart charges up as Isaac fires. At full charge, upon releasing the fire button, it knocks back nearby enemies and tears, creates a small puddle of red creep on the ground, and releases blood shots in 8 directions that deal 8 damage.
 - (Added in Repentance) Enemies that come in contact with Isaac take 2x Isaac's current damage per tick or 4x Isaac's damage per second.
 - (Removed in Repentance) Most enemies now target the heart instead of Isaac. Eyes and other similar enemies, however, will still target Isaac.
"," - (Removed in Repentance) Blood Donation Machines and Devil Beggars can be used for free.
  - During {{chal
column3:
The Guardian}}, Devil Beggars and Blood Donation Machines deal damage to Isaac.
 - Spikes, Curse Room doors and Spiked Chests do no damage. Sacrifice Room spikes still work, though the heart has to go on the spikes instead of Isaac. The door to {{Stage
column4: Mausoleum}} / {{Stage
column5:
Gehenna}} is not affected.
 - Picking up a non-orbital familiar will cause either Isaac's Heart or the other familiar to be layered over the other's sprite. This is due to the heart not taking up the spot that the other familiar follows in.
 - Co-op babies gain the immunity effect without spawning additional hearts.
 - {{dlc
column6:
na}} Enemy Brimstone shots (such as from The Bloat) will not do any damage to the heart.
 - The tracking lasers from Hush and light pillars from Isaac do not damage the heart.
",True

column1: Scissors,I325,Lose your head,Turns Isaac's head into a stationary [[familiar]] for the current [[room]] which fires tears automatically. {{dlc
column2:
r}} Isaac's body also shoots a controllable fountain of blood shots for the room.,1,The Scissors," - Detaches Isaac's head from his body and turns the head into a stationary familiar that fires tears for the current room.
  - The player still controls Isaac's headless body, which also shoots tears.
   - (Added in Repentance) The body constantly spews a controllable fountain of blood shots, dealing about 0.66x-1.01x damage.
  - (Removed in Repentance) The tears fired by the head do not scale with Isaac's damage and always do 3.5 damage.
   - (Added in Repentance) The head's tears are affected by Isaac's stats and attack modifiers.
"," - Can spawn multiple heads if used in the same room more than once.
  - (Added in Repentance) Only the most recent head is able to fire.
 - {{Dlc
column3:
nr}} Brimstone and Technology are not fired from the stationary head.
 - If Isaac has an invisible body due to the cosmetic effect of Transcendence, only a shadow will be seen after using the Scissors.
 - If Isaac is Blindfolded, the floating head can still fire tears.
 - (Added in Repentance) The floating head does nothing as Lilith, Tainted Lilith, and Tainted Forgotten.
  - As The Forgotten, the floating head will only fire tears when the Soul is active.
  - The floating head will not fire tears as Tainted Samson while he is enraged.
 - (Added in Afterbirth, Removed in Repentance) Each wave of Boss Rush fully recharges the item, allowing many heads to be spawned.
 - Only deaths which end runs (i.e. Isaac is not revived by a revival item such as 1up!) count towards unlocking the Scissors.
",True

column1: Stop Watch,I232,Let's slow this down a bit...,"{{dlc
column2:
na}} Automatically inflicts [[slow]] to all enemies in every room.
{{dlc
column3:
anr}} Upon taking damage, inflicts slow to all enemies for the current room.
{{dlc
column4: r}} Slows all enemies in every room to 80% speed.",4,Stop Watch," - {{dlc
column5:
na}} Automatically inflicts slow to all enemies in every room, which slows them down to approximately 51.3% of their original movement and attacking speeds.
 - (Added in Afterbirth, Removed in Repentance) Inflicts slow to all enemies in the current room after the player is hit.
 - (Added in Repentance) Slows all enemies to 80% of their original movement speed and attacking speeds. This is separate from the slow status, and fully stacks with it.
 - +0.3 speed.
"," - {{dlc
column6:
nar}} Once activated, the effect lasts permanently.
 - (Removed in Repentance) The background music is slowed down to 70% of the original speed of the music during the item's effect.
  - (Added in Repentance) The background music is slowed down to about 90% of the original speed, not affecting boss tracks. The slowdown makes the music approximately 2 semitones lower.
  - If acquired through Eden's Blessing,the starting track will be affected as well
 - The Broken Watch is an item similar to this item, but functions in a different way.
 - (Removed in Repentance)Because of the slow effect, champion versions of enemies will be tinted the same color as all other enemies. This makes it much harder to distinguish certain champion types, such as those that explode upon death.
 - Poky
column7:
display=Pokies, Slides and Mega Troll Bombs are not affected and will move in their regular speed.
 - {{dlc
column8:
na}} Stop Watch is a special item.
",True

column1:
Missing No.,I258,Syntax error,Randomizes all passive items and stats upon pickup and at the start of each succeeding floor.,1,Missing No.," - Randomizes passive items and attributes on pickup and at the start of every floor.
  - Stats gain a random modifier. These modifiers do not stack between levels and are instead rerolled every time.
   - Speed -0.2, 0 or +0.2.
    - (Removed in Repentance) Also affects maximum speed, may never exceed 2.0.
   - (Removed in Repentance) Range -0.5, 0 or +0.5.
   - (Added in Repentance) Range -1.5, 0 or +1.5.
   - (Removed in Repentance) Tears -0.5, 0 or +0.5.
   - (Added in Repentance) Fire rate -0.5, 0 or +0.5.
   - Shot speed -0.2, 0 or +0.2.
   - Damage flat -1, 0 or +1.
   - Luck -1, 0 or +1.
  - Does not affect trinkets, cards, pills, Pretty Fly
column2:
Pretty Flies, The Polaroid / The Negative, Key Piece 1 / Key Piece 2, Knife Piece 1 / Knife Piece 2, or active items.
"," - See D4 for more details of the rerolling process.
 - Like other full-reroll effects, Missing No. has a small chance to not reroll every item.
 - (Removed in Repentance) Can cause transformations.
  - (Added in Repentance) Transformations are lost when rerolling out of the items that caused them.
 - Missing No. cannot be re-rolled or removed by most means after being picked up, including D4, Clicker, XVII - The Stars?, or taking damage as Tainted Eden.
",True

column1: Mystery Sack,I271,?,"Spawns a [[familiar]] that drops a [[Heart]], [[coin]], {{E
column3:
key}} every 5-6 [[rooms]].",2,Mystery Sack," - Spawns a familiar that drops a Heart, coin, bomb, or key (or any of their variations) alternatingly every 5 or 6 rooms.
",,True

column1: The Polaroid,I327,Fate chosen,"If Isaac has half a red heart or no red hearts after taking damage, he gains a [[shield]] that nullifies all types of damage for 5 seconds. Allows entrance into {{s
column3: r}} Also allows access to {{s
column4:
Home}}.",2,The Polaroid," - If the character has half a red heart or no red hearts after taking damage, it triggers the Book of Shadows effect, creating a shield that nullifies all types of damage for 5 seconds.
 - Allows entrance into Chest after beating Isaac in the Cathedral by touching the chest.
 - (Added in Repentance) Opens A Strange Door
column5:
n in Depths II and its variants that leads to Mausoleum/Gehenna II.
  - Unlike with the Chest entrance, The Polaroid gets consumed by the door and vanishes from Isaac's inventory.
"," - This item is a guaranteed drop from Mom, if unlocked. Will drop alongside The Negative, provided they are both unlocked. However, they are mutually exclusive: Once one of them is picked up, the other one will disappear.
  - With the use of either a teleportation item and 5 pip Dice Room, a Forget Me Now, or R Key, both the Polaroid and the Negative or multiple copies of the Polaroid or Negative can be obtained.
 - The Polaroid always triggers when taking damage as characters who lack Red Heart containers, such as ??? and Tainted ??? (Added in Repentance)Dark Judas and Tainted Judas, The Forgotten (only as the soul), Tainted Forgotten , Tainted Bethany or any other character who has chosen to trade away their heart containers in Devil room
column6:
deals with the Devil, Black Markets,Guppy's Paw or the Potato Peeler. It will also trigger if the character has only half of a red heart left.
 - Since The Lost and Tainted Lost donâ€™t have health, The Polaroid will never trigger.
 - The Polaroid will be the leftmost item after defeating Mom, in case {{Cu
column7:
Blind}} is active.
 - (Removed in Repentance) It is possible to obtain two Polaroids by obtaining one as an Eden starting item.
 - Obtaining multiple copies of The Polaroid does not cause its effect to stack.
 - As with all items crucial to story progress (Key Piece 1 and Key Piece 2, Knife Piece 1 and Knife Piece 2, Dad's Note, and Dogma), this item has protection from full-run rerolls. It does not, however, share the immunity Dad's Note has to D6-type rerolls and Void.
",True

column1:
Little Steven,I100,Psychic friend,Spawns a [[familiar]] who follows Isaac around and fires [[homing tears]].,1,Little Steven, - Spawns a familiar who follows Isaac around and fires homing tears that do 3.5 damage.
  - (Removed in Repentance) Little Steven shoots once per second.
  - (Added in Repentance) Little Steven shoots once every 3/4ths of a second.
 - {{transf
column3:
item}}
,,True

column1: Sacrificial Dagger,I172,My fate protects me,"Spawns a dagger [[orbital familiar]], blocking enemy shots and dealing a high amount of damage to enemies in contact.",2,Sacrificial Dagger," - Gives Isaac a sideways dagger that orbital familiar
column2:
orbits him, dealing high damage to enemies on contact and blocking enemy shots.
  - (Removed in Repentance) The knife deals 15 damage every 1/15th of a second (every 4 frames) or 225 damage per second.
  - (Added in Repentance) The knife deals 15 damage every 2/15ths of a second (every 8 frames) or 112.5 damage per second.
"," - The dagger orbits further away from Isaac than many other orbital familiars (minus Big Fan), making it easier to use both offensively and defensively.
",True

column1: Friendly Ball,I382,Gotta fetch 'em all!,"Throwing the ball at a [[monster]] instantly kills and captures it. The captured enemy can later be released and will be [[friendly]], fighting for Isaac and persisting between rooms.",2,," - Once thrown, the Friendly Ball will instantly capture any monster
column2:
non-boss enemy it hits, removing them from the room.
 - (Added in Repentance) Walking over a Friendly Ball after it captures an enemy will instantly recharge the item.
 - The next time the Friendly Ball is thrown, it will release the previously captured enemy as a friendly enemy.
  - Released enemies persist between rooms and floors and will follow Isaac until they die.
  - Friendly enemies cannot harm Isaac and do not need to be defeated to clear a room.
  - If Isaac leaves the room before the monster is released, the monster will stay in the ball until it is thrown again.
 - If the Friendly Ball does not capture an enemy, it will simply disappear after a couple seconds being on the ground. The next throw will work the same.
"," - All enemies that aren't invincible and are not designated as a boss or mini-boss can be captured by the Friendly Ball. This includes enemies summoned from bosses such as Brownie's spawned Dips or The Cage's unique Vises.
  - One exception to this is if you capture a Portal, as it can spawn enemies such as Death's Head.
 - It is generally wasteful to use this item on Mulligans and their variants as they will immediately rush towards enemies and try to kill themselves, leaving behind friendly debris.
 - If the captured enemy is a Globin variant (besides Black Globins for their lack of regenerative abilities) or a Champion
column3:
Dark Red Champion, the enemy will regenerate after dying, granting a much longer lifespan.
 - Wall Creeps and their variants stick to walls, backing far away from any potential danger they might encounter.
 - Stationary enemies that move underground (such as Round Worms or Lumps) work surprisingly well as an ally as they shoot foes from far away and rarely ever get hurt.
 - Mom's Hand and Mom's Dead Hand will both one-shot almost all normal enemies and greatly damage most bosses with an incredibly small window for the hands to be hit, making them ideal for capturing.
 - Brimstone-capable enemies are very potent as their lasers can cause an obscene amount of damage to both enemies and most bosses.
 - If the captured enemy is one that spawns enemies, those enemies will be friendly as well.
 - If the ally is immune to damage (such as a Mobile Host while its head is lowered), it will not take contact damage.
 - If the captured enemy is a Champion
column4:
Solid White Champion, it will be completely invincible, as it cannot be killed until the room counts as being cleared, at which point it can be killed by spikes or a Wall Hugger.
 - (Added in Afterbirth+) If the captured enemy is a Champion
column5:
Pulsing Red Champion, it will regenerate the health of other monsters in the room, including friendly ones.
 - (Removed in Afterbirth+) If an enemy that leaves behind a trail of damaging creep is caught, the creep created by the friendly mob will still damage Isaac when he walks over it.
  - (Added in Afterbirth+) All creep created by a friendly enemy will only hurt grounded enemies and not the player.
 - The ball will only capture one segment of a Grub, one Buttlicker, or one Swarm
column6:
display=Swarm Fly. However, when releasing a Swarm Fly, a new swarm is generated for it.
 - If a Mask + Heart's Heart is caught and then released, a Mask can use the friendly heart to live even if its original heart is destroyed. The room will not be cleared unless the Mask is killed.
  - The mask will ignore the friendly heart yet can still damage it. Bait the mask to charge towards the heart to destroy both.
 - If an Ipecac-capable enemy is caught, the explosive Ipecac shots it fires will not hurt Isaac.
  - This explosion immunity also applies to enemies that explode on death, and even the Troll Bombs left behind by Mulligoons.
 - The head of Rag Man can be captured by the ball while detached. It will not become a Ragling after being released, and only chases enemies by rolling.
 - (Added in Repentance) Captured Bishop
column7:
ns will protect Isaac with their shield generation ability, as well as all other friendly enemies. Isaac cannot take any damage while the Bishop is alive, as it will protect him with the shield. Protecting the Bishop can be a powerful defensive tool, especially when playing as The Lost.
  - The shield does not protect against instant death effects such as Suicide King or Plan C
column8:
x.
 - (Added in Repentance) Captured Cultist
column9:
ns will revive killed enemies as friendlies, allowing one to slowly amass an army of friendlies by protecting the Cultist.
  - Bosses and degraded bosses can be revived by a friendly Cultist, but will not persist between rooms.
",True

column1:
Continuum,I369,Transcendent tears,Grants [[spectral tears]] and increases [[range]]. Tears travel through walls and appear at the opposite side of the room.,2,," - Grants spectral tears.
 - When tears travel off-screen, they loop back around through the opposite wall.
 - (Removed in Repentance) +2.25 range.
 - (Added in Repentance) +3 range.
 - (Removed in Repentance) +1.5 tear falling speed.
",,True

Dead Eye,I373,Accuracy brings power!,Isaac's [[damage]] increases each time an enemy is hit. Damage is reset upon missing a shot.,3,," - Isaac's damage increases for each successive tear hit on enemies.
  - The multiplier increases by 0.25x for each hit, going up to a maximum of 2x after 4 successive hits.
  - If a tear misses and hits nothing (wall/floor), there is a chance for the multiplier to be reset back to 1.
   - The chance is 20% for the first miss, 33% for the second miss, and 50% for the third miss and beyond.
  - As the multiplier increases, Isaac's tears glow red and increase in size.
"," - The effect is triggered by many entities aside from enemies. Shooting {{Dlc
column2:
nr}} Fire Places, Wall Huggers, and Stone Grimaces will count towards the multiplier. This can be used to preemptively increase damage before entering a new room.
  - {{Dlc
column3:
nr}} Because blue fires do not deteriorate when shot at with tears, maximum damage can always be achieved as long as the fire is not destroyed by an explosion.
  - Shooting poop will count as a miss.
  - Shooting Hosts will increase the damage multiplier even if their skull is lowered down.
 - If Dead Eye is removed by re-rolling it with D4, D100, or a 1 or 6 pip Dice Room, the damage multiplier will be removed, but the tears will continue to glow red.
 - Tears do not have to be landed on only one enemy to build the multiplier; as long as they do not miss, Isaac gains damage.
 - If Isaac is shooting multiple tears at once, like with Mutant Spider, only one of them has to land for the multiplier to build up.
 - (Added in Repentance) Because there are no walls or floors for tears to collide with in the fight with The Beast
column4:
n, the damage boost will not fade away.
 - Due to the natural Brimstone effect of Azazel, he gains no benefit by picking up Deadeye unless his tear effect has been replaced.
",True

column1: More Options,I414,There's options,Two item pedestels are presented in every {{r
column2:
Treasure Room}}. Only one can be taken; the other will disappear.,3,There's Options, - Two item pedestals are presented in every Treasure Room. Only one can be taken; the other will disappear.
," - (Removed in Repentance) Small Treasure Rooms only present one item, nullifying this item's effect.
 - If the Treasure Room has already been entered and the item was not taken, then picking up More Options later on the same floor will not retroactively add a second item to the room.
 - The very rare Treasure Rooms that have either no item or two items that can ''both'' be picked up will be replaced with a one-out-of-two choice room, like other Treasure Rooms. In the latter case, this is a downgrade.
 - (Added in Repentance) In Downpour / Dross / Mines / Ashpit / Mausoleum / Gehenna, Treasure Rooms will have two known items and one unknown item, instead of the usual one known and one unknown.
 - (Added in Repentance) In Downpour
column4: / Dross
column6:
, The Mirrored world's treasure room will '''not''' contain a second item.
 - More Options will work for Treasure Rooms during the Ascent as long as those rooms were never originally entered.
",True

column1: Sack Head,I424,More sacks!,"{{E
column3: display=Coin}}s, {{E
column4: bomb}}s, {{E
column5: key}}s, cards, runes and batteries have a chance to become {{E
column6: grab bag
column7: n}}s.",3,," - Penny
column8: display=Coins have a 10% chance to be replaced with Grab Bags. Bombs, Keys, Cards, Runes, and Lil' Battery
column9:
display=Lil' Batteries have a 20% chance.
  - This includes pickups spawned by most sources: room rewards, chests, slot machines, special shopkeepers, etc.
  - (Added in Repentance) Coins bombed out of a Donation Machine can become sacks.
  - The exception to this are pickups spawned by Isaac himself directly, e.g. with the likes of IV Bag or Fanny Pack, and contents of other sacks.
 - Spawns a sack upon pickup.
"," - The item does not replace hearts, pills and chests.
 - The item can also replace Troll Bombs and Mega troll Bombs that are not used as attacks, i.e. generated as room rewards, chest contents and such.
 - The pickup replacement is applied retroactively when the item is collected: any appropriate pickup already existing on the current level may be replaced by a sack.
 - (Removed in Afterbirth+) Sacks on each floor tend to have the same contents, which can be taken advantage of if cards are involved.
 - (Added in Repentance) Picking up a Golden Penny
column10:
n may spawn a sack instead of another Golden Penny.
 - Cracked Key in the Ascent can be replaced by a sack, thus it is not recommended to take the item if you're going to unlock a tainted character.
",True

column1:
Fruit Cake,I418,Rainbow effects!,Isaac's tears gain a random effect that changes every shot.,2,," - The following tear effects when generated by Fruit Cake work differently than that of the base item:
  - Eye of Greed: Isaac will not lose coins from this effect occurring.
  - Ipecac: There is no associated damage up/poison effect/arcing.
  - My Reflection: There is no associated shot speed up.
  - Polyphemus: Only the ability to pierce enemies on overkill damage is applied; there is no associated damage bonus with the tear.
  - Proptosis
column2:
nr : There is no associated damage multiplier, effectively decreasing damage dealt.
  - Serpent's Kiss
column3:
r: This keeps the internal tear tag that makes enemies drop Black Hearts, despite the item itself losing this ability.
  - Tiny Planet: There is no associated range up.
 - (Added in Repentance) The unique tear effects available to some Wisps.xml
column4: wisps made by Book of Virtues
column5:
n can also be used by Fruit Cake. This can include:
  - Drop hearts/coins/cards/runes on kill. The tear must deal the final hit; earlier hits do not flag enemies to drop the consumable on death.
  - Teleport enemies to a random location in the room. This cannot affect Bosses.
  - Transform enemies into poop (similarly to E. Coli).
  - Transform enemies into random wisps.

column1: Tear effects used in the pool of Fruit Cake do not need their base items unlocked in order to be used. This means that Fruit Cake can occasionally give previews of synergies that are locked.
<!-- The list of tear effects was taken from the wisps.xml document and from testing; effects 28, 29, 35, 36, 45, and 72 are used by bombs instead of tears, and effects past 83 weren't listed. -->

== Synergies ==
 - Brimstone: Each tick of brimstone has a random effect.
 - Dr. Fetus: Bombs pull their effects from bomb modifiers (Bobby-Bomb, Bob's Curse, Bomber Boy, Butt Bombs, Glitter Bombs, Hot Bombs, Mr. Mega, Sad Bombs, Scatter Bombs, Sticky Bombs) as well as tear effects.
 - Finger!/Technology 2: Each tick of the laser has a random effect, allowing it to rapidly afflict enemies with multiple status effects.
  - This also includes the Sulfuric Acid effect to destroy rocks and enter secret rooms.
 - Isaac's Tears/Tammy's Head/Tear Detonator: Each tear will have its own tear effect.
 - The Ludovico Technique: The tear will cycle through different effects, based on Isaac's tear rate.
  - (Added in Afterbirth+, Removed in Repentance) If Isaac stays in one room long enough the Ludovico tear will often fill the room with many stationary Trisagion tears that last until Isaac leaves the room. This combination can easily clear most rooms.
 - Mom's Knife: The benefits of fruit cake still occur but are short lived due to the high damage of Mom's knife.
",,True

Incubus,I360,Dark friend,"Spawns a demonic [[familiar]] that shoots tears identical to Isaac's in terms of [[damage]], [[tears]], and [[tear effect]]s.",4,Incubus, - Spawns a demonic familiar that copies Isaac's tears.
  - {{Dlc

nr}} Incubus' tears ignores Isaac's range and shot speed.
  - (Added in Repentance) Incubus' damage is reduced by 25% when playing as characters other than Lilith and Tainted Lilith.
," - Lilith's starting Incubus is technically not a collected item but an intrinsic part of the character, and is removed if an item such as Ankh or Clicker are used to become a different character. As such, playing as Lilith will not add Incubus to the collection page, nor does her personal Incubus count towards the {{transf
column3:
Conjoined}} transformation.
 - Incubus is one of the familiars that can be spawned by Cambion Conception.
 - (Added in Repentance) Incubus has the second highest priority of following familiars, below King Baby
column4:
n.
 - {{dlc+
column5: r}}{{transf
column6: Conjoined
column7:
item}}{{dlc-}}
",True

column1:
Diplopia,I347,Double item vision,Duplicates all pickups and item pedestals in the room.,3,," - Duplicates all pickups and pedestal items in the current room, then disappears.
"," - (Removed in Repentance) Using Diplopia on a trinket will spawn another random trinket instead of duplicating the trinket.
  - (Added in Repentance) Using Diplopia on a trinket does nothing.
 - (Added in Repentance) Does not duplicate Rune of Jera.
 - (Removed in Afterbirth+) Using Diplopia on an empty item pedestal will spawn another random item.
 - If used in a Shop, the duplicated pickups and items can be taken for free.
 - (Removed in Repentance) If used in the Boss Rush room, all available items will be duplicated and all the duplicates can be taken ('''this will still start the Boss Rush'''); however, only one of the original items may be taken. Taking one of the original items does not cause the duplicates to disappear.
  - (Added in Repentance) Only one duplicate can be taken.
 - (Removed in Repentance) If used on the The Polaroid and The Negative after defeating Mom, the duplicates can be taken without affecting the originals.
  - (Added in Repentance) Only one duplicate can be taken.
 - If an item pedestal that is duplicated is visible as ""?"" (for example with the {{cu
column2:
Blind}}), duplicate will be visible as ""?"" until taken, just like the original item pedestal.
 - (Added in Repentance) If used in a Treasure Room on the alternate path, only one duplicate can be taken. However, this allows Isaac to essentially take both items.
 - If used in a Devil Room or the Black Market, the duplicated items can be taken for free. The original items will still be offered at an HP price, and Deal with the Devil precedent will not be obtained.
 - (Removed in Repentance) If used in an Angel Room that has multiple item pedestals, the duplicated items can be taken for free. The original items will still behave as normal: once an item is chosen, the others will disappear.
  - (Added in Repentance) Only one duplicate can be taken.
 - (Removed in Repentance) Picking up multiple copies of items that can cause Isaac to transformation
column3:
transform will not count towards transformation progress.
  - (Added in Repentance) Multiple copies of the same item do count towards transformations.
 - Using Diplopia on another copy of Diplopia will not work.
 - Jacob and Esau can use this item to duplicate an active item to each have the same active item.
 - Tear-boosting items, if stacked, cap at shooting 16 tears at once.
",True

column1: Restock,I376,Never ending stores!,"Causes {{R
column2: Shop}}s to instantly restock their items when they are bought. {{dlc
column3:
r}} Outside of [[Greed Mode]], the restocked item's cost is increased after each purchase.",2,," - Upon purchasing an item from the Shop, a new purchasable item is added to the store's inventory.
  - Collectibles created correspond to the Shop (Item Pool)
column4:
shop's item pool.
 - (Removed in Repentance) Drops 3 random pickups around Isaac.
 - (Added in Repentance) Outside of Greed Mode, the restocked item's cost is increased after each purchase.
  - For items, the price increase is 2 coins times the number of purchases. For example, an item starting at 15 cents would next be +2 to 17, then +4 to 21, +6 to 27, etc. The cost follows the formula 15+n(n+1) with n being the number of times restock has triggered.
  - For everything else, the price increase is 1 coin times the number of purchases. For example, a heart starting at 3 cents would be +1 to 4, +2 to 6, +3 to 9 etc. This follows the formula (original price)+(n(n+1))/2
  - The increase is not affected by discounts occurring naturally or through Steam Sale: costs will increase at the same rate, though the base price is still discounted. Once the item's cost goes over what it would naturally be, the price is no longer highlighted red.
  - The maximum price is 99 cents.
 - A small restock icon appears under the map, just like Treasure Map, Blue Map, The Compass (Added in Repentance) and any active curses.
"," - (Removed in Repentance) If used with IV Bag/Blood Donation Machine and an item which can spawn additional coins (Counterfeit Penny, Swallowed Penny, Humbling Bundle, etc.), infinite money can be produced by buying hearts for 3 coins and getting more than 3 coins back after donating health.
 - Using a Credit Card in a Shop prevents Restock from working for that shop only.
  - A Shop Restock Machine will refresh the items, which Restock will interact with normally.
 - When purchasing Restock from a Shop, the slot that Restock was purchased from will not be restocked.
 - Restock does not affect Black Markets or purchasable items generated via A Pound of Flesh or The Stairway.
 - (Added in Afterbirth+) Purchasing an item that is on sale will replace it with another that is on sale.
",True

column1:
Little Horn,I404,,,,Something wicked this way comes!,," - The Gnawed Leaf can make the battle easier, as Little Horn will damage himself with his bombs over time. Isaac can still fall into the pits and be transported around the screen, and will ''appear'' to suffer damage, but no actual loss of HP will occur if he is in statue form when he falls in.
 - The Dark Balls that Little Horn spawns can appear in Closets in the {{Stage
column3: Flooded Caves}}. They also appear in a room with Little Horn in the {{Stage
column4:
Chest}}.
 - If Isaac has the Safety Scissors
column5:
n, he can acquire maximum bombs from the fight at fairly little risk since the bombs Little Horn spawns will turn into bomb pickups and all his hole attacks are easy to dodge.
 - Little Horn's Dark Ball is considered a monster. Killing it will activate items such as Charm of the Vampire, Infestation 2, and Jar of Flies
column6:
n.
 - Occasionally, a Pitfall that Little Horn summons will not vanish after defeating the boss. The Pitfall is still active and can damage Isaac, even if it does not actively chase the player.
",True

column1:
Crack Jacks,I354,HP up. Don't swallow the prize!,Grants one full [[Red Heart container]] and drops a random [[trinket]].,2,, - Grants one full Red Heart container.
  - {{Dlc

r}} Heals 1 additional red heart.
 - Spawns one random trinket.
,,True

column1:
The Wiz,I358,Double wiz shot!,"Tears simultaneously fire out of both eyes diagonally, similar to the effect of the [[R U a Wizard?]] pill. Isaac's tears also travel above all obstacles.",1,," - Isaac fires tears from both eyes at the same time.
 - Isaac's tears are fired diagonally outwards, similar to the effect of the R U a Wizard? pill.
 - Isaac's tears become Tear Effects
column2:
spectral.
"," - The maximum amount of tears per volley that can be reached by combining and/or duplicating 20/20, The Inner Eye, Mutant Spider and The Wiz is 16.
",True

column1:
Athame,I408,Call to the void,"When Isaac takes damage, a black ring briefly appears around him, dealing damage to all nearby enemies.",1,Athame," - When Isaac takes damage, a black ring briefly appears around him, dealing tear damage at a rapid rate to everything touching it.
  - (Removed in Repentance) When an enemy is killed with the black ring, there is a 15% chance for it to drop a Black Heart.
   - (Added in Repentance) Athame no longer has a chance to spawn black hearts upon killing enemies with the black ring.
  - (Removed in Repentance) Black Hearts will drop as soon as the enemy is killed. (In other words, the heart will drop at the beginning of the death animation rather than at the end of the death animation.)
", - The ring is similar in appearance to the combination of The Ludovico Technique and Brimstone.
 - It is identical to the ring created by Maw of the Void.
 - (Removed in Repentance) Especially effective against Envy and Super Envy. Each piece of Envy grants a 15% chance for a Black Heart. It is also effective against Brownie due to all the Brownie Corns it spawns.
,True

Kidney Bean,I421,Love toots!,"Isaac farts, [[charm]]ing all nearby enemies.",1,," - Upon use, Isaac farts, charming all nearby enemies.
  - (Removed in Repentance) The cloud deals 5 damage.
",,True
Epiphora,I368,Intensifying tears,"Shooting in one direction increases Isaac's [[Tear delay
column2:
rate of fire]] until the cap is reached. As soon as Isaac changes direction or stops shooting, rate of fire is reset to its normal amount.",1,," - (Removed in Repentance) Tear delay gradually decreases as the player shoots in one direction. Accuracy also decreases as the fire rate increases.
  - At max ""charge"", it will reduce tear delay by half, rounding down.
 - (Added in Repentance) Fire rate gradually increases as the player shoots in one direction. Accuracy also decreases as the fire rate increases.
  - At max ""charge"", it will increase fire rate by double.
 - Rate of fire returns to its original value if Isaac stops firing, changes firing directions, uses an active item, or is hit.
  - (Added in Afterbirth+) Being hit, changing rooms, and using items no longer reset the Epiphora bonus.
  - (Added in Repentance) Entering an unexplored boss room will reset the Epiphora bonus.
   - During the delay when transitioning between rooms, picking up an item, or using an active item, it's possible to change the firing direction without resetting the bonus.
"," - Epiphora technically works with items that require a charge (such as Monstro's Lung), but requires releasing the key or button, causing players to lose the effect.
",True

column1: Glitter Bombs,I432,Prize bombs!,+5 {{E
column2:
bomb}}s. Bombs have a chance to drop random [[pickup]]s or [[charm]] enemies when they explode.,2,," - Grants 5 bombs.
 - Isaac's bombs have a 25% chance to spawn a pickup or trinket when they explode including other bombs.
  - (Added in Repentance) Isaac's bombs have a 63% chance to spawn a pickup or trinket when they explode, but the chance for either to generate decreases by 1% for each spawn until Isaac enters a new floor. This is to prevent items such as Dr. Fetus or a Golden Bomb from providing unlimited resources. This means that the maximum spawns per floor is 63, although the final generation of a pickup or trinket will have a 1% chance to occur.
 - Isaac's bombs have a 15% chance to charm random enemies in the room when they explode.
"," - (Removed in Repentance) Picking up a Golden Bomb, Dr. Fetus, Epic Fetus, or Number Two with Glitter Bombs allows infinite pickup generation.
  - In Greed Mode, infinite pickup generation is still possible, but excludes coins, presumably to prevent the player from filling the Greed Donation Machine in a single run. However, this can be worked around if Isaac has the Swallowed Penny or Piggy Bank, since it does still produce health.
",True

column1:
Tech X,I395,Laser ring tears,Tears are replaced with laser rings that pierce through enemies and deal damage to enemies within them. Can be charged to increase the effectiveness of the ring.,4,," - Isaac's tears are replaced with ring-shaped lasers.
  - Shots can be charged to increase the size of the rings.
  - The rings deal damage 15 times per second. Only the outer circumference of the rings will deal damage.
  - Rings pass through obstacles and enemies. Rings have infinite range and will travel until they hit a wall.
  - {{Dlc
column2:
r}} Damage dealt is based on the amount charged, starting at around 25% Isaac's damage and approaches 100% at maximum charge.
   - \text{Charge Time} = \frac{1}{30}(Roundup(\text{Tear Delay} \times 3) + 1) \approx \frac{3}{\text{Fire Rate}}
   - \text{Max Charge Damage per Tick} = \text{Damage} \times \frac{5}{4}(\text{Fire Rate} \times (Roundup(\text{Tear Delay} \times 3) + 1) - 10)
   - \text{Min Charge Damage per Tick} = \text{Damage} \times \frac{5}{4}(\text{Fire Rate} \times (Roundup(\text{Tear Delay}) + 1) - 10)
   - At 30.00 fire rate or above (0 tear delay or lower), charging is no longer needed and fires 30 rings per second. Higher fire rate results in higher laser damage.
    - \text{Damage per Tick} = \text{Damage} \times \frac{5}{4}(\text{Fire Rate} - 10)
    - Damage per Tick is capped at 100% Isaac's Damage, at 90.00 fire rate.
"," - The rings are similar in appearance to the combination of The Ludovico Technique and Technology.
 - The laser rings will linger for a brief moment upon touching a wall, allowing more damage to be dealt to enemies closer to walls.
 - The ""R U A WIZARD?"" pill effect does not work with Tech X.
 - Acquiring an extra copy of Tech X will shoot an extra laser ring.
 - {{Dlc
column3:
nr}} Charging only increases size, not damage. It is useful for hard-to-hit enemies or hitting a wide area at once, but spamming small, uncharged shots will lead to much higher damage output.
  - {{Dlc
column4:
a+nr}} With the charge bars option enabled, the rings can be released immediately as the charge bar appears for easier gauging of maximum damage output.
 - {{Dlc
column5:
r}} The maximum ring size is slightly smaller in ''Repentance''.
",True

column1: Tractor Beam,I397,Controlled tears,"Isaac emits a beam from his face that his tears are bound to. {{dlc
column3:
r}} Increases [[Fire Rate]], [[Range]], and [[Shot Speed]]. ",3,," - A beam appears directly in front of Isaac in the direction that his head is facing. Isaac's tears travel in the path of the beam.
  - When Isaac moves or turns his head, tears that are mid-flight will snap to the beam.
 - (Removed in Repentance) +0.5 Tears.
  - (Added in Repentance) +1.0 Fire Rate.
 - (Removed in Repentance) +5.25 Range.
  - (Added in Repentance) +1.5 Range.
 - (Removed in Repentance) +0.5 Tear Falling Speed.
 - +0.16 Shot Speed.
", - This item prevents Isaac from firing tears at angles using momentum.
 - Having this item equipped prevents Isaac from automatically aiming downwards after he stops firing.
 - This item grants Isaac immunity from the R U a Wizard? pill effect.
,True

column1:
Multidimensional Baby,I431,ydduB Buddy,Spawns a [[familiar]] that will follow Isaac's movements on a 2.5-second delay. Tears that pass through the baby will be doubled and increase in speed.,2,," - Spawns a familiar that follows Isaac's path with a 2-second delay.
  - (Added in Repentance) The delay is 0.66 seconds instead.
 - When a friendly tear passes through Multidimensional Baby, the tear splits into two parallel tears that gain a 1.33x shot speed boost, (Removed in Repentance) x1.5 range /(Added in Repentance) x1.5 tear height (which also increases effective range), and also a visual black and white flashing effect.
"," - It is possible to crash the game when combining this item with rapid-fire or multi-shot laser tears.
 - Duplicated tears will deal the same damage as Isaac's tears.
 - If other familiars that move with a similar pattern such as Shade have been collected before the Baby, it will follow them instead with further delay.
 - Standing perfectly still with the Multidimensional Baby inside of Isaac will activate its effect, as the tears will pass through it as they spawn.
  - This does not work with attacks such as Brimstone.
 - (Added in Repentance){{transf
column3:
item}}
",True

column1:
Night Light,I425,Scared of the dark?,A cone of light shines in the direction Isaac is moving that [[slow]]s enemies and enemy shots.,2,," - A cone of light shines from Isaac's chest that slows all enemies and enemy shots.
  - The light will face the direction Isaac is moving.
  - The light doesn't affect bosses, but it will slow their shots.
  - The slow effect will disappear from enemies when the light stops shining on them, but shots will remain slow.
 - Removes {{curse
column2:
darkness}} for the current floor.
  - Doesn't provide immunity on later floors, but lessens the visual effect significantly, effectively removing the curse.
"," - The light only needs to touch a shot once to slow it permanently.
  - Doing a quick circular motion is effective to slow surrounding enemy shots, especially while fighting Hush.
  - Overuse of this effect can cause unavoidable patterns, as the slowed shots will often still travel most of their original distance.
 - (Added in Repentance) This item is '''not recommended''' against The Beast
column3:
n, as the fires spawned by her will be slowed down significantly and pile up quickly, leading to no room to dodge.
 - (Added in Repentance) Doesn't remove Curse of Darkness afflicted by XIX - The Sun?, no matter if Night Light was picked up before or after using the card. However, the visual effect is still lessened by the beam of light.
",True

column1: Box of Friends,I357,Double your friends,"Duplicates all of Isaac's [[familiar]]s for the current room. If Isaac has no familiars, spawns a {{i
column2:
Demon Baby}} for the room instead.",1,Box of Friends," - Upon use, it adds one copy of each of Isaac's familiars for the duration of the current room.
 - If Isaac has no familiars, a Demon Baby will spawn for the duration of the current room.
"," - Lilith starts with this item by default, even if it hasn't been unlocked yet.
 - If Isaac has more than one copy of the same familiar, it will still only add one copy.
 - Blue Flies, Blue Spiders, and orbitals (Halo of Flies, Leprosy, etc) are not copied.
  - (Added in Repentance) It now copies some orbitals.
 - Many familiars can be spawned in Greed mode and Boss Rush, as completing waves charges the item.
 - (Added in Repentance) Familiars with the Item Tags uniquefamiliar
column3:
uniquefamiliar item tag are ignored by Box of Friends. If Isaac has only unique familiars, a Demon Baby is spawned.
",True

column1: D7,I437,Roll again,"Restarts the current [[room]] and brings back all [[enemy
column2:
enemies]], allowing more rewards to be acquired by completing the room.",1,," - Upon use, it restarts the room and respawns all enemies. Pickups or Chests may be granted for clearing the room.
"," - Has no effect in Greed Mode.
 - Has no effect when used in a room that had no enemies, Challenge Rooms, or Boss Challenge Rooms.
 - Will work in a Mini-Boss Room.
 - (Removed in Repentance) When used in a Boss Room, Devil Room, or Angel Room, Isaac is teleported to another room on the floor, and the room he was in does not reset. The room Isaac teleports to will respawn enemies if it had them.
  - (Added in Repentance) D7 will not work when used in a Boss Room, Devil Room (it can be used to respawn Krampus), or Angel Room.
 - (Removed in Repentance) When used in a Secret Room that previously contained Greed or Super Greed, the room becomes a regular Secret Room.
  - (Added in Repentance) No longer rerolls the room into a regular Secret Room; instead respawns Greed or Super Greed (depending on which one was present before).
 - (Removed in Repentance) When used in a Shop that previously contained Greed or Super Greed, the Shop items will spawn. Rolling it again will cause new items to spawn on top of each other.
  - (Added in Repentance) No longer spawns a regular Shop; instead Greed or Super Greed respawns.
 - When used in a room with a Champion enemy, the enemy will not respawn as a Champion.
 - Can be used to generate infinite rewards with both 9 Volt and AAA Battery and/or 4.5 Volt depending on the enemies in the room.
  - If Isaac only has either 9 Volt or AAA Battery, rewards can still be endlessly generated in a quadruple-sized room or an L-shaped room.
 - Enemies respawn exactly where they first spawned, even if that's where Isaac is standing, in which case Isaac will take damage immediately upon use of the D7. Right next to doors is usually a safe place to use it.
 - {{Dlc
column3:
r}} If used in the Mirrored World of Downpour or Dross II, the rooms will not only have their enemies respawn, but all the normal non-mirrored contents such as pickups are restored. Using it in the Shop causes it to be stocked normally, and additional uses will restock the Shop's contents, unlike normal Shops.
 - {{Dlc
column4:
r}} As Tainted Keeper, enemies respawned by the D7 will drop the same type of coins as they had before using the D7. This can be used to quickly generate money from enemies that dropped high-value coins or greatly increase Luck if an enemy dropped a Lucky Penny.
",True

column1:
Ventricle Razor,I396,Short cutter,"Can be used to place an orange portal and a blue portal. Upon entering a portal, Isaac is teleported to the other portal.",1,," - When used for the first time, Isaac creates a blue portal under where he is standing. The next time he uses the item, he creates an orange portal under his feet. Isaac can then walk over either of the portals to teleport instantly to the location of the other one.
 - Activating the item more than twice will replace the older of the two portals.
 - The portals can be placed in any room. However, if a portal leads to a room with a negative grid index (i.e. Devil Room, Angel Room, I AM ERROR room, Crawl Space, Boss Rush, Black Market, Mega Satan room, or ??? portal room), Isaac will not be able to enter the portal.
"," - This item can be used to escape a Challenge Room or the Boss Rush.
 - {{Dlc
column2:
nr}} Upon teleportation, Isaac is granted with a short invulnerability period which can be abused to trigger the Blood Donation Machine and Devil Beggar without losing health by placing a portal just next to it, teleporting, and touching the Donation Machine or Beggar in the same move. This trick is particularly useful for The Lost. The teleportation trick can also be used to escape a Curse Room without taking damage.
  - (Added in Repentance) This no longer works because the Blood Donation Machine and Devil Beggar take hearts without accounting for invincibility frames, however, a Curse Room can still be entered/exited for free.
 - Portals will stay even if the item is dropped or changed.
 - The item can prove useful in close quarters combat, allowing the player to attack one side, then dodge attacks and jump to the other side of the room to attack the enemies on that side.
 - Upon entering a new floor, the previously placed portals will disappear.
 - If {{cu
column3:
Maze}} is active, using portals placed between different rooms may result in a random destination. Two portals in the same room work reliably.
  - If room contents are randomized by the curse, it's possible for the portals to end up completely surrounded or even inside rocks or pits. If Isaac can't move to safety, the run can be quit and resumed to be placed at a door.
 - {{Dlc
column4:
r}} On Downpour II, Ventricle Razor cannot be used to teleport between the normal and mirror world.
 - {{Dlc
column5:
r}} This item can be useful to exit Mom's boss room to start the Ascent, as long as you use it at least once before entering the boss room.
 - If this item is used while having the Broken Remote trinket Isaac will be teleported to a random room
",True

column1:
Cambion Conception,I412,Feed them hate,"After taking damage a certain amount of times, a permanent demonic [[familiar]] spawns.",2,Cambion Conception," - Upon taking damage a certain number of times, Isaac gains a permanent demonic familiar. Possible familiars include:
  - Dark Bum
  - Demon Baby
  - Incubus
  - Leech
  - Lil Brimstone
  - Succubus
  - Lil Abaddon
  - Twisted Pair
 - The first and second familiars will each spawn after taking damage 15 times. The third and fourth familiars will each spawn after taking damage 30 more times. No further familiars will spawn. As a result, after taking damage 90 times, four out of eight possible familiars will have spawned.
 - Isaac will look progressively more pregnant as he takes damage.
"," - Lilith starts with this item by default, even if it hasn't been unlocked. Lilith can get a second incubus through this.
 - Only one of each type of familiar can be spawned.
 - Familiars that have yet to be unlocked can spawn, {{dlc+
column2:
r}} with the exception of Lil Abaddon and Twisted Pair, which must be unlocked before they can spawn through Cambion Conception.
 - Only actually getting damage counts towards the payout. For example, negating damage with the Holy Mantle will not count.
 - Familiars spawned this way do not count towards transformations nor the collection page.
 - Familiars spawned by the item do not affect item pools, so multiple copies of one familiar can be obtained. For example, a second Incubus can be purchased after Cambion Conception spawns one.
 - If a familiar obtained is a copy of another one already obtained, using Box of Friends will only clone one of that familiar.
 - {{dlc+
column3:
r}} If this item is removed with XVII - The Stars?, it will also remove any familiars already obtained through Cambion Conception.{{dlc-}}
",True

column1:
Chaos,I402,!!!,Drops 1-6 random [[pickups]] on the floor. Causes [[items]] to be chosen from random [[item pool]]s.,3,," - Drops 1-6 random pickups around Isaac.
 - Causes items to be chosen from random item pools.
  - Fixed item drops that ignore the current room's item pool will not be replaced. Examples include Cube of Meat after defeating one of The Harbingers as a floor boss, or the Small Rock after breaking a Tinted Rock.
"," - When playing Greed mode, items that are available only in the normal game will still not appear despite Chaos; the modes' different item pools stay separate.
 - As the item does not mix or combine item pools, it is possible to deplete smaller item pools and end up with Breakfast before all items in the game have been taken.
  - Thus, if Chaos tries to pull from an item pool that is already depleted, it will not pull from a different pool and instead give Isaac Breakfast.
   - As many Greed Mode item pools are small, Chaos tends to result in Breakfast more often during Greed mode.
 - (Removed in Repentance) Chaos will draw items even from item pools that are not used in the game, but defined in the game's files. The unused pools are bossrush containing nearly all bomb related items, challenge with a smaller selection of bomb items and dungeon containing several Mom related items and food items.
 - (Removed in Repentance) Since all item pools have the same probability of being selected, bomb-related items are much more common due to the Bomb Bum (Item Pool)
column2:
Bomb Bum, bossrush and challenge item pools.
 - (Added in Repentance) Each pool has a weight based on the number of items in the pool. Items from large pools such as Treasure Room (Item Pool)
column3: Treasure Room, Shop (Item Pool)
column4: Shop, and Boss (Item Pool)
column5: Boss are very likely, while items from small pools like Bomb Bum (Item Pool)
column6: Bomb Bum and Planetarium (Item Pool)
column7:
Planetarium are more rare.
 - If an item outside of the Devil Room (Item Pool)
column8:
Devil Room pool appears as a Devil Deal, it will always cost 1 Red Heart Container (or 3 Soul Hearts should Isaac have no Red Hearts).
  - (Added in Repentance) If an item from the Angel Room (Item Pool)
column9:
Angel Room pool appears as a Devil Deal, it will cost 2 Red Hearts if it would cost 30 cents in the Angel Shop generated by The Stairway, and 1 Red Heart if it would cost 15 cents in the Angel Shop.
   - Similarly, if an item from the Devil Room (Item Pool)
column10:
Devil Room pool appears in an Angel Shop generated by The Stairway, it will cost 30 cents if it would cost 2 Red Hearts as a Devil Deal, and 15 cents if it would cost 1 Red Heart as a Devil Deal.
 - If an item that grants an Eternal Heart is taken in a devil deal, the eternal heart will ''not'' keep Isaac alive if he has no other hearts.
 - (Added in Afterbirth+) Bosses defeated in The Void drop items as if Chaos was active. Re-rolling the items uses the Boss Room pool as normal.
",True

column1: Scatter Bombs,I366,We put bombs in your bombs!,Adds 5 {{E
column2:
bomb}}s. Isaac's bombs explode into 2-4 tiny bombs.,1,, - Gives Isaac +5 bombs.
 - (Removed in Repentance) Isaac's bombs split into 2-4 tiny bombs after exploding.
  - (Added in Repentance) Bombs split into 4-5 tiny bombs.
  - Tiny bombs deal half damage and have decreased blast radius.
  - Tiny bombs retain Isaac's bomb synergies (with the exception of Mr. Mega (Removed in Repentance) and Bomber Boy's increased blast radius).
  - {{Dlc
column3:
r}} Tiny bombs explode immediately upon landing.
,,True

column1: Jar of Flies,I434,Bug catcher,"Killing an enemy adds a fly to the jar, up to a maximum of 20. On use, releases [[Blue Fly
column2:
Blue Flies]] equal to the number of flies in the jar.",2,," - Killing an enemy adds a fly to the jar, up to a maximum of 20.
 - Upon use, releases Blue Fly
column3:
Blue Flies equal to the number of flies in the jar.
 - {{transf
column4: Beelzebub
column5:
item}}
"," - Kills by blue flies and locusts (including flies from the jar) and shooting familiars (including Incubus and the launch attack from (Added in Repentance) Tainted Lilith's fetus) do not add flies to the jar.
 - Blue spiders, orbital familiars, and chasing familiars do add flies to the jar.
 - Friendly enemies such as from the Friendly Ball add flies to the jar, but not those spawned from other enemies.
 - Batteries do not affect the number of flies in the jar.
 - Enemies must be actually ''killed'' to add a fly; transformations (such as Gapers turning into Pacers) or knockouts (such as incapacitating a Globin) do not count as kills.
 - Destroying a shopkeeper will count as a kill.
 - With items that kill normally unkillable enemies, killing things like Stone Grimaces will add flies to the jar.
 - Killing minions in the Hush fight does not add flies to the jar.
",True

column1: PJs,I428,You feel cozy,Grants 4 {{E
column2:
Soul Heart}}s and fully restores Isaac's [[health]].,2,, - Grants four Soul Hearts.
 - Heals 12 Hearts.
,,True

column1: Lil Gurdy,I384,A gurd of your own!,"A {{E
column2:
Gurdy Jr.}} [[familiar]] that charges up while Isaac is firing, bouncing around the room when released and dealing contact damage based on its speed.",2,," - Spawns a familiar that can be launched in the direction the player is firing after a short charge-up period.
  - (Removed in Repentance) At full charge, it initially deals 6 damage per tick or 90 damage per second, but quickly drops towards 0 the slower the familiar moves.
  - (Added in Repentance) No longer deals damage per tick, instead deals a fix amount of damage depending on charge level, at lowest being ~5 and at max being ~20.
 - It bounces off walls multiple times, much like Gurdy Jr.
  - (Added in Repentance) It will also bounce off enemies.
",,True

column1: Marked,I394,Directed tears,"Isaac will automatically fire tears directed at a red target on the ground. The target can be moved with tear controls. +0.7 [[tears]], {{dlc
column3:
r}}+3.0 [[range]].",1,," - Creates a controllable crosshair. Isaac automatically and continuously fires towards the crosshair.
  - (Added in Repentance) The crosshair will not appear in each room until Isaac fires. Pressing the ""drop"" key or button (Keyboard default: left Control key; Controller default: right trigger) will make the crosshair disappear and stop Isaac from firing tears until a firing key is pressed again.https://www.reddit.com/r/bindingofisaac/comments/mi3z0l/important_protip_that_could_save_your_run_from/
 - +0.7 tears.
 - (Removed in Repentance) +3.15 range.
 - (Added in Repentance) +3.0 range.
 - (Removed in Repentance) +0.3 tear falling speed.
 - {{Dlc
column4:
r}} All familiars will fire towards the crosshair.
"," - (Removed in Repentance) If taken with Lilith, Marked gives the stat upgrades but not the mark.
 - On PC, it is possible to control Marked with the mouse. On Windows, go to {{code
column5: C:/Users/[username]/Documents/My Games/The Binding Of Isaac [Rebirth/Afterbirth/Afterbirth+/Repentance]/}} and in the options.ini file, change the line that says {{code
column6: MouseControl{{=}}0}} to {{code
column7:
MouseControl{{=}}1}}.
 - {{Dlc
column8:
r}} If taken with Tainted Lilith, when the baby is launched, it permanently fires at the crosshair. Pressing the ""drop"" key or button (Keyboard default: left Control key; Controller default: right trigger) will make the crosshair disappear and cause the baby to return to Tainted Lilith
",True

column1:
Holy Light,I374,Holy death shot,"Adds a chance to fire holy tears, which will create a damaging light beam in the area if they hit an enemy.",3,," - Isaac has a chance to fire a glowing blue tear that, after colliding with an enemy, spawns a damaging beam of light (similar to Crack the Sky).
  - {{Dlc
column2:
nr}}Each beam of light deals quadruple (4x) Isaac's tear damage.
  - {{Dlc
column3:
r}}Each beam of light deals triple (3x) Isaac's tear damage.
  - A single beam of light can damage multiple enemies.
 - {{Dlc
column4: r}}{{transf
column5: Seraphim
column6:
item}}
"," - The chance to fire a holy tear (activation rate) depends on the Luck stat.
  - The activation rate is equal to 1/(11 - Luck).https://docs.google.com/spreadsheets/d/15K8Xgxoxdx68AIaxuLXgZoJJlG36UPgy3_aeDpAM5tU/edit?usp=sharing
   - At base luck (0), the activation rate is 10%.
   - At 9 luck, the activation rate maximizes at 50%.
 - Its damage is multiplied from the tear's damage, not directly from Isaac's Damage.
  - This means that, if the tears's damage has been multiplied from effects such as Proptosis or Tough Love, the beam's damage is also multiplied.
",True

column1: Placebo,I348,Pill mimic,"When used, copies the effect of the [[pill]] Isaac is currently holding without consuming it. Does not copy the effects of [[Cards and Runes
column2: cards or runes]].",2,," - Mimics the effect of Isaac's held pill, like Blank Card does with Cards and Runes#Cards
column3: cards and Clear Rune does with Cards and Runes#Runes
column4:
runes.
  - Does not consume Isaac's held pill.
  - Does not mimic cards or runes.

column1:
Eden's Blessing,I381,Tears up + your future shines brighter,+0.7 [[tears]] up. Grants a random [[item]] at the start of the next run.,3,Eden's Blessing," - +0.7 tears up.
 - Grants a random item at the start of the next run.
  - Key Piece 1, Key Piece 2, Broken Shovel 1, Broken Shovel 2, Mom's Shovel, Knife Piece 1, Knife Piece 2, and Dogma cannot be granted.
"," - The effect still occurs whether the run was successful or not, even if the run was restarted.
 - The effect does not work if Eden's Blessing was obtained on a seeded run, during a Victory Lap, a RERUN, or during a challenge.
  - Likewise, Eden's Blessing will not grant a free item at the start of a challenge or RERUN, instead granting the free item on the next valid run started.
   - Interestingly, seeded runs will still gain the benefit of banked Eden's Blessings, without depleting them. This means that it is possible to play an infinite amount of seeded runs, and they all start with a free item until a normal run is started.
 - Even if Eden's Blessing is re-rolled, such as with the D4 or D100, a random item will still be granted at the start of the next run.
  - If Eden's Blessing is then regained through Glowing Hour Glass, only one extra item will be given.
  - Absorbing Eden's Blessing with Void will not grant an extra item in the next run.
 - Eden's Blessing can choose itself as the free item you gain, but will not give you an item on your next run.
 - If more than one Eden's Blessing is acquired in a single run, that quantity of random items will be granted at the start of the next run, although it's capped at ten items.
  - It is possible to obtain multiple copies of an item at once this way.
 - If Eden's Blessing effect is obtained through Metronome, no extra item will be given.
 - If gained from Lemegeton, it will not grant an item next run.
 - Taking Eden's Blessing and then starting a run as (Added in Repentance)Jacob and Esau will only give item(s) to Jacob.
 - (Added in Repentance) As Tainted Lazarus, the item will be given to his alive form.
  - If Tainted Lazarus somehow acquires the item before flipping for the first time of the run, Eden's Blessing will be consumed upon flip and a random item will be granted to Dead Tainted Lazarus.
 - Using R Key or Genesis will not consume Eden's Blessing.
 - XVII - The Stars? can't remove the item(s) given by Eden's Blessing and using it will consume the first item(s) acquired after them or do nothing if there are no other items.
 - XVII - The Stars? can remove Eden's blessing and the item will be granted in the next game.
",True

item}}{{dlc-}}

 - The charm fart deals 5 damage.
 - The poison fart initially deals 5 damage and the poison deals 3.5.
,True

column3:
poison tears, each tick dealing damage equal to Isaac's.
  - Poison from the shots will tick 2 times.
 - Inflicts poison on enemies who make contact with Isaac.
  - Contact poison will tick 6 times.
 - (Removed in Repentance)Enemies who are killed after they have been inflicted with this type of poison have a 20% chance to drop black hearts.
  - Enemies can still drop black hearts after the poison has worn off.
  - (Added in Repentance) Only enemies that were inflicted with contact poison drop black hearts.
"," - Not affected by luck.
 - Enemies and bosses with multiple segments, such as Chub and Larry Jr., have a chance to drop multiple Black Hearts.
 - (Removed in Repentance) Although Stoney
column4:
display=Stonies and Shopkeepers can't be visibly poisoned, they still can drop Black Hearts if destroyed after being touched.

tear damage]], and occasionally inflicts [[fear]].",1,, - Gives Isaac a spear familiar that he holds in the direction he most recently shot.

fear on enemies it damages.
," - Spear of Destiny does not replace tears.

Grants immunity to explosions.,3,," - Enemy shots that hit Isaac have a 25% chance to be blocked. When a projectile is effectively blocked, Host Hat fires 3 bullets similar to the Host's.
  - Bullets fired from Host Hat use Isaac's Damage and Range, and copy Isaac's Tear effects.
   - The bullets do not use Isaac's Shot Speed.

   - Fire projectiles (e.g. from Mega Satan).
   - Obstacles thrown by Polty or Kineti.
  - Does not block:
   - Explosive projectiles (e.g. from Gurgle).
   - Lasers or beams.
   - Lines of fire from fireballs.
   - Projectiles from Big Bony, Coal Boy, Danny.

 - After firing tears for 2.35 seconds, releasing the fire button unleashes a black Brimstone ring around Isaac that expands and contracts, dealing damage at a rapid rate to all enemies touching it.
  - The charge is completed when a red upside-down cross appears on Isaac's forehead.

item}}
