column3:
Red Heart}}.,1,, - Grants one full Red Heart container.
 - (Added in Repentance) Heals 1 additional Red Heart.
,,True

column1:
Belly Button,I458,What's in there?,Drops a random [[trinket]]. Grants a second trinket slot.,3,, - Drops a random trinket.
 - Grants a second trinket slot.
,,True

Sinus Infection,I459,Booger tears!,Adds a chance to fire a booger that sticks to enemies and deals damage over time.,3,," - Grants a 20% chance to fire a booger that sticks to an enemy and deals damage over time.
  - Multiple boogers can stick to one enemy and deal extra damage.
  - Each booger deals damage equal to Isaac's tear damage every second.
  - {{Dlc
column2:
nr}}The booger lasts for 60 seconds or until the enemy dies.
   - {{Dlc
column3:
r}}The booger lasts 10 seconds.
  - Boogers cannot pierce and stick to the first enemy that they come in contact with, but will pass through fireplaces even without piercing shots.
  - Boogers also cannot inflict status effects, even if the booger's appearance changes.
"," - The booger falls off the enemy after they die. If it hits another enemy before it touches the ground, it will stick to them and deal damage.
 - Jumping enemies or bosses like Monstro and Leapers and burrowing enemies like Round Worms and Lumps can get rid of the booger when they leap or burrow.
  - Bosses like The Harbingers or Dark One, or enemies like Oob that have dash attacks do not lose the booger when they go off-screen.
 - The tear-sticking effect is similar to Explosivo and Mucormycosis's.
 - Booger shots behave like piercing shots against bombs and fireplaces, making it potentially difficult to evade hostile bombs or push bombs along.
 - The Nose Goblin trinket's effect is almost identical to Sinus Infection, with an added homing tears
column4:
homing bonus.
  - When Isaac is holding both Nose Goblin and Sinus Infection each booger tear created by the item has a 50% chance to also have homing.
 - Not affected by Luck.
",True

column1: Parasitoid,I461,Egg tears!,Adds a chance to fire an egg sack which creates [[slow]]ing [[creep]] and spawns a [[Blue Fly]] or [[Blue Spider]] upon hitting an enemy.,3,," - Adds a chance to fire an egg sack which spawns slowing creep. If an egg sack hits an enemy, one to two Blue Fly
column2:
Blue Flies or Blue Spider is spawned.
 - Egg sack tears have (Removed in Repentance) x2 range/(Added in Repentance) x2 tear height (which also increases effective range).
 - (Added in Repentance) {{transf
column3: Beelzebub
column4:
item}}
 - (Added in Repentance) {{transf
column5: Spider Baby
column6:
item}}
"," - Egg sacks will also spawn blue flies or spiders if they hit Fire places or invincible enemies like Death's Head and Stoney.
 - The chance to fire an egg sack is affected by luck. It is 15% at 0 luck, and maxes out at 50% at 5 luck.
 - It is possible to create a large number of Spiders and Flies by repeatedly shooting a closed Host.
",True

column1: Eye of Belial,I462,Possessed tears!,"Grants [[Tear Effects#Piercing
column2: piercing tears]]. After piercing one enemy, tears start [[Tear Effects#Homing Tears
column3:
homing]] and deal double [[damage]]. ",3,Eye of Belial," - (Removed in Repentance) +1.5 range.
 - (Added in Repentance) +0.375 range.
 - (Removed in Repentance) +1.0 tear falling speed.
 - Grants piercing tears.
 - After piercing one enemy, tears will gain double damage, homing tears
column4:
homing, and a 1.3x size multiplier.
"," - (Removed in Repentance)The piercing effect makes placed Bombs, Troll Bombs, and Mega troll Bombs unable to be pushed around by Isaac's tears.
 - Tears will also gain homing and double damage when they pierce bombs and entities the game considers enemies, like Stone Grimaces and Fire places.
",True

column1: Glyph of Balance,I464,A gift from above,Grants 2 {{E
column2: Soul Heart}}s and modifies drops from [[Champion]] monsters based on certain conditions. {{dlc
column3:
r}} Also modifies room clear drops.,3,Glyph of Balance," - Grants 2 Soul Hearts.
 - Modifies drops from Champion enemies depending on certain conditions.
 - (Added in Repentance) Also modifies room clear drops.
 - The priorities of the drops, in order, are as follows:
  - '''Soul Hearts''': When Isaac has no Red Heart containers and less than 2 Soul Hearts.
  - '''Full Red Hearts''': While at 0.5 Red Hearts.
  - '''Keys''': When Isaac has no keys.
  - '''Bombs''': When Isaac has no bombs.
  - '''Full Red Hearts''': When Isaac has at least half a Red Heart container empty.
  - '''Penny
column4:
display=Pennies''': While Isaac has less than 15 pennies.
  - '''Keys''': When Isaac has less than 5 keys.
  - '''Bombs''': When Isaac has less than 5 bombs.
  - '''Trinkets''': If Isaac has no trinkets and there are no trinkets on the ground in the room.
  - '''Soul Hearts''': When Isaac has less than 6 total Heart containers of any kind.
  - If none of the above conditions are true, items dropped will be rolled as normal.
"," - The Glyph has no effect in Greed Mode or Greedier Mode aside from the Soul Hearts granted upon pickup; champions still never drop anything.
 - (Removed in Repentance) Because of how the item works in the priorities listed above, this item is not recommended for The Lost (except in combination with Immaculate Conception) as he is always considered to be at half a Soul Heart, and all drops ''from champions'' are replaced with Soul Hearts.
  - (Added in Repentance)The Lost and Tainted Lost ignore both rules for Soul Heart generation. This prevents the item from generating mostly useless Soul Hearts.
 - When playing as The Forgotten, the priority of the drops is based on the active form's health: for example, if The Forgotten has half a red heart or less, but The Soul was active right before the pickup drop and it had more than 2 soul hearts, the Glyph will skip over the full red heart drops to the next condition. Also if The Forgotten is full on pickups and health, has a trinket but has less than 6 bone hearts, the Glyph will always drop soul hearts unless The Soul is active at the moment of the drop.
 - (Added in Repentance) When playing as Jacob and Esau / Tainted Lazarus, the priority of the drops is based on the health of the character that has the Glyph.
 - (Added in Repentance) When playing as Tainted Lazarus, the room drop will be modified when the character switches to the character that has the item on room clear.
 - {{Dlc
column5:
r}} Chest drops override the Glyph of Balance.
 - {{Dlc
column6:
r}} Empty room drops are replaced by Glyph of Balance drops, with the exception of heart drops in hard mode, which have a separate chance of being replaced with an empty drop.
 - {{Dlc
column7:
r}} When playing as characters incapable of having red heart containers such as ???, the Glyph will skip soul heart and red heart generation.
  - It is still possible to get hearts if none of the other conditions are true.
",True

column1:
Analog Stick,I465,360 tears!,+0.35 [[tears]] up. Allows Isaac to fire tears diagonally.,2,," - +0.35 tears up.
 - Allows tears to be fired diagonally.
  - With a keyboard or using buttons to fire with a controller, tears can be shot at 45-degree angles by holding two buttons. This is known as eight-directional firing.
  - With an analog controller, the analog input is accepted, allowing full analog aiming in any direction.
"," - Enables full directional firing for keyboard and mouse users with the accessibility option EnableMouseControl enabled.
 - Cricket's Body/The Parasite: When tears are fired diagonally, the split tears will also move diagonally.
",True
Jacob's Ladder,I494,Electric tears,Tears fire sparks of electricity in random directions upon hitting an obstacle or enemy.,3,," - {{Dlc
column2:
nr}} Tears fire 1-2 sparks of electricity in random directions upon hitting an obstacle or enemy.
 - {{Dlc
column3:
r}} Tears fire 1 short-ranged spark of electricity in a random direction upon hitting an obstacle or enemy. When an arc strikes an enemy, it will strike another nearby enemy, chaining up to four times.
 - Sparks deal half of the tear's damage.
  - Sparks behave like Spectral tears
column4: spectral and Piercing tears
column5:
piercing lasers and will arc to hit enemies that are close enough, even striking multiple ones in a row.
  - An enemy can take damage multiple times from sparks of a single chain. If an enemy take damage from a tear, it does not take any damage from the chain which the tear causes.
  - Tears that hit the floor due to running out of range do not generate arcs.
  - {{Dlc
column6:
r}} If the floor is wet, such as Downpour, Dross, Flooded Caves, some rooms in Scarred Womb and after using Flush!, the arcing distance is increased.
",,True

column1: Contagion,I466,Outbreak!,The first enemy killed in a room explodes and [[Status Effects#Poison
column2:
poisons]] nearby enemies. Poisoned enemies will also explode upon death.,2,," - In each room, the first enemy killed will release a gas explosion and poison nearby enemies.
  - Poisoned enemies will also release gas upon death, spreading the effect.
   - Poisoned enemies do not need to die while the poison is still active to spread the effect.
  - The effect will also activate if a shopkeeper is destroyed before killing any enemies.
   - Re-entering a room and destroying another shopkeeper inside it will trigger the effect for a second time.
"," - The initial gas explosion deals 5 damage, and the poison deals Isaac's Damage
column3:
tear damage per tick, for 6 ticks.
 - The gas explosion and poison can damage friendly enemies.
",True

column1: Shade,I468,It follows,"Spawns a shadow [[familiar]] that follows Isaac's movements on a 1 second delay and deals contact damage to enemies. After dealing enough damage, it is absorbed by Isaac and spawns [[friendly]] {{E
column3: display=Charger
column4:
n}}s.",0,Shade," - Grants a shadow familiar that follows Isaac's movements on a (Removed in Repentance) 1-second delay (Added in Repentance) 0.66-second delay and deals 2 contact damage per tick or 30 damage per second to enemies.
 - Shade is absorbed by Isaac after dealing (Removed in Repentance) over 600 damage (Added in Repentance) over 666 damage.
  - The familiar disappears and turns into friendly dark My Shadow
column5:
display=Chargers, similar to those spawned by My Shadow.
  - Isaac will now do equal contact damage at the same rate as the Shade used to.
   - BFFS! will continue to work on Isaac even after absorption, doubling damage dealt.
   - Isaac's contact damage increases when absorbing multiple Shade familiars.
"," - If other familiars that move with a similar pattern such as Multidimensional Baby have been collected before the Shade, it will follow them instead with further delay.
 - If Isaac gains a method of flight, Shade will gain wings.
 - Cannot be removed with Sacrificial Altar.
",True

column1: Hushy,I470,Lil hush!,"Spawns a {{E
column3: n}} [[familiar]] that bounces diagonally around the [[Rooms
column4: room]] and deals contact damage. While firing tears, it stops moving.",0,Hushy," - Spawns a Hush familiar that bounces diagonally around the Rooms
column5:
room and deals contact damage to enemies.
  - Hushy deals 2 damage per tick or 30 damage per second.
  - While firing tears, Hushy stops moving.
  - When Hushy stops moving, it can block shots.
"," - During Isaac's hurt animation, when holding down a fire button, Hushy will continue to move until the animation is over.
",True

King Baby,I472,Hail to the king baby,"Spawns a [[familiar]] that follows Isaac and makes other familiars follow it. While firing tears, other familiars stop moving.",1,King Baby," - Grants a familiar that follows Isaac and always appears first in the familiar chain.
 - While firing tears, King Baby stops moving and glows white.

column1: Euthanasia,I496,Needle shot,"Adds a chance to fire needles that instantly kill [[Monsters
column2: basic enemies]] and deal triple [[damage]] to [[boss]]es. If a needle kills an enemy, it bursts into more tears/needles.",3,Euthanasia," - Adds a chance to fire needles which deal triple Isaac's Damage
column3:
tear damage.
  - Needles will instantly kill Monsters
column4:
regular enemies and cause them to burst into 10 more tears in all directions.
  - The chance to fire a needle depends on luck.
   - At base luck (0), it is 3.33%
   - (Removed in Repentance)It is 100% at 15 luck.
   - (Added in Repentance)It maxes out at 25% with 15 luck.

column5: Spun
column6:
item}}

 - The needle tears can kill Stone Grimaces, allowing Isaac to permanently remove any obstacle in a room.

ns, dropping 10 unlit Throwable Bombs. This can make it detrimental to shoot at them, since they are usually provided as a tool rather than an obstacle.
 - Possible needle tears in a burst from killing an enemy do not retain the instant kill and burst-causing capabilities, but still deal triple damage. This prevents chain reactions of bursts.
 - The tears in the burst are larger than normal but do not have a damage bonus.
 - Unless piercing is obtained, Knights will still block the needles if shot from the front.
",True

   - If Isaac is firing tears while walking into a room, the camouflage and stat boost will not apply.
"," - List of enemies that are completely unaffected by this item:

 - Red Fire Places & Purple Fire Places are not affected by this item.

 - While bosses are not confused, monsters spawned during boss fights are confused, as long as the effect lasts.
 - The item's effect can potentially cause FPS drops.

column1: Duality,I498,You feel very balanced,"Whenever a {{R
column3:
Angel Room}} would spawn after defeating a boss, both rooms spawn. Only one can be entered.",1,Duality," - Whenever a Devil Room/Angel Room spawns after defeating a boss, the other will also spawn.
  - Upon entering one, the other one will disappear.
  - Both rooms will spawn even if a devil deal was made before.
  - In rooms without enough accessible walls, only one of the two will spawn.
"," - Even with Goat Head or Eucharist both rooms will not stay open, and entering either of the rooms will make the other disappear.
 - If Duality was bought through a Devil deal, it is still possible to get Angel Rooms as well as Devil Rooms.
 - Teleportation via a Joker card, a Red Chest or a Sacrifice Room ''before'' defeating the boss and choosing a door will follow the normal rules of Devil/Angel Room generation, instead of a 50/50 chance.
  - The room that was chosen this way will be the only one that opens once the boss is defeated.
  - Teleporting after choosing a door will always take you to the same room.
  - Gaining Duality during Greed/Greedier Mode will only generate one room as per normal, rendering it useless.
",True

column1: Sack of Sacks,I500,Gives sacks,Spawns a [[familiar]] that drops a {{E
column3:
n}} every 5-6 [[rooms]] cleared.,3,Sack of Sacks, - Spawns a familiar that follows Isaac and drops a Grab Bag alternatingly (Removed in Repentance) every 5 or 6 rooms. ((Added in Repentance) 7 or 8 rooms).
,,True

column1:
Plan C,I475,My last resort,"Kills all enemies in the room, then kills Isaac three seconds later.",0,Plan C," - Upon use, deals 9,999,999 damage to every enemy in the room, then kills Isaac 3 seconds later.
"," - Plan C does not kill both phases of bosses like The Lamb, Hush, Ultra Greed, Mega Satan, and Mother, and is most useful when used during the last phase of these multi-phase bosses.
 - It is recommended not to use this item in Challenges, as even if the goal is within the bosses that dies before Isaac does, the player will likely die before the end of the rising trophy animation.
 - For the game's sake, a run is not truly over until Isaac's Last Will appears. This means that some bosses that might seem to finish their death animations after Isaac dies, such as (Removed in Repentance)Ultra Greed, will still be technically killed and will still give their completion marks, even if Isaac does not enter the Final Boss Chest.
 - Some bosses have special interactions with this item:
  - Attempting to use this item to kill Delirium will not work. Its death animation is much longer than the time between using Plan C and Isaac's Last Will appearing, meaning Isaac will die first and it will not count as a kill. Having extra lives that revive Isaac outside the room will not help, either; Delirium must be fought again.
   - However, items that revive Isaac in the same room he died in, namely Lazarus' Rags (or being Lazarus), Inner Child, Soul of Lazarus, and Tainted Lost's Birthright, will allow Isaac to bypass this and kill Delirium with this item. In the case of Lazarus' Rags, though, the completion mark will go toward Lazarus and not the character originally selected.
    - Similarly, if playing as Tainted Lazarus, using Plan C and then using Flip to switch to the other form pauses the death counter until the player switches back to the form that originally used the item.
   - It is possible to kill Delirium by carefully timing pauses after each screen static. Each screen static plays a cutscene that continues to play even while paused, so by pausing and unpausing at the right timings, Delirium's death animation can be shortened to just under 3 seconds allowing for his completion mark to be awarded.
  - (Added in Repentance) Will not work if used against Ultra Greedier as Tainted Forgotten, The Lost, Tainted Lost, or Tainted Jacob in his lost form.
  - (Added in Repentance) Killing Mother
column2:
n's second phase with Plan C will kill Isaac just at the end of her death animation. No completion mark is awarded.
  - {{Dlc
column3: r}} If used in The Beast
column4:
n battle, Plan C will only kill the harbinger that Isaac is fighting on screen. It won't have any effect on the other harbingers nor The Beast itself (The Beast can still be killed if Isaac is fighting it when Plan C is used, and there is enough time to earn the completion mark).
 - Invulnerable enemies and closed Hosts will not be killed by Plan C.
 - Isaac's last will shows his last damage source as the cause of death, not Plan C. If Isaac has not taken damage or lost health from any source, Isaac's face is shown.
 - Invincibility or the Holy Mantle shield will not save Isaac from being killed.
 - Some items that activate when Isaac reaches zero hearts, such as Heartbreak and Spirit Shackles, will not activate, killing Isaac.
 - Even if Isaac enters a trapdoor immediately after using Plan C, he will still die after arriving at the next floor.
  - Isaac will also die after accepting a Victory Lap or performing a RERUN.
 - Plan C has an 80% decreased item pool weight, making it less likely to appear than other collectibles.
 - Plan C is found in 8 item pools, the second highest count amongst all items, behind Cube of Meat. Its lowered weight, however, offsets its presence.
",True

column1: Large Zit,I502,Creep shots,Adds a chance to fire a creep shot that deals double [[damage]] and leaves a trail of [[Status Effects#Slow
column3: white creep]].,1,," - While firing, Isaac has a chance to fire an additional creep shot that deals double damage, Status Effects#Slow
column4: slows enemies, and leaves a short trail of Creep#White Creep
column5: white creep that also Status Effects#Slow
column6:
slows enemies.
  - The chance is not affected by luck.
  - The creep shots don't take on any tear effects.
  - {{Dlc
column7:
a+nr}}The creep shots are affected by range and shot speed.
   - {{Dlc
column8:
r}}The creep shots are not affected by range but affected by shot speed, which determines their effective range.
  - Their tear sizes are not affected by their damage. They always retain their small size.
 - A creep shot will also be fired in a random direction when taking damage.
",,True

column1: D1,I476,What will it be?,"Duplicates a random pickup in the room. {{dlc
column2:
r}} The new pickup may be different than the original (i.e. a different card, etc).",3,D1," - Duplicates 1 random pickup in the current room, including Cards, Runes, Chests, and trinkets.
 - (Added in Repentance) Duplicated pickups may not be identical to the original; for example, a duplicated card may be a different one than the original.
"," - Rune of Jera can not be duplicated.
 - Mimic Chests will not be duplicated.
 - Opened chests will be duplicated into an unopened copy.
 - It is possible to duplicate Shop pickups that have not been purchased yet.
 - (Removed in Repentance) By dropping a card, rune, or pill in a room with no other pickups, then using D1, this item can function similarly to Blank Card and Placebo.
 - (Removed in Repentance) A normal Chest may be duplicated into a Red Chest or a Mimic Chest.
 - (Removed in Repentance) A duplicated trinket is mostly useless, as you cannot pick up two of the same trinket even with Mom's Purse, Belly Button
column3:
n, or Smelter.
  - However, with ""consumable"" trinkets such as Store Credit or Bag Lunch, it can be extremely powerful.
 - (Removed in Repentance) With Car Battery, it is possible to infinitely generate Lil' Battery
column4:
display=Lil' Batteries from a single Lil' Battery.
  - {{Dlc
column5:
r}} While it's still possible to generate infinite batteries with this synergy, it is very slow to do so since mostly Micro Batteries will spawn. The occasional Lil' Battery or other battery spawn is needed to build up the battery pile.
 - (Removed in Repentance) In combination with a 48 Hour Energy pill and Paper Clip, the initial Locked Chests on Chest can be infinitely duplicated and opened.
 - (Removed in Repentance) In Greed Mode, if a Lil' Battery appears in the Shop and a 2 of Diamonds is acquired, infinite money can be gained by duplicating the Two of Diamonds.
 - {{Dlc
column6: r}} A duplicated card has a chance to turn into Cracked Key
column7:
n; however, a duplicated Cracked Key will always turn into another Cracked Key.
 - {{Dlc
column8: r}}A duplicated Pills
column9:
Gold Pill will turn into a random Pill chosen from the Pill Pool.
",True

column1: Dataminer,I481,109,"Displaces enemy sprites for the current room, randomly increases one [[Attributes
column2:
stat]] and decreases another.",0,," - For the current room, rotates every enemy and pickup 90 degrees and moves its sprite up and left.
  - Enemy hitboxes remain the same.
 - Increases one of Isaac's Attributes
column3:
stats and decreases another. Possible stat changes include:
  - Â± 1 flat damage
  - (Removed in Repentance) Â±0.5 tears
  - (Added in Repentance) Â±0.5 fire rate
  - Â±0.2 speed
   - (Removed in Repentance) Also affects maximum speed (may never exceed 2.0)
  - Â±0.2 shot speed
  - Â±1 luck
  - (Removed in Repentance) Â±0.5 range
  - (Added in Repentance) Â±1.50 range
 - Adds random tear effects for the current room.
 - Distorts the music for the current room.
"," - {{Dlc
column4:
r}} If the tear stat reaches a negative number, there will be an integer overflow, which will max out the tear rate at the 120 cap; if the tear stat is boosted back into a positive number, it will replace the value obtained previously.
 - If Rock Bottom is obtained while Tear Rate is overflowed, it will stay at 120 even if boosts are obtained.
 - The minimum values for each stat are as follows:
  - Damage: 0.5
  - Speed: 0.1
  - Shot Speed: 0.6
  - Range: 1.0
 - Further changes to Isaac's stats are still calculated normally behind the scenes, but their ''effective'' values cannot go below the minimum. For example, 0.5 Shot Speed will ''behave'' as though it were 0.6, but a 0.2 Shot Speed increase would apply to the true stat value of 0.5, meaning the new stat value would be 0.7.
",True

column1: Backstabber,I506,Watch your back!,Isaac's tears deal double [[damage]] and inflict [[Status Effects#Bleed
column2: bleeding]] on enemies if they're facing away from Isaac.,2,," - When tears land on the ""back"" of enemies, they deal double damage and inflict Status Effects#Bleed
column3:
bleeding.
  - (Removed in Repentance) Bleeding enemies take damage equal to 10% of their maximum health every 5 seconds. Bosses cannot be inflicted with bleeding, but will still take the extra damage.
  - (Added in Repentance) Enemies bleed for 5 seconds, bleeding enemies take damage based on how quickly they move; the faster the enemy, the more damage they take. While moving, a bleeding enemy leaves behind Creep#Red_Creep
column4:
red creep that can damage other enemies. Bosses can also be inflicted with bleeding.
  - The extra damage is dealt even if the enemy is already bleeding.
",,True

column1: Mama Mega!,I483,BOOOOOOOOOM!,Damages all [[Monster
column2: enemies]] and destroys all [[obstacle]]s. The effect occurs every time a new room is entered for the rest of the floor. Opens the doors to the floor's {{r
column3: Secret Room}}s and {{r
column4:
Super Secret Room}}s.,3,," - Destroys all obstacles in the current room and deals 200 damage to every enemy (including Bosses). This effect also applies to every room for the remainder of the floor.
  - (Added in Repentance) Also destroys all Machines, Beggars, Shopkeepers, and Fire Places.
  - (Added in Repentance) Also destroys all obstacles in rooms that have already been cleared.
  - (Added in Repentance) Will destroy Donation Machines as well, reducing donated coin count and removing them for the rest of the run.
 - Opens all Secret Room and Super Secret Room doors on the current floor.
"," - Mama Mega! opens the paths to Boss Rush and the {{Stage
column5:
???}} even after the time limits expire.
  - The Boss does not need to be defeated before entering these doors.
  - It will also open the Boss Rush / ??? entrance room door if it is activated after Mom or Mom's Heart/It Lives has already been defeated.
  - Leaving the Boss Room (via teleport or entering a Devil Room/Angel Room) will close the doors.
  - Leaving the Boss Rush room or ??? entrance room will also close the doors.
  - {{Dlc
column6:
r}} Does not open a path to ??? if used in the room on the other side of the flesh door in Mausoleum / Gehenna II.
 - Entering a room with an angel statue while the effect is active automatically initiates a fight with an Angel.
 - Does not kill Lil' Haunts and other enemies that are immune to damage while entering the room.
 - If used before the Ultra Greed fight begins, it will deal no damage to Ultra Greed, as he is invulnerable for the first few seconds upon first entering his room. However, it will still break obstacles as usual.
 - When used in Greed mode, it will only activate once for the main room (as opposed to once per wave, in a similar fashion to a standard run). Therefore, its damage potential is maximized if used after all the monster waves have spawned for the current floor.
 - Does not open the door to Mega Satan in Dark Room or Chest.
 - {{Dlc
column7:
r}} If used in Downpour / Dross II, the entrance to the Mirrored World will be destroyed, making it inaccessible.
  - If used in the Mirrored World, it will destroy the exit, which, on top of making it impossible to leave, will then cause Isaac to take damage and die.
  - This can be avoided by entering and immediately leaving the room before the shockwave reaches the mirror.
 - {{Dlc
column8:
r}} Does not open the flesh door at the end of Mausoleum / Gehenna II.
",True

column1:
Wait What?,I484,I can't believe it's not butter bean!,"Isaac farts, sending out rock waves.",1,," - Upon use, Isaac farts, knocking back enemies and their shots. It also sends out rock waves that deal 10 damage per tick to nearby enemies and break obstacles.
"," - This item is identical to Butter Bean in appearance.
 - (Removed in Repentance) Butter Bean has a small chance to turn into this item upon pickup.
 - (Added in Repentance) Each run has a chance of replacing Butter Bean with Wait What? in item pools. Both items generally do not exist during the same run.
 - This item is useful for opening Secret Rooms, Super Secret Rooms, Bedrooms and the path to Mines. In Bedrooms, it can also open up the passage under the carpet.
  - To break open a secret room, the wall must be hit with one of the rock waves, not the gas cloud, so Isaac needs to stand a few steps away from the wall.
 - The earthquake can open Bomb Chests.
 - (Removed in Repentance) The earthquake can be used to blow up the Donation Machine or activate/blow up a Shop Restock Machine.
",True

Crooked Penny,I485,50/50,"Spawns a penny and has a 50% chance to double all [[items]] and [[pickups]] in the room. If the effect fails, the items and pickups disappear.",1,Crooked Penny," - Upon use, has a 50% chance to double all items, pickups, and chests in the current room.
  - If the effect fails, the items, pickups, and chests disappear, and a penny is spawned.
"," - If used in a Shop or Devil Room, the duplicated items and pickups can be taken for free.
 - If the effect fails in a shop that contains a Shop Restock Machine, then the Restock Machine can be used to refresh the Shop, bringing back new items and pickups.
 - If used in the Boss Rush room, it can duplicate the items, and all of them can be taken without affecting the originals. Successfully duplicating the items will trigger Boss Rush, and failing to duplicate them will not.
 - If used on The Polaroid and The Negative after defeating Mom, it can duplicate them, and they can both be taken without affecting the originals.
 - The 50% chance is predetermined after each use of Crooked Penny. By force quitting or using Glowing Hour Glass after each failure, this can be exploited to generate large numbers of copies of useful items â€” if the penny is going to fail, then use it in a different room, recharge it, and try again.
  - {{Dlc
column2:
r}} The outcome of Crooked Penny is determined on a per-room basis, meaning that it will succeed in certain rooms and fail in others respecting the 50/50 chance. Using Crooked Penny will still advance an RNG step, however, and re-roll the outcome of the other rooms.
",True

column1:
Dull Razor,I486,I feel numb...,"Hurts Isaac without depleting health, activating any items that trigger upon taking damage.",1,Dull Razor," - Hurts Isaac without taking away health, activating any items that trigger upon taking damage.
"," - As using the Dull Razor will grant extra invincibility frames like normal damage, this item can be used to enter Curse Room for free, or, with proper timing, allow Isaac to avoid taking damage from an enemy or obstacle.
 - (Removed in Repentance) The invincibility frames allow Isaac to use {{Machine
column3:
Devil Beggar}}s for free.
 - (Added in Repentance) Dull Razor ignores shields granted by Holy Mantle, and similar items.
",True

column1:
Metronome,I488,Waggles a finger,Grants a random item effect for the current room.,1,Metronome, - Grants a random item's effect for the current room.
," - Beware using this as The Lost or {{Dlc
column2:
r}}Tainted Lost, as it can trigger self-harm items and kill him.
 - Using this item multiple times in the same room will replace the previous item with a new one.
 - Metronome cannot grant the effects of itself, Glowing Hour Glass or Plan C.
  - {{Dlc
column3:
r}}It also cannot grant the effects of Breath of Life, Clicker, or R key.
 - Keep in mind that you can trigger items you haven't unlocked yet, which means you could trigger the effect of items like Death Certificate without having to go through the trouble of unlocking them.
 - If Metronome triggers the effect of Genesis, it will disappear from the active slot, just as with the real item.
 - Metronome has a reduced chance of activating Genesis (25% success) or Death certificate (15% success).
",True

column1: D Infinity,I489,Reroll forever,"{{dlc
column2:
nr}} Grants a random die item that changes each use.
{{dlc
column3:
r}} Acts as any die item, and can by cycled by pressing the drop key.",4,D Infinity," - (Removed in Repentance) Grants a random dice item that transforms into a different random die item upon use.
  - Each die item has a 2 room charge.
  - D Infinity is able to use all of the available effects, regardless of whether the individual die mimicked by this item has been unlocked prior or not.
 - {{dlc+
column4:
r}} Acts as any die item except for Spindown Dice, and can be cycled through by pressing the drop key.
  - When in possession of more than one active item with the Schoolbag, all dice must be cycled through before the other active item can be used.
  - Charge time varies based on the current die, and updates when used.
   - D1 has a charge of 4 rooms.
   - D4 has a charge of 6 rooms.
   - The D6 has a charge of 6 rooms.
   - Eternal D6 has a charge of 2 rooms.
   - D7 has a charge of 3 rooms.
   - D8 has charge of 4 rooms.
   - D10 has a charge of 1 room.
   - D12 has a charge of 3 rooms.
   - D20 has a charge of 6 rooms.
   - D100 has a charge of 6 rooms.{{dlc-}}
", - The icon of the D Infinity will change to resemble the corresponding die while being held. Putting it back on a pedestal will change its icon back to normal.
,True

column1:
Eden's Soul,I490,...,Spawns two item pedestals then is consumed. Begins with no charges.,3,Eden's Soul," - Upon activation, this item is consumed and will vanish from Isaac's inventory.
 - Spawns two random item pedestals using the item pool of the current room.
"," - This item starts with no charges.
 - (Removed in Repentance) Unlike Mega Blast, this item can be charged with a single Lil' Battery.
  - Lil' Battery
Delirious,I510,Unleash the power!,Spawns {{E
column3:
n}} as a random [[friendly]] [[boss]] that fights for Isaac.,1,Delirious," - Upon use, spawns Delirium in a form of a friendly boss for the current room.
 - Changes the appearance of the current room so it looks like a different chapter.
"," - If multiple bosses are spawned in one room with Car Battery, The Battery, or batteries, the bosses can try to kill each other.
 - Sometimes bosses don't spawn because of grid entities getting in the way. When this happens the upper door appears to have friendly particles.
 - (Removed in Repentance) Unlike Mega Blast, this item can be charged with a single Lil' Battery.
  - Lil' Battery
column4:
r gives 6 charges.
 - It is possible for Hush to spawn, despite Delirium not transforming into Hush during its boss battle.
 - If a boss summons monsters, the monsters will be charmed and will follow Isaac out of the room.
 - Delirious has a 60% decreased item pool weight, making it less likely to appear than other collectibles.
 - Certain large bosses with high health likeHush can block projectiles while Isaac stays within their hitbox, with enemies often dying when they touch the boss. Very useful for bullet heavy bosses.
 - Using Delirious in the Delirium fight is ill-advised as the player may confuse which Delirium is the right one, often causing more chaos in an already chaotic battle.
",True

column1:
Angry Fly,I511,He's violent,Spawns a fly [[familiar]] that orbits around a random enemy and deals 30 damage per second to enemies it comes in contact with.,1,Angry Fly," - Spawns a fly familiar that orbits around a random enemy and deals 2 damage per tick/30 damage per second to enemies it comes in contact with.
  - It will occasionally make a lunge towards the enemy it is orbiting, allowing brief contact even with smaller enemies.
  - If the enemy it is orbiting dies, it starts orbiting a different enemy.
  - If there are no enemies, it orbits Isaac.
 - {{transf
column3:
item}}
"," - Angry Fly will orbit around invincible enemies such as Stone Grimaces without dealing damage.
 - Due to its movement pattern, its actual damage dealt per second is erratic against most enemies and groups of them.
 - (Added in Repentance) As Tainted Jacob, Angry Fly will orbit around Dark Esau
column4:
n.
",True

column1:
Black Hole,I512,Nothing can escape,Throws a black hole on the ground which sucks in and damages enemies.,1,Black Hole," - Upon use, Isaac throws a black hole which sucks in and damages enemies.
  - The black hole deals 0.4 damage per tick very rapidly, for a maximum of 6 dps.
  - The black hole lasts for about 6 seconds.
  - The black hole also slightly sucks in Isaac and pickups.
  - The black hole also destroys nearby obstacles, such as rocks and pots.
  - It can also suck in projectiles shot by enemies.
"," - Black Hole can pull pickups across pits, so be careful as it may pull pickups to areas where they are unobtainable.
 - Black Hole cannot free Sticky Nickels.
 - Black Hole cannot destroy Shopkeepers.
 - Black Hole cannot destroy Angel

 - Black Hole does not suck in stationary or invincible enemies.
 - Black Hole will not suck in the following bosses, although they can still take damage from the black hole and their shots are affected by it:

Broken Modem,I514,Lag!,"Enemies, enemy shots, tears, and pickups will briefly freeze in place at random intervals.",2,Broken Modem," - Enemies, enemy shots, tears and pickups will briefly freeze in place at random intervals.

 - Has a 25% chance to double the room drop, similar to Contract From Below.

The tears copy Isaac's stats and most tear effects.

column1: Coupon,I521,Allow 6 weeks for delivery,"While held, guarantees one item in every {{R
column2:
Shop}} will be on sale. On use, makes a random item in the current room free.",2,Coupon," - On use, makes a random item in the current room that costs money or hearts free.
 - While held, guarantees a random item or pickup from the Shop to be half price.
", - Using the Coupon in a Devil Room and taking that free item does not affect or remove the chances for Angel Rooms.
 - Using the Coupon in Greed Mode does not restock the taken item or consumable.
 - Using the Coupon in a Shop while holding Restock will not respawn a new item after taking the free one.
 - (Added in Repentance) Using the Coupon as The Lost or Tainted Lost allows multiple Devil deals to be taken.

column1:
Telekinesis,I522,Power of the mind,"Upon use, for the next two seconds, any enemy shots that come near Isaac are held in place. After the charge is depleted, they are fired back as tears.",1,Telekinesis," - Upon use, for the next three seconds, any enemy shots that come near Isaac are held in place. After the charge is depleted, they are fired back as tears.
  - The reflected tears always do 3.5 damage.
 - (Added in Repentance) Pushes enemies away for the duration of the item's usage.
"," - The tears can be rammed into enemies while they're held by Telekinesis. They won't disappear until the effect ends but do no further damage.
 - Catching shots from enemies that fire high into the air, like the Tube Worm, is very difficult and not beneficial; in the case of the Tube Worm, shots that are caught will just fall to the ground rather than be fired at enemies.
",True

Moving Box,I523,Pack and unpack,"If the box is empty, picks up all items and pickups in a room and stores them. If the box is not empty, places all stored items and pickups in the current room. ",1,Moving Box," - If the box is empty, it picks up items and pickups in a room and stores them.
  - (Added in Repentance) Moving Box can carry up to 10 items or pickups at once, randomly picked (i.e. items are not prioritized).
 - If the box is not empty, places all stored items and pickups in the current room.
"," - (Removed in Repentance) There is no limit to the number of items and pickups that can be held in the box.
 - Any stored items and pickups unpacked from Moving Box will remain identical to what was originally packed; pills, Cards and Runes
column2:
cards, and runes will stay the same, Sticky Nickels will remain stuck to the floor, and chests will have the same contents as they would if they had been opened immediately.
 - Active items keep their charge in the box.
 - Stealing from Shops and Devil Rooms is not possible; only items on pedestals will be packed up.
 - (Removed in Repentance) If used in a Challenge Room or Boss Challenge Room the objects within can be packed up without starting the challenge.
  - (Added in Repentance) Using Moving Box in these rooms starts the challenge.
 - If used in a room with a choice of multiple item pedestals, only one of the choice objects will be packed up and the rest behave normally.
  - (Removed in Repentance) Both items presented by There's Options and More Options can be taken.
  - (Removed in Repentance) Both The Polaroid and The Negative can be taken.
  - (Removed in Repentance) If used in the Boss Rush room, one of the objects is packed up but the rush is not started. The remaining item choices start the rush as normal.
   - (Added in Repentance) Using Moving Box to pack items in Boss Rush starts the challenge.
  - (Added in Repentance) Moving Box works normally in Death Certificate
column3:
n's area. Packing items in that special area won't activate the force-leaving mechanic.
 - All existing Moving Boxes share their opened/closed state. Therefore, it is not possible to carry a Moving Box that is holding items within another Moving Box as the items must be unpacked first.
 - (Added in Repentance) Disappearing pickups that are spawned by Tainted Magdalene / Soul of Magdalene
column4:
n or Tainted Keeper can't be packed into Moving Box.
",True

column1:
Jumper Cables,I520,Bloody recharge,Grants an active item charge every 15 enemies killed.,3,Jumper Cables, - Grants an active item charge every 15 enemies killed.
,,True

Technology Zero,I524,Static tears!,Connects Isaac's tears with electricity that can damage enemies.,3,Technology Zero," - Connects tears with electricity that damages enemies.
  - (Removed in Repentance) The electricity's damage is equal to Isaac's Damage.
  - (Added in Repentance) The electricity deals 30% of Isaac's Damage, 15 times per second.
  - A tear can generate one connection. The tear does not generate another connection even after the connection is lost. However, other tears can still make connections with it.
  - Each of Isaac's tears can connect to other allied tears Including those of shooting familiars.
   - The number of connections is limited by the number of Isaac's tears.
", - It will connect Jacob and Esau's tears regardless of which one picked up the item.
,True
Leprosy,I525,You're tearing me apart!,"Upon taking damage, grants a body part as an [[Familiar#Orbital Familiars
column2: orbital]], which blocks enemy shots and deals 7 damage per tick to enemies it comes in contact with. The orbitals will be destroyed if they take enough damage from enemies or enemy shots.",1,Leprosy," - Upon taking damage, Isaac gains a body part as an Familiar#Orbital Familiars
column3:
orbital, which blocks enemy shots and deals 7 damage per tick (35 damage per second) to enemies it comes in contact with.
  - A maximum of three body parts can be active at once.
  - The body parts will be destroyed after dealing 30 ticks of damage and/or blocking 3 shots.
  - The body parts persist between floors.
  - Body parts orbit on the same layer as Blue Fly
column4:
Blue Flies and Locusts do.
",,True

column1: 7 Seals,I526,Lil harbingers!,Spawns a random [[The Harbingers
column2: Harbinger]] [[familiar]] that changes every 10 seconds. Harbingers have different behaviors and spawn themed [[Locust]]s.,2,7 Seals," - Spawns a random The Harbingers
column3:
Harbinger familiar that changes every 10 seconds. All harbingers deal contact damage to enemies and periodically spawn locusts if Isaac currently doesn't have any, though each harbinger behaves slightly differently:
  - Famine wanders around the room, leaves a trail of slowing black creep, deals 0.5 contact damage per tick or 15 damage per second, and spawns Locust of Famine
column4:
yellow locusts every 3 seconds that deal double Isaac's damage and slows enemies.
  - Pestilence wanders around the room, leaves a trail of green creep that deals 1 damage per tick or 30 damage per second, deals 0.5 contact damage per tick or 15 damage per second, and spawns Locust of Pestilence
column5:
green locusts every 3 seconds that deal double Isaac's damage and poisons enemies, which deals double Isaac's damage over time.
  - War chases enemies, moves faster than the other Harbingers, deals 1.5 contact damage per tick or 45 damage per second, and spawns Locust of War
column6:
red locusts every 5 seconds which detonates upon impact with enemies, dealing double tear damage for the impact of the locust and 60 damage for the explosion. The explosion synergizes with multiple bomb related items.
  - Death chases enemies, deals 1.5 contact damage per tick or 45 damage per second, and spawns Locust of Death
column7:
black locusts every 3 seconds that deal quadruple Isaac's damage, applied as two hits of double damage.
  - Conquest wanders around the room, deals 0.5 contact damage per tick or 15 damage per second, and spawns two Locust of Conquest
column8:
white locusts at a time every 2 seconds that deal double Isaac's damage.
   - (Removed in Repentance) Conquest ignores the locust spawn timer.
"," - (Removed in Repentance)If Conquest is on top of an enemy when Isaac has no white locusts, it will spawn locusts at an incredibly high rate and deal a lot of damage.
 - If an enemy is large enough to stand on multiple segments of Pestilence's creep trail, the damage from each pool of creep will stack.
 - The locusts that War spawns can damage Isaac if they explode near him.
  - This makes it possible to gain multiple varying horsemen and gain all of their locusts at one time
",True

column1:
Mr. ME!,I527,Caaan do!,Summons a controllable ghost that can perform various tasks depending on what it targets.,3,Mr. ME!," - Summons a ghost near Isaac that will follow him around, and summons a controllable blue crosshair. After a few seconds, the crosshair disappears, and the ghost will act depending on what the crosshair was targeting:
  - Items / Pickups / Trinkets / Chests / Red Chests / Spiked Chests / Mega Chests: Brings it to Isaac. Works in Shops, Devil Rooms and Black Markets as well, making them effectively free. Stealing an item has a 50% chance to fail. If that happens, a buzzer sound will play out and the ghost will disappear without doing anything.
  - Locked Chests / Eternal Chests / Bomb Chests: Opens the chest for free.
  - Silver Button/Reward Plate: Presses the button.
  - Monsters
column2:
Enemies: Attacks the enemy until it dies or can no longer be targeted due to a form change or similar cause. The ghost does 3 damage per tick, for 9 damage per second.
  - Rooms#special%20rooms
column3:
Doors: Opens the door, even if it is locked. Functions the same as Dad's Key when being used in this way. This includes the door to Mega Satan, exiting Hush's room, and exiting Boss Rush.
   - {{dlc+
column4:
r}} This does not work on A Strange Door. However, it does work on doors leading to alternate path levels.{{dlc-}}
   - (Added in Repentance) This does not work on the flesh door leading to Mom's Heart that appears after defeating Mom in {{Stage
column5: Mausoleum}} or {{Stage
column6:
Gehenna}}.
   - (Added in Repentance) This does not work on the hidden closet in {{Stage
column7:
Home}} to unlock the tainted characters.
  - Secret Room entrances: Explodes, opening the entrance.
  - Destructible obstacles, shopkeepers, angel statues, Slot Machines, and Beggars: Explodes and destroys them.
"," - (Removed in Repentance) Stealing an item from a shop will restock it with another item. This happens even if Isaac does not have Restock
column8:
n.
  - (Added in Repentance) Stealing shop items will never restock them, even if Isaac '''does''' have Restock
column9:
n. This includes Greed Mode.
  - (Added in Repentance) Stealing from a black market will not restock items, as they work like devil deals.
 - Stealing a devil deal item will make Isaac able to pick it up for free. This allows Isaac to take free devil deals without losing the chance of an angel room appearing for that run.
 - (Added in Repentance) Allows The Lost to take more than one devil deal.
 - If the crosshair is not targeting anything when the crosshair disappears, the ghost will interact with the object closest to the crosshair.
  - This can be used to check for secret rooms on multiple walls at once.
 - If the room has nothing to interact with, the ghost will disappear without doing anything.
 - The ghost cannot pick up Sticky Nickels and will disappear upon touching them.
 - The ghost can press the button in Greed Mode, allowing waves to be stopped without taking damage.
 - The ghost can open chests in Challenge Rooms without triggering the room.
 - Unlike chests, stealing an item pedestal from a Challenge Room will trigger the waves to spawn upon picking up the stolen item.
 - In rooms with multiple pedestal items where only one can be taken, if the ghost is carrying a pedestal while Isaac picks up a different pedestal item, the ghost will disappear. This prevents taking both items for free.
 - Mr. Me can open the door to the {{Stage
column10: Mausoleum}} / {{Stage
column11:
Gehenna}} without paying hearts.
 - If used in an Angel Room with no item pedestals, Mr. ME! will target the angel statue, blowing it up.
 - Using Mr. ME! with Tainted Forgotten does not work as displayed. Mr. ME! will not follow the crosshair, instead it will target where the Forgotten is thrown.
 - Cannot steal the second item as Tainted Lazarus
column12:
r or with Flip.
",True

column1: Angelic Prism,I528,Eclipsed by the moon,Spawns an [[Familiar#Orbital Familiars
column2: orbital familiar]] with a large orbital radius. Tears that pass through the prism split into four multi-colored tears.,3,Angelic Prism, - Spawns an Familiar#Orbital Familiars
column3:
orbital familiar with a large orbital radius. Tears that pass through the prism split into four multi-colored tears.
, - It will also quadruple Familiar
column4:
shooting familiar tears.
,True

column1:
Pop!,I529,Eyeball tears!,"Replaces Isaac's tears with eyeballs that can bounce off of each other. The eyeballs are not limited by [[range]], and will instead dissipate when they stop moving or when hitting an enemy or obstacle.",2,Pop!," - Replaces Isaac's tears with eyeballs that can bounce off of each other.
 - Isaac's tears are no longer limited by range, and will instead dissipate when they stop moving or when hitting an enemy or obstacle.
 - (Added in Repentance) Eyeball tears will start to fall to the ground after bouncing off of each other 8 times.
",,True
Death's List,I530,Just hope you're not next...,Grants a [[pickup]] or [[Attributes
column2:
stat]] upgrade if all enemies in a room are killed in the order they are marked.,2,Death's List," - Upon entering a room, a skull appears over an enemy's head.
  - Killing the marked enemy will cause the skull to move to a different enemy.
  - If all enemies in the room are cleared in the order they are marked, Isaac gains one of the following rewards at random:
   - A Soul Heart, a pill, a Key, a Bomb, or a Nickel.
   - +0.2 speed, +0.5 range, (Removed in Repentance) +0.5 tears, (Added in Repentance) +0.5 fire rate, +0.2 shot speed, +1 flat damage, or +1 luck.
  - If a non-marked enemy is killed, the skull will disappear and no bonuses will be granted for that room.
"," - As long as the room is not cleared, Isaac can re-attempt a Death's List by leaving and re-entering.
 - The marked enemies are chosen in the same order in a given room, starting from the top-left corner with enemies that are vulnerable at their spawn time. If new enemies are spawned via Portals or on death, they are added to the end of the marked queue.
 - Bishops can shield the marked enemy unless frozen or petrified beforehand.
 - A room with no enemies that instead requires Silver Buttons to be pressed will also give a reward when cleared.
 - If a reward stat is chosen that is already at maximum, the sound effect and Isaac's thumbs up animation will play, but there is no other effect.
 - Bosses may also be marked.
 - If a Portal is marked and despawns, no other enemy will be marked and the bonus is lost.
 - Enemies that are not spawned when the room is entered (such as Angels from bombed Angel Statues and enemies in Challenge Rooms, Greed Mode, and Boss Rush) will not be marked.
 - In the Mom boss fight, each of Mom's body parts (eyes, foot, and hands) is considered as a different enemy, and Isaac has to kill the foot to get the bonus.
 - If the doors open automatically due to spending a long enough time in the room, any existing mark will disappear.
 - When playing as Tainted Jacob, Dark Esau can be marked by this item, and will be marked first if he is alive when you enter a room. This makes this item much less useful for Tainted Jacob.
 - Familiars, especially ones that passively or actively damage enemies of their own accord, may make killing enemies in order difficult, if not impossible.
 - Ace cards will kill the enemies in the correct order when possible.
 - If a Mr. Maw is marked, killing either part of its body will not forfeit Death's List, as the remaining enemy of said Mr. Maw will still be marked.
 - This item has little to no effect in Greed Mode.
 - Waiting for the [https://bindingofisaacrebirth.fandom.com/wiki/User:Blcd/RandomTidbits#Room_Anti-softlock Room Anti-softlock] to trigger will always grant a reward from Death's List.
",True

column1:
Haemolacria,I531,I'm seeing red...,"Tears are now fired in an arc. Upon hitting the floor, an obstacle, or an enemy, they burst into many smaller tears in all directions. Increases tear delay.",3,Haemolacria," - Tears are fired in an arc. Upon hitting the floor, an obstacle, or an enemy they burst into smaller tears in all directions.
  - The number of burst tears is random between 6-11 and they have equal chance.
  - The scattered tears deal random damage that is 50-83.33% of the main tear. On average, they deal 66% damage.
 - Tears down: {{Dlc
column3:
r}} Tear Delay Ã— 2 + 11.
  - {{Dlc
column4:
r}} The tear delay adjustment is applied after fire rate downs, before fire rate ups.
 - Increases damage by about 31%.
  - {{Dlc
column5:
r}} +1 damage and 1.5x damage multiplier.
 - {{Dlc
column6:
r}} Range down: 0.8x range multiplier.
"," - Higher shot speed lowers the arc of the main shot, whereas lower speed heightens it, resulting in a very minor change in effective range.
  - The split tears are affected normally by shot speed.
 - (Removed in Repentance) The tear falling speed stat is entirely ignored for both the main shot and the split tears.
 - The main tear has a roughly 1.71x size multiplier.
",True

column1: Lachryphagy,I532,Feed them!,"Isaac's tears decelerate as they travel. Upon stopping or hitting an obstacle, they burst into 8 tears in all directions. Tears can be fired into other tears to feed them, increasing their damage.",2,Lachryphagy," - Isaac's tears decelerate as they travel. Upon stopping or hitting an obstacle, they burst into (Removed in Repentance)8 tears {{Dlc
column2:
r}}5 to 8 tears, depending on tear size, in all directions.
  - Hitting an enemy will not cause them to burst.
 - Tears can be fired into other tears to feed them, increasing their damage and the damage of the burst tears.
  - If one tear is fed 5 other tears, it will immediately burst.
  - The tears will have their damage added together, with the first consumed tear giving additional damage.
  - Tears in the burst will deal half the damage the main tear would have.
  - This also applies to Familiar tears.
 - Tear bursting can also happen from sheer shot size. With sufficiently high damage or several tear-size increasing items, the tears will burst almost immediately after firing.
"," - Certain items that cause tears to split and feed each other, when combined, can cause the resulting tear to become so large that the game will crash. Use caution when using Lachryphagy with splitting tears.
",True

column1: Trisagion,I533,Smite thy enemy,Tears are replaced with [[Tear Effects#Piercing
column2: piercing]] white blasts of light that can damage the same enemy multiple times.,2,Trisagion," - Tears are replaced with Tear Effects#Piercing
column3:
piercing white blasts of light.
  - Blasts deal 33% of the regular Damage
column4:
tear damage, but can hit the same enemy multiple times.
   - Because of this, Tear Effects#Homing
column5:
Homing effects are incredibly powerful, allowing blasts to quickly stack on enemies and deal very high amounts of damage.
  - Blasts decrease in size until disappearing.
   - Despite the blasts decreasing in size after passing through obstacles, this is aesthetic as the blast will only damage enemies adjacent to the obstacle.
  - (Removed in Repentance) Blasts do not knock back enemies.
"," - Since the blasts can strike one enemy multiple times, low shot speed can be very beneficial whereas high shot speed may lower effective damage.
  - Walking backward while firing can allow tears to move slower, making it useful for increasing damage output.
 - Items that grant a high Tears rate, such as Soy Milk, can cause the light beams to significantly obstruct visibility, which can further be exacerbated by items such as Fruit Cake causing rapid color and size change.
 - With only Trisagion, Isaac with base stats will deal about 18 damage per second on an unmoving, gaper-sized enemy. 1.32 shot speed will reduce DPS to about 14.
",True

column1:
Schoolbag,I534,Extra active item room,Allows Isaac to hold two active items.,3,Schoolbag," - Allows Isaac to hold two active items.
  - Swap between active items by pressing the {{plat
column3: no break}} CTRL, {{plat
column4: PS4
column5: no break}} R2, {{plat
column6: Xbox
column7: no break}} RT, or {{plat
column8: Switch
column9:
no break}} ZR.
"," - The button to swap between active items is the same button used to swap between cards and pills.
 - Items in the secondary slot will recharge at the same rate as the primary item.
 - Items that grant temporary effects for the room, such as The Nail, may deactivate if switched with an item in the secondary slot.
 - The ? Card does not activate both active items.
 - While holding an active item that grants passive bonuses in the secondary slot, swapping the main slot item with a pedestal item may remove the bonuses. If this happens, Isaac can swap the bonus-granting item to the pedestal and pick it up again to regain them.
 - The swap key must be pressed twice if playing as The Forgotten.
 - This item cannot be unlocked if the player encounters more than one {{cu
column10:
xl}} in Chapters 1-3, except by chance of finding Silver Dollar, Forget Me Now, or a 5-pip Dice Room.
  - If ''one'' Curse of the Labyrinth is encountered, getting to ??? and entering the Shop there will unlock the Schoolbag.
 - (Added in Repentance) If Tainted Isaac drops Schoolbag, the 2nd active item in the player's inventory is destroyed. However, a duplicate active item spawns beside Schoolbag. Tainted Isaac's reroll ability applies to this new item, and the player can choose between the original active item or a new item. Picking up the original active item again will count as another item towards any transformation.
 - {{Dlc
column11:
r}} In ""True"" Co-op, when a player dies with this item, they will drop one of their active items if they have two. It is unknown if this is a bug or intended interaction.
",True

column1: Blanket,I535,You feel Safe,"Grants one {{E
column2:
Soul Heart}}. Upon entering a boss room, grants a shield that blocks one hit, then disappears.",2,Blanket," - Heals one Red Heart.
 - Grants one Soul Heart.
 - Upon entering a Boss Room, grants a shield that blocks one hit, then disappears.
"," - If the shield is not broken before leaving the room or entering the next floor, it will disappear by itself.
 - Reentering a boss room after the boss has been defeated will still grant a shield.
 - Multiple Blankets will only give 1 shield.
 - In Greed Mode, this item grants a shield only for the two boss fights on the final level. The shield does not activate for the regular boss waves on previous floors.
 - To quickly unlock this item, keep restarting Greed mode to enter its Curse Room which occasionally contains a bed.
",True

column1: Sacrificial Altar,I536,He demands a sacrifice,Sacrifices up to 2 [[familiar]]s and spawns an item for each familiar sacrificed. Converts all friendly [[Familiar#Blue Spiders
column3:
flies]] into [[coins]]. ,2,Sacrificial Altar," - Upon use, sacrifices up to 2 familiars and spawns an item for each familiar sacrificed.
  - The order in which the familiars were obtained does not matter; it picks 2 at random to sacrifice.
  - If Isaac has no familiars, no Blue Fly
column4:
Blue Flies, and no Blue Spiders, the item will do nothing and will not be consumed.
   - Even if Isaac doesn't have any familiars, if he has a single fly, spider, or locust, the item will be consumed.
 - The list of possible rewards include:
  - 7 Seals
  - Abaddon
  - Athame

column1:
Lil Spewer,I537,Puking buddy,"Drops a random [[pill]], and spawns a [[familiar]] that charges up and fires [[creep]]. Using pills changes the creep type.",1,Lil Spewer," - Spawns a random pill.
 - Spawns a small Spewer familiar that charges up and fires different types of creep.
 - The familiar and his creep change randomly when Isaac uses a pill.
 - Possible creep includes:
  - A line of damaging green creep that deals 0.4 damage per tick (12 damage per second).
  - A long line of slowing black creep.
  - A line of short-lasting, damaging red creep, with a larger puddle of creep at the end that lasts longer. The creep will deal 1.2 damage per tick (36 damage per second).
  - A short-ranged cone of damaging yellow creep that grows larger and deals more damage the further it travels. It deals 2 damage per tick at the lowest range, and increases to 15.2 damage per tick at the furthest (~6-47 damage per second, based on range).
  - A large ring of long-lasting slowing white creep.
", - Lil Spewer always starts with green creep.
 - The familiar does not do contact damage.
,True

Marbles,I538,Choking hazard,"Spawns 3 random [[trinket]]s, 5% chance to swallow held trinket after taking damage, gaining its effect permanently.",2,Marbles," - Spawns 3 random trinkets.
 - Taking damage has a 5% chance to swallow Isaac's currently held trinket, gaining its effect permanently, similar to Smelter.
"," - If activated while carrying two trinkets, both will be swallowed.
 - Trinkets swallowed via Marbles will not be removed or rerolled by items such as the D4.
 - Perfection is still lost after Isaac takes damage from regular sources.
",True

room]].",1,Mystery Egg," - Spawns an egg familiar, which cracks and turns into a random friendly enemy when Isaac is hurt.
  - The egg regenerates upon entering a different room.
"," - The usefulness of the enemy depends on how many rooms have been cleared without getting hurt.
  - For Greed Mode
column3:
Greed Mode and Greedier Mode, the usefulness of the enemy is based on waves cleared rather than rooms.
 - The list of available monsters is as follows:

tear damage]] to all enemies in a small area.",2,Flat Stone," - Tears bounce off the floor.

tear damage.

column1:
Slipped Rib,I542,Projectile shield,Spawns a bone [[familiar]] that circles around Isaac and reflects enemy shots.,2,Slipped Rib," - Spawns a bone familiar that circles around Isaac and reflects enemy shots.
  - {{Dlc
column2:
nr}} The reflected projectiles deal 5 damage if they would've hurt Isaac for half a heart, and 10 for a full heart.
  - {{Dlc
column3:
r}} The reflected projectiles deal 6 damage if they would've hurt Isaac for half a heart, and 7 for a full heart.
  - Enemy damage modification from item effects or by stage does not affect the reflected damage.
  - Reflected projectiles do not gain Tear effects from Isaac.
 - The familiar does not deal contact damage, but kills the same types of flies on contact as Pretty Fly orbitals do.
"," - Projectiles that create other projectiles (e.g. Shady) can harm Isaac and be reflected.
 - Homing projectiles (e.g. from Psychic Horf) do not retain their homing effect after being reflected.
 - Slipped Rib can reflect:
  - Explosive projectiles (e.g. from Gurgle), which explode as normal.
  - Fireballs (e.g. from Crackle), and their lines of fire do not harm Isaac.
  - Fire projectiles (e.g. from Mega Satan).
  - Obstacles thrown by Polty or Kineti, dealing a flat 35 damage.
 - Slipped Rib does not reflect:
  - Lasers or beams.
  - Lines of fire from fireballs.
  - Projectiles from Big Bony, Coal Boy, Danny.
",True

r}} The aura also increases damage by 20% and gives [[homing]].",1,Hallowed Ground," - Spawns a white poop familiar, which turns into a White Poop when Isaac is hurt.
  - White Poop has an aura that increases tear fire rate and has a high chance to block damage like the Cone Head item.

homing effect.

column7: r}} This item belongs to the {{transf

Oh Crap}} set. Collecting three items from this set will transform Isaac into a walking pile of poop.
"," - Aligning a white poop to drop next to a Devil Beggar, a Blood Donation Machine or a Confessional is a great way to save on health, as the aura will allow for frequent free plays.
 - White Poop is impervious to enemy shots and charging attacks.
 - White Poop is not immune to explosive damage or stomping attacks.
 - Chubber attacks cannot destroy White Poop, but can still harm Isaac.

n's boss arena.

n}}.",3,Book of the Dead," - When used, spawns one of the following for each enemy already killed in the current room:
  - An orbital bone familiar (very common).
  - A friendly Bony (uncommon).
  - (Added in Repentance) A friendly Bone Fly
column10:
n (uncommon).

column12:
n (rare).
   - The chance to spawn Revenants is greatly increased in Mausoleum / Gehenna / Sheol / Dark Room.

column14:
item}}
"," - Orbital bones deal contact damage equal to Isaac's damage at the time it was spawned and repel enemies that touch them.
  - (Removed in Repentance) They block 3 shots or deal 2 ticks of contact damage before being destroyed.
 - (Removed in Repentance) Bonies deal 8.3 contact damage and 5 damage with thrown bones.
  - (Added in Repentance) Bonies deal 8.7 contact damage and 6 damage with thrown bones.
 - Black Bonies will explode on death, dealing 40 damage to enemies it hits. The explosion will not hurt Isaac, (Removed in Repentance) but will knock him back.
 - Internally, the Book tracks each position an enemy was killed at in the current room, and uses those locations as spawn points for bone orbitals and Bonies; using the book gives a
  - high probability
  - for each location to give one of them.
  - If one of these locations doesn't give a bone orbital or bony, it can still give one if the book is used in the same room without leaving. However, once a location gives something, it cannot do so again.
 - Using the book in a room that had no enemies or was re-entered does nothing and expends the charge.
 - Orbital bones occupy the same area around Isaac as Blue Fly
column15:
Blue Flies, meaning Isaac can have an incredibly dense ring of bone orbitals around him that nullifies most attacks.
 - Friendly monsters killed in the current room can also be used by Book of the Dead.

 - Frozen enemies (enemies killed by uranus, cube baby, etc.) will not summon bone familars unless their frozen bodies are shattered.

column1: Mom's Shovel,I552,Lost but not forgotten,Creates a trapdoor that leads to the next floor upon activation. Unlocks {{c

column3:
Dark Room}}.,4,," - Upon activation, creates a trapdoor that leads to the next floor or to a Crawl Space, identical to We Need to Go Deeper!.
 - Using this on a dirt patch that appears in Grave Rooms in Dark Room will unlock The Forgotten.
  - Once the Forgotten is unlocked, digging into dirt patches will instead spawn a random type of Chest.
"," - It is possible to unlock The Forgotten even if The Negative has not yet been unlocked by teleporting straight to the dark room via a Sacrifice Room.
 - Does nothing when used on ???, Sheol, Cathedral, Dark Room (except in a Grave Room), Chest, The Void, or (Added in Repentance) Home.
 - Once Mom's Shovel is complete, the stomping caused by Broken Shovel 1 stops.
 - Unlike the Broken Shovel, Mom's Shovel will not disappear if it is left on a pedestal, and Isaac leaves and re-enters the room it was left in.
 - Like We Need to Go Deeper!, this item can be used to destroy rocks if used while Isaac is flying over a rock.
 - {{dlc+
column4:
r}} This item can be obtained by using Spindown Dice on Mucormycosis without obtaining the Broken Shovels.
 - {{dlc+
column5:
r}} The full Mom's Shovel can be found within the area of Death Certificate. Even without unlocking the item, it can be crafted with the Bag of Crafting using 8 Bone Hearts, and its effect can potentially be activated by Metronome.
",True

column1:
Book of Virtues,I584,Spiritual companionship,"On use, spawns a destroyable orbiting Wisp [[familiar]] that fires tears and deals contact damage. Also acts as a passive item that causes other active items to spawn themed Wisps.",3,Book of Virtues," - On use, spawns a wisp that orbits Isaac and fires small spectral tears alongside him. The wisps can block shots and deals contact damage to enemies, but take damage when doing so and will be destroyed when enough damage is taken.
  - When a wisp is destroyed, the sound of fire being extinguished plays.
   - A normal wisp is white and blue, has 2 health and spectral tears which deal 1.6-2.4 damage, and is summoned in the middle ring.
   - A wisp's health can be represented by its size, shrinking as its health decreases.
   - Most wisps deal contact damage equal to 2x Isaac's damage. Doing damage this way usually destroys the wisp unless Isaac is Temporary Buffs
column2:
invulnerable.
  - Multiple wisps can exist at once. Some combinations have an upper limit of 26 wisps: an inner counterclockwise ring of 6, a middle clockwise ring with 8, and an outer counterclockwise ring of 12.
 - If another active item is picked up, Book of Virtues will become a passive item that causes active items to spawn wisps when used, often with Wisps.xml
column3:
special effects.
 - While held, changes the first Devil Room encountered to be an Angel Room, and increases the chance of an Angel Room appearing by 25%.
  - Allows for Angel Rooms to appear even if a Deal with the Devil was taken before.
 - {{transf
column4: Bookworm
column5:
item}}
"," - Bethany starts with this item.
 - It is the only passive item in the Library (Item Pool)
column6:
library pool.
  - If Isaac walks into a library for the first time with NO!, The Book of Virtues is very likely to appear.
  - Because of this, when acquired from a library the book cannot be rerolled by use of the D4, D100, a Dice Room, or getting hit as Tainted Eden.
 - Whenever Isaac is Temporary Buffs
column7:
invulnerable the wisps are as well, but can still deal damage.
 - Summoning a wisp while at the maximum will replace the most damaged wisp.
 - While having 100% chance of Angel Room discovery, Isaac will not get teleported to a Devil Room by using some items which allow it. Instead, he will be teleported to the Angel Room, keeping his 100% chance of discovering Angel Room. This can be used to get to Angel Room on the first floor, where naturally Devil/Angel Rooms do not spawn, and still keep the 100% chance for the next floor.
 - This item's passive effects also apply to active items in the consumable slot. (e.g. Tainted Bethany's Lemegeton, Tainted Jacob's Anima Sola, etc.)
 - While the item can function as both passive and active item, it is treated as a passive item by NO!, Void and XVII - The Stars?
column8:
n.
 - This item is displayed in the Extra HUD as a passive item.
  - It will take up one of Tainted Isaac's limited item slots.
",True

room, up to a maximum of 5. These familiars do not follow Isaac.

column1:
Mucormycosis,I553,Spore shot,"Gives Isaac the chance to fire spore tears that stick to enemies and blow up after a few seconds, dealing damage and [[poison]]ing nearby enemies and releasing more spores.",3,," - Gives Isaac a 25% chance to shoot a spore that, in addition to dealing damage, will stick to enemies.
  - The chance is not affected by Luck.https://docs.google.com/spreadsheets/d/15K8Xgxoxdx68AIaxuLXgZoJJlG36UPgy3_aeDpAM5tU/edit?usp=sharing

homing.

item}}

2Spooky,I554,4me,Enemies near Isaac are afflicted with [[fear]].,2,,," - 2Spooky can be used to manipulate Ultra Greed. Once Greed Gapers spawn and Ultra Greed is in his resistance stance, the gapers will be feared when getting close, leaving the boss unable to move or damage Isaac.
",True

Eye Sore,I558,More eyes,Causes Isaac to occasionally fire extra tears in random directions while shooting.,2,," - When Isaac shoots, he has a chance to fire 1-3 additional tears in random directions.
  - The chance to fire extra tears is unaffected by luck.
",,True

120 Volt,I559,Zap!,Repeatedly zaps enemies that are close to Isaac.,2,," - Repeatedly zaps enemies that are in close proximity to Isaac with electricity beams for light damage.
  - Enemies can be zapped up to five times per second, with each zap dealing 0.75x Isaac's damage.
  - Each zap can hit up to 4 enemies, if they are sufficiently close to each other.
  - If the floor is wet, such as in Downpour, Flooded Caves, some rooms in Dross and Scarred Womb, as well as under the effect of Flush!, the initial distance is unchanged, but enemy-to-enemy arcs reach further.
  - Trigger range appears to be approximately two tiles wide - It's possible to zap an enemy standing directly on the other side of a rock.
"," - This item has a brief targeting delay, such that enemies can close in and touch Isaac before they start getting zapped.
 - All friendly monsters (from Book of the Dead, Delirious, Poke Go, etc.) are targeted by 120 Volt as well, and while they don't receive damage from it, zaps can be chained through them to regular enemies that do take damage potentially increasing the range zaps reach from Isaac.
",True

It Hurts,I560,No it doesn't...,Releases a ring of tears and increases [[fire rate]] for the current room when Isaac takes damage.,1,," - Taking damage causes Isaac to release a ring of 10 tears and gain tears up for the current room.
  - The first hit taken increases Isaac's tears fired per second by 1.2, then by 0.4 for every subsequent hit in the same room. This ignores the tears cap and can stack indefinitely.
  - Each tear in the ring deals 10 damage and doesn't use Isaac's tear effects.
",,True

Almond Milk,I561,DMG down + tears up + you feel nutty,"Quadruples [[fire rate]], with x0.3 [[damage]] multiplier. Tears are given random worm trinket effects.",1,," - Quadruples fire rate.
 - x0.3 damage multiplier.
 - -0.16 tear size.
 - Tears gain random worm trinket effects, as well as some item effects such as Rubber Cement, My Reflection and Tiny Planet.
",,True

Rock Bottom,I562,It's only up from there,Locks Isaac's [[attributes]] to their highest values reached.,3,Rock Bottom," - Upon pickup and from then onwards, locks attributes to their best values reached.
 - The true values of Isaac's stats are still calculated normally, but the best values will override them.
"," - Health downs do not count as stat downgrades for Rock Bottom.
 - Temporary buffs work normally, though they may make reaching new best values harder after the buff has worn off.
  - For example, using The Book of Belial to gain +2 damage will stay in effect indefinitely, but while it's not currently activated, Isaac must earn more than +2 damage from other items to see a difference.
  - Stacking as many temporary buffs at once as possible may be helpful to reach particularly high values.
  - Temporary positive multipliers are ''not'' retained, only the values reached through them are.
 - Stat penalties are accounted for, causing increased difficulty of reaching new best values.
  - Optimally, any available increases to a particular stat should be taken before taking the item that lowers it.
  - Permanent negative multipliers, such as Soy Milk works as expected: after the internal damage value is dropped to 0.2x, it would require over 5x increase in damage from other items and effects afterwards to start increasing the best value again.
 - If Rock Bottom is removed, Isaac's stats will no longer be locked and return to match his current items/effects.
",True
Nancy Bombs,I563,Random blast +5 bombs,Gives Isaac +5 {{E
column2:
bomb}}s and gives his bombs random bomb synergies.,1,," - Grants 5 bombs.
 - Causes Isaac's bombs to gain the effects of 1-4 random bomb synergies (most commonly 1).
  - Aside from normal bomb synergy items, this also includes Bob's Bladder, Strange Attractor and Golden Bombs (golden bombs will not be free).
"," - Nancy Bombs cannot give the effects of Mr. Mega, Rocket in a Jar, or Giga Bombs.
 - Even though Nancy Bombs can grant the Fast Bombs synergy, this will have no effect on the bomb placement speed. It will, however, disallow that bomb to knock back other bombs.
",True

column1:

 - +0.2 Shot Speed.
,,True

Blood Puppy,I565,What a cute little thing!,"Spawns a [[familiar]] that chases enemies. After killing enough enemies, it becomes more powerful but will also try to hurt Isaac. Attacking it returns it to normal.",1,Blood Puppy," - Spawns a familiar that chases nearby enemies and deals 2 contact damage to them per tick (~8.57 per second).
 - After killing 15 enemies, Blood Puppy becomes angry, and changes in the following ways:
  - Deals 7.5 damage per tick instead of 2 (15 per second, or 90 per second while charging).
  - Charges at enemies that are aligned with it in the cardinal directions.
   - If Blood Puppy charges into a live bomb, it will get caught on its mouth, preventing it from moving until it explodes.
  - Drops a half red heart for every 10 enemies it kills.
  - Will also try to attack Isaac, dealing a half heart of contact damage to him.
  - Can be damaged by Isaac, returning it to normal after it takes enough damage. Blood Puppy has 20 health and 90 Damage_Scaling
column2:
Armor (effective health is ~140-180).
 - After getting 25 more kills (40 total), the angry version evolves, gaining the following modifications:
  - Becomes much larger and deals 15 damage per tick instead of 7.5 (30 per second, or 180 per second while charging).
  - Destroys obstacles it runs into while charging.
  - Deals a full heart of damage to Isaac instead of half a heart.
  - Drops a red heart after every 10 kills instead of a half red heart.
  - Has 50 health instead of 20 (effective health is ~400-500).
 - Each boss killed by Blood Puppy counts as killing 4 enemies.
"," - Blood Puppy appears in the Bestiary as a type of monster, if Isaac turns it back to normal after it becomes angry. This is required to complete the Bestiary.
 - Blood Puppy is not targeted by other familiars while it is angry.
  - Blue Fly
column3:
Blue Flies and other familiars that deal contact damage will still damage Blood Puppy if they happen to collide.
 - Since bombs ignore armor, a single bomb will tame the Blood Puppy.
 - Stages 2 and 3 of Blood Puppy are an enemy for all intents and purposes, similar to Dark Esau. This means it can be affected by, for example, the slow effect of Broken Watch.
 - Friendly Blood Puppies will spawn beside Isaac when he enters a new room, while hostile ones will spawn in the middle or opposite ends of the room.
 - Starting the Mega Satan or Dogma fight while Blood Puppy is angry can be dangerous, as it will let Blood Puppy attack Isaac while he is unable to move during the boss's spawning animation.
",True

column1: Dream Catcher,I566,Sweet dreams,"During the transition between floors, Isaac's nightmare shows the contents of the  upcoming floor's {{r
column2: Treasure Room}}, as well as the floor's [[boss]]. Grants a {{E
column3: Half soul heart
column4:
