n}} when entering a new floor.",2,," - During the transition between floors, Isaac's nightmare shows the item that will be found in the Treasure Room and what Boss will be at the end of the floor.
  - {{cu
column5:
Blind}} items will be revealed, as well as the hidden second item on the alternate floors (Downpour, etc.)
 - Grants a Half Soul Heart upon entering a new floor (this includes each floor of the Ascent).
"," - On {{cu
column6:
XL}} floors, both items and bosses are shown.
 - If the floor Isaac is going to has no Treasure Rooms, Dream Catcher will simply show the floor's boss. If there are no Treasure Rooms or bosses on the floor (i.e. in {{Stage
column7: The Shop}}, {{Stage
column8: Ultra Greed}}, and {{Stage
column9:
Home}}), the dream will instantly be skipped.
 - Dream Catcher cannot show glitched items generated by TMTRAINER. Instead, it will just show The Sad Onion.
 - Dream Catcher will show a poop in the Treasure Room if there are no item pedestals in the room.
 - On {{Stage
column10: Corpse}} II, the boss will appear as a blank space; on the special {{Stage
column11: Mausoleum}}/{{Stage
column12: Gehenna}} II floor that leads to {{Stage
column13:
Home}}, it will appear as Mom.
 - On {{Stage
column14:
The Void}}, the Dream Catcher will show all the bosses that can be found in the various boss rooms, starting with Delirium.
",True

column1:
Paschal Candle,I567,Keep the flame burning,Gives Isaac a [[familiar]] that grants +0.4 [[Fire Rate]] for each consecutive room he's cleared without taking damage. The bonus stacks up to five times.,3,," - Gives Isaac a candle familiar that grants a Fire Rate bonus of +0.4 for each room cleared in a row without taking damage, which stacks up to 5 times (Max. +2 Fire Rate), represented by how brightly the flame burns. Starts at 1 stack, and resets to zero if damage is taken.
"," - The Fire Rate bonus can exceed the normal Fire Rate cap.
  - Any self-damage, such as from Curse Rooms, Sacrifice Rooms, the Bad Trip pill, spiked chests, and self-damaging items such as IV Bag, won't reset the bonus.
 - Clearing waves in Greed Mode will give the candle charges as if you cleared rooms.
",True

Divine Intervention,I568,Double tap shield,Double tapping a fire key creates a shield that pushes away enemies and reflects enemy projectiles and lasers.,2,Divine Intervention," - Double tapping a fire key creates a Divine Shield that slowly moves in the chosen direction.
 - The Divine Shield has a variety of effects.
  - Enemies are pushed back in the opposite direction, completely reversing their trajectory with some added momentum.
   - If they hit a wall or obstacle while being pushed, they take 10 damage and deal 10 damage to enemies they hit. The damages are increased by 2 for each floor.
  - Enemy tears are reflected, dealing damage back to enemies depending on the source of the tear.
   - The reflected projectiles deal 6 damage if they would've hurt Isaac for half a heart, and 7 for a full heart.
   - Reflected projectiles do not gain Tear effects from Isaac.
    - Explosive projectiles (e.g. from Gurgle) explode as normal, dealing as much damage they would've.
    - Projectiles that create other projectiles (e.g. Shady) can harm Isaac and be reflected.
    - Homing projectiles (e.g. from Psychic Horf) do not retain their homing effect after being reflected.
   - Can reflect:
    - Fire projectiles (e.g. from Mega Satan).
    - Obstacles thrown by Polty or Kineti, dealing a flat 35 damage.
   - Does not reflect:
    - Lines of fire (e.g. from Dragon Fly), but can reflect fireballs (e.g. from Crackle) and their lines of fire do not harm Isaac.
    - Projectiles from Big Bony, Coal Boy, Danny.
  - Enemy Brimstone lasers are reflected, dealing 7 damage per tick (105 damage per second) to enemies hit by the reflection. It can even deflect the colossal brimstone laser fired by The Beast.
   - White beams, such as those used by Dogma in its second phase, are reflected into holy beams similar to those fired by Revelation.
 - The shield lasts 1 second, and has a cooldown of 3 seconds.
 - {{transf
column3:
item}}
"," - If any charged item is obtained along with Divine Intervention e.g. Brimstone or Revelation, a different fire key may be pressed to put out the shield without forfeiting the charge of said item.
",True

column1: Free Lemonade,I578,Party time!,Creates a large pool of [[Creep#Yellow Creep
column2: yellow creep]] beneath Isaac.,1,, - Spawns Creep#Yellow Creep
column3:
a pool of Lemonade similar to the Lemon Party pill effect underneath Isaac.
  - The creep deals 8 damage per tick (24 per second) and lasts ~19 seconds.
,,True

column1: Blood Oath,I569,Bleed me dry,"Stabs Isaac at the beginning of each floor, draining his {{E
column2: red heart}}s. Increases [[damage]] and [[speed]] for the floor based on the amount drained.",2,," - Spawns a familiar that stabs Isaac at the beginning of each Chapters
column3:
floor if Isaac has more than a half red heart. This drains as much red health as possible without killing him, leaving a half red heart if Isaac only had red health, or none at all if Isaac has soul/black/bone hearts.
 - Although the animation is only a single stab when the effect is triggered, it's treated as taking damage one time per half heart lost. This can lead to synergies with items that activate upon taking damage.
 - For the rest of the floor, Isaac gains about +(0.15
 - HeartsLost ^ 2) damage and +(0.1
 - HeartsLost) speed, where HeartsLost is the total hearts of damage taken from Blood Oath (half a heart counts as 0.5).
  - This amounts to a max of +20 damage and +1.15 speed if starting the floor with 12 filled hearts (of which only 11.5 are drained).
   - This increases to +21.8 and +1.2 if starting the floor with 12 filled hearts, at least one being a Bone Heart.
"," - The damage from Blood Oath can be avoided with invincibility, but will not provide any damage and speed increase.
 - Eternal hearts give the health up before Blood Oath stabs Isaac, so the new heart is also drained.
 - XI - Strength can be activated at the start of a floor before Blood Oath triggers to have one more heart counted in the bonus.
 - If Isaac has half a red heart or less, the effect will not trigger, even if Isaac has soul/black hearts.
 - Blood Oath also drains the health of Keeper / Tainted Keeper, leaving their health at one health coin.
 - The damage caused by Blood Oath does not lower the chance for a Devil Room or Angel Room to appear.
 - While playing as The Forgotten, red health will not be drained if The Soul is being controlled when Blood Oath triggers.
 - If Blood Oath is removed (such as with Tainted Isaac), any existing damage and speed bonuses will remain until the next floor.
  - The damage and speed bonuses '''are''' removed after defeating The Lamb and refusing a Victory Lap.
 - Upon getting stabbed, any items that trigger upon getting hit will activate multiple times depending on the number of hearts drained.
 - Rotten hearts are only counted as half a red heart each.
",True

column1: Playdough Cookie,I570,Tasty rainbow,Grants multicolored tears. Each color comes with a different [[Status Effects
column3:
tear]] effect.,3,," - Every tear has a different color and different corresponding effect. These following effects can be granted:
  - Light Brown: None
  - Green: Poison
  - Yellow: Fear
  - Blue: chance for Proptosis tears
   - Unlike Proptosis, it starts at x1 damage rather than x3, effectively making it a damage down.
  - Light Blue: Slow, and Freeze on kill
  - Pink: Charm
  - Red: double damage, Fire Mind, '''or''' Petrification
column4:
Petrify (cannot proc at the same time)
  - Purple: Homing
  - Dark Orange: Mark
"," - The color of the tears from Playdough Cookie are not based on luck, but their individual effects are. (e.g. Red Fire Mind tears will always explode at 13 Luck.)
",True

column1: Orphan Socks,I571,Speed up + your feet feel stronger,Prevents [[creep]] and floor [[spikes]] from damaging Isaac. Also gives Isaac +0.3 [[speed]] and 2 {{E
column2:
soul heart}}s.,2,, - Gives Isaac +0.3 speed and 2 soul hearts.
 - Isaac becomes immune to spikes and creep.
," - Does not prevent damage from Curse Room doors, spiked chests, or Rocks#Spiked Rocks
column3:
spiked rocks but does protect against spiked rock bridges.
 - Does not prevent use of a Sacrifice Room.
",True

column1:
Eye of the Occult,I572,DMG up + range up + controlled tears,"Isaac's tears are now controlled mid-flight with tear controls. Also increases [[damage]] and [[range]], but decreases [[shot speed]].",3,," - Isaac's tears are now controlled mid-flight with tear controls instead of moving on their own, similarly to the controlled tear given by The Ludovico Technique.
 - +1 damage.
 - +2.0 range.
 - -0.16 shot speed.
 - {{transf
column3:
item}}
"," - The flight duration of tears is determined by the Range
column4:
range stat.
 - Items which use charge mechanics (like Chocolate Milk, Cursed Eye or Monstro's Lung) require precise input to be able to both charge the shot and then move the tears, making it significantly harder to control.
  - Beams and lasers like Brimstone are unaffected by this.
 - ''MouseControl=1'' enabled via the options.ini file does not allow the player to control the tears by mouse. Synergies which add a crosshair, however, will allow the tears to be controlled by mouse normally. (Further detail on valid synergies below)
 - This item grants Isaac immunity from the R U a Wizard? pill effect.
",True

column1:
Immaculate Heart,I573,Halo of tears,Adds one Red [[Heart Container]] and fully restores health. x1.2 [[damage]] multiplier. Isaac will occasionally fire extra tears that orbit around him.,3,," - Isaac will frequently fire extra spectral tears that orbit around him until they hit the ground, similar to Tiny Planet. These tears mimic Isaac's in most cases.
 - x1.2 damage multiplier. This multiplier does not stack with multiple Immaculate Hearts.
 - Adds one Red Heart Container and fully replenishes Isaac's health.
 - {{transf
column3:
item}}
",,True

column1:
Monstrance,I574,Purifying light,Isaac gains an aura that deals damage to enemies inside it.,2,," - Gives Isaac a large pulsing aura around him that deals damage to enemies inside of it.
  - The aura deals more damage the closer enemies are to Isaac, ranging from 0.4 on the edge up to 3.9 + 0.3
 - floor damage.
  - The aura deals damage up to 8 times per second.
",,True

The Intruder,I575,Invasive friend,"A [[familiar]] burrows in Isaac's head, firing 4 [[slow]]ing tears. Upon taking damage, there's a chance it will burst out of Isaac's head, spawning [[Familiar#Blue Spiders
column2:
blue spiders]] and chasing enemies for the current room.",3,," - Gives Isaac a spider familiar that burrows in Isaac's head, firing four slowing tears in addition to Isaac's normal tears.
  - The slowing tears deal 1.5 damage each, and fired every 1.5 seconds.
  - These tears are unaffected by Isaac's damage and tears stats; they have fixed damage and fire rate.
 - Upon taking damage, there is a chance that Isaac's head will pop, spawning Familiar#Blue Spiders
column3:
friendly spiders, and release the Intruder familiar, who will leap at enemies to deal contact damage, and fires four slowing tears towards nearby enemies instead of Isaac.
  - The spider familiar deals up to 4.5 contact damage depending on how fast it's moving and fires slowing tears twice as fast compared to when it's in Isaac's head.
  - The chance for activation goes up to 100% at 4 luck.
  - The familiar lasts for the current room, and Isaac's head is reattached upon entering a new room.
 - {{transf
column4: Spider Baby
column5:
item}}
"," - The Intruder is treated as a familiar even while in Isaac's head, and benefits from familiar synergies while in it.
 - If The Intruder is released after The Pinking Shears are used, control is given back to an invisible head with only a shadow visible. This is due to both the head (the spider) and the body being mobilized to attack.
",True

column1: Dirty Mind,I576,Filthy friends,Destroying [[Poops
column3:
Dip Familiars]] that follow Isaac and damage enemies. Destroying different types of poop spawns different Dips with special effects.,2,Dirty Mind," - Converts all enemy Dips and Drips into Dip familiars.
 - Rocks have a chance to be replaced with poop when generated.
 - Destroying poops spawn 1-4 Familiar#Dips
column4:
Dip Familiars, which loosely follow Isaac around, block enemy shots, and deal contact damage to enemies.
  - Dips deal contact damage to enemies equal to the damage Isaac had at the time it spawned, and can deal up to 2 ticks of contact damage and/or block 2 shots before dying.
 - Destroying different types of poop will spawn special Dips:
  - Corny Poops create Corny Dips that spawn 1 Blue Fly on death.
   - Brownie Dips spawned by Brownie and Dangle have the same behavior.
  - Red Poops create Red Dips that deal twice as much damage and autonomously charge at enemies, but automatically die after 15 seconds.
  - Golden Poops create Gold Dips that have a chance to inflict the Midas' Touch effect on enemies they hit. They can also take 5 hits before being destroyed.
  - Rainbow Poops create Rainbow Dips that charm enemies they hit and have a chance to drop a half red heart on death.
  - Black Poops create Black Dips that leave a trail of slowing creep.
  - White Poops create White Dips that recreate the effect of Hallowed Ground and can take 3 hits before being destroyed.
 - Poops unique to Tainted ??? and IBS also spawn Dips with special effects:
  - Stone Poops create Rock Dips that deal an additional 3.5 damage per hit and can take 6 hits before dying instead of 2.
  - Stinky Poops create Stinky Dips that release toxic gas as they move and a larger cloud of toxic gas when they die.
   - The toxic gas does 0.5x Isaac's damage per tick (~1.2x Isaac's damage per second) and poisons enemies; clouds left behind while alive last 1.5 seconds and the cloud created on death lasts 8 seconds.
  - Fire Poops create Flaming Dips that Status_Effects#Burn
column5:
burn enemies they hit and leave behind a fire when they die.
   - The burn deals 3.5 damage up to 6 times, and the fire deals 8 damage at full durability, 6 after taking 1 hit, and 4 otherwise, for a maximum of 22 damage.
 - {{transf
column6: Oh Crap
column7:
item}}
"," - The familiars are destroyed by bombs, making them very easy to destroy when trying to blow up walls or rocks.
 - Familiars remain if this item is lost (re-rolled, etc)
 - Enemies that charge towards Isaac, such as Gurdy Jr., can deflect off of friendly Dips in unpredictable directions.
",True

column1: Spirit Sword,I579,Divine blade,"Instead of tears, Isaac swings a sword. Charging does a spin attack and fires a projectile, and a projectile is sometimes fired with normal swings if Isaac has no empty {{E
column3:
display=Red Heart Containers}}.",3,Spirit Sword," - Replaces Isaac's tears with a sword he can swing in front of him.
  - The swing does 3x Isaac's damage +3.5 and deals knockback to both enemies and Isaac if it hits.
  - The sword can be swung as rapidly as the fire button can be tapped.
  - The sword swing can collect pickups.
 - If Isaac's total health is equal to or greater than his number of Red Heart
column4:
display=Red Heart Containers (same rule as regular Challenge Rooms), the sword fires a projectile when swung.
  - The projectile deals damage equal to Isaac's damage +2, and has a cooldown equal to 2x Isaac's normal Tears
column5:
tear rate.
 - Holding an attack button charges a spin attack, ready when the sword flashes, which damages all enemies around Isaac. It also deflects enemy projectiles, which can damage enemies who get hit, and launches a projectile regardless of Isaac's current health.
  - The circular swing deals 8x Isaac's damage +10, and the projectile created from it deals 4x Isaac's damage +4.
  - The charge time is based on Isaac's tears stat, at ~4x Isaac's normal tear rate.
  - While charging, the sword will damage the first enemy that contacts it. This will cancel the spin attack.
"," - Spirit Sword has the highest priority of all tear modifiers in the game, over Epic Fetus and Mom's Knife. It is also the only item that can override Epic Fetus.
 - Unlike most charge attacks, the direction of the attack can't be changed by pressing and holding a different attack button then releasing the old one. Instead, it will stay pointing the same direction until all attack buttons are released, either doing nothing or using the spin attack, or the sword touches and damages an enemy, dealing sword slash damage.
 - Spirit Sword can be used to open Spiked Chests and Mimics without taking damage.
 - Range upgrades move the hitbox of the sword forwards, including the spin attack. Enough range upgrades can leave a large blind spot directly in front of the sword.
 - Only the projectile and spin attack are affected by tear rate, not the normal sword swing, meaning that items that increase damage but decrease tear rate, such as Polyphemus and Eve's Mascara, are much more effective when only using the swing. Additionally, items that do the inverse, such as Soy Milk and Almond Milk; are not as effective when only using the swing.
 - Spirit Sword will deflect Mother's Fistula attack and will send it right back at her, entering a short sequence that allows to deal bonus damage, if executed correctly; see this Mother#Phase 1
column6:
page for more details.
 - Spirit Sword is overridden by the Blindfolded effect, as seen while playing as Lilith or in challenges like {{chal
column7:
Cat Got Your Tongue}}.
 - Tainted Lilith: The sword is held by the fetus and acts the same way as with other characters.
 - Having 30 tears performs the swing attack automatically.
",True

column1:
Psy Fly,I581,Flamboyant protector,Spawns a fly [[orbital familiar]] that chases and deflects enemy shots and converts them into [[homing tears]] that deal 2 damage. Turns some [[Fly]] enemies into friendly Blue Flies if it touches them while deflecting shots.,4,," - Spawns a fly orbital familiar that chases and blocks enemy shots.
  - After a certain amount of shots are blocked, it enters a short cooldown period where it still blocks shots, but does not actively chase them.
 - Psy Fly also deals 1 contact damage to enemies per tick (15 per second).
 - Turns some Fly enemies into friendly Blue Flies if it touches them while blocking shots (but not on the return trip).
  - Flies affected include: Army Fly, Attack Fly, Fly, Ring Fly, Swarm, and Willo.
 - {{transf
column3:
item}}
"," - While Psy Fly is an effective means of projectile protection, it is not immunity, and recklessly wading into a barrage of shots can easily result in taking damage.
 - Psy Fly will block most types of projectiles, not just red bullets. This includes the fires from Mega Satan phase 2, the bone projectiles Bony
column4:
display=Bonies throw, or even the rocks that the Kineti throws at you.
 - Enemy Flies touched by Psy Fly can die if their HP is low enough, which does not convert them into Blue Flies.
",True

column1: Rocket in a Jar,I583,Rocket propulsion +5 bombs,"+5 {{E
column2:
bomb}}s. If Isaac is currently firing, placing a bomb will instead shoot a fast-moving, explosive rocket in the direction he's facing.",2,," - Adds 5 bombs.
 - If any firing input is given when placing a bomb, a fast-moving, explosive rocket will be shot in the direction corresponding to the input.
  - The rockets accept analog firing input. This means they can be shot diagonally or in any other angle with a mouse or joystick.
  - Isaac will place a regular bomb if no firing input is received.
", - Rockets use Isaac's bomb synergies like his bombs normally would.
 - Rockets are unaffected by Isaac's shot speed.
 - Rockets can be boosted by Brimstone lasers and Hemoptysis sneezes.
 - Bosses such as Chub or Carrion Queen can swallow the rockets just like regular bombs.
,True

column1: The Stairway,I586,May you get what you came for,Generates a ladder at the start of every floor that leads to a unique {{R
column2:
Angel Room}} shop.,3,The Stairway," - At the start of every floor, generates a ladder which leads to a special Angel Room Shop, regardless of whether a devil deal has been taken. These angel shops always contain the following:
  - Three items/pickups for sale. These items/pickups can be on sale, just like with normal Shop.
   - An item from the Angel Room (Item Pool)
column3:
Angel Room Item Pool for 15 or 30 pennies.
   - An Eternal heart for 5 pennies.
   - A Soul heart for 5 pennies.
   - A key for 5 pennies.
   - A Holy Card for 5 pennies.
  - An Angel statue. The Angel can be fought for a Key Piece like normal.
  - A normal {{Machine
column4: Beggar}} or {{Machine
column5:
Rotten Beggar}} next to the entrance.
  - A {{Machine
column6:
Confessional}}, if it has been unlocked.
"," - The following items cost 30 coins to purchase:

column1:
- The Body
 - Crown of Light
 - Dead Dove
 - Godhead
 - Holy Grail
 - Holy Mantle
 - Immaculate Heart
 - The Mind
 - Paschal Candle
 - Prayer Card
 - The Relic
 - Revelation
 - Sacred Heart
 - Sacred Orb
 - The Soul
 - Spirit Sword
 - Trinity Shield
 - The Wafer

- The ladder to the angel room disappears if Isaac leaves the starting room, regardless of whether Isaac has climbed it or not.
  - The ladder also disappears after save-quitting.
 - Item Pool#Weight Decrementation
column2:
Weight decrementation in the generated shops is the same as in regular Angel Rooms, so if an item is seen in the special shop, it won't be encountered regularly again for the rest of the run.
 - During the Ascent, ladders will generate in the ""starting rooms"" (where light beams are located) on every floor.
  - The same does not apply during {{chal
column3:
Backasswards}}, in which the item simply has no effect.
 - The ladder will appear in Greed Mode, but the ladder may be blocked off depending on the room layout.
 - The ladder will appear in the Mirrored World in the starting room, and will lead to the same shop.
 - Rerolled items will be taken from the Angel Room pool. This can allow the player to gain more Angel Room items by rerolling the Key Pieces from the Angels and/or the item from the Beggar.
 - Since a beggar always spawns immediately to the right of the entrance way, caution should be taken to avoid accidental donation.
 - If a run is started with The Stairway, i.e. playing as Eden or having collected Eden's Blessing, the ladder will not appear on the first floor.
",True

column1: Sol,I588,Radiant victory,"Reveals the location of the {{R
column2: Boss Room}}. Upon defeating a boss, activates {{p
column3:
XIX - The Sun}}, fully recharges Isaac's active item, grants bonus [[damage]] and [[luck]] for the rest of the floor, and removes [[curses]].",2,," - Shows the location of the Boss Room on the minimap.
 - After killing the boss in the Boss room shown on the map, has the following effects:
  - Activates the effect of XIX - The Sun.
  - Gives Isaac +3 damage and +1 luck for the rest of the floor.
  - Fully recharges Isaac's active item.
  - Removes any Curses from the current floor.
"," - The buffs from Sol will be active upon entering all the floors in the Ascent, but it will not activate the effect of XIX - The Sun.
  - In {{Stage
column4:
Home}}, the buffs from Sol will activate after sleeping in Mom's bed or defeating Dogma's first phase.
 - Only damage and luck buff will be granted upon entering the boss room in the special version of {{Stage
column5:
Mausoleum}} II.
 - On floors with multiple bosses (The Void, XL floors, {{chal
column6:
Red Redemption}}), one random boss room is shown.
  - In The Void, only the randomly selected Boss room will grant Sol's effect.
 - Does not activate with bosses killed during Boss Rush.
 - Despite being on a different floor, Sol's effect persists for ??? and thus contributes to the Hush fight.
 - Upon defeating a multi-segment boss where all pieces die at the end (Chub, C.H.A.D, Carrion Queen, etc.), the effect activates once per segment, leading to an effective +3 luck and +9 damage until leaving the room, after which, the extra bonuses will be removed.
 - Sol will not activate upon clearing the Mirrored World's Boss Room.
 - If Sol is obtained in Greed Mode, through Spindown Dice or as a starting item for Eden, the effects will activate when entering the main room for the first time. In addition, it will activate each time a boss wave is completed.
  - Sol will not activate during the final stage in the mini-boss fight before Ultra Greed.
",True

column1: Luna,I589,The moon's blessing shines upon you,Adds an extra {{r
column3: Super Secret Room}} to each floor. Secret Rooms contain a beam of light that increases [[Fire Rate]] for the current floor and gives a {{e
column4: Half Soul Heart
column5:
n}}.,2,," - Adds an extra Secret Room and Super Secret Room to each floor.
 - Reveals one random Secret Room on the map on pickup and at the start of each floor.
 - Each newly discovered Secret Room has a shining beam of light that will raise tears for the current floor and gives Isaac a Half Soul Heart when walked under.
  - The first light gives Isaac +1 tears fired per second, and all subsequent ones give +0.5 tears fired per second.
  - This gives a potential +2.5 tears per second for a given floor, on top of 2 soul hearts.
  - The tears up breaks the default 5 tears per second cap.
 - Once the effect is triggered for the floor, a silver-bluish shine will appear around Isaac. This light will be strengthened for every beam of light ""gathered"".
  - While this effect is mostly cosmetic, it also partially counteracts both the {{Curse
column6:
Darkness}} and the ""dark rooms"" in the Mines/Ashpit.
"," - The beams of light appear in both Secret Room types but not in Ultra Secret Rooms.
  - The beams of light also appear in Secret Rooms and Super Secret Rooms that appear as a result of Red Key.
 - The beams of light appear even in unopened Secret Rooms on the same floor the item was acquired on.
 - The effect can also be obtained in the Mirrored World.
 - The tears up bonuses still apply while in the special area of Mines/Ashpit II.
 - No new Secret Rooms are added in Greed Mode or Chapters#Chapter 1
column7:
Chapter 1 (if it's a starting item for Eden), but the beam of light is still added to current Secret Rooms.
 - No new Secret Rooms are added in ???, The Ascent, and Home.
 - If kept after using Birthright with Tainted Eden, upon taking damage, the additional tear rate is lost. More beams of light will have to be found or used for the tears to be regained (assuming not all of them were used).
 - If playing Co-op or as Jacob and Esau, characters that did not pick up Luna will still gain full benefit from stepping within the beam of light. However, this will only benefit one character.
 - Multiple copies of Luna will not cause additional Secret Rooms or Super Secret Rooms to be generated.
",True

column1:
Mercurius,I590,Speed up + you feel elusive,"+0.4 [[speed]]. Doors stay open after entering a room, even in rooms with enemies.",3,," - +0.4 speed.
 - Opens most doors after entering a room, even in rooms with enemies, allowing Isaac to leave at any time.
"," - While Door Stop has a similar effect, Mercurius has the added benefit of opening the doors that Isaac did not enter through.
 - Does not open the Boss Rush door.
 - Does not open any Special Rooms, including those that require pickups to unlock. Doors won't be opened even if they were open already (such as Treasure Rooms and Shops on the first floor, Sacrifice Rooms, etc.) or have been entered before.
 - Does not open doors to Red Rooms if those door are created while there are enemies inside the current room.
",True
Venus,I591,HP up + you feel pretty,Adds one red [[Heart container]]. Heals 1 additional {{E
column2:
Red heart}}. Enemies near Isaac become [[charm]]ed.,2,, - Grants one Red Heart Container.
 - Heals 1 additional Red heart
 - Charms enemies close to Isaac. The effect wears off quickly after enemies move away from Isaac.
,,True

column1:
Terra,I592,Born to rock,"+1 [[Damage]]. Replaces tears with rocks that deal variable damage, have increased [[knockback]], and can destroy [[obstacles]].",3,," - Gives Isaac +1.0 damage.
 - Isaac's tears become rocks that have extra knockback and have a chance to destroy obstacles (including walls to Secret Rooms, the mirror in {{Stage
column3: Dross}}, entrances to {{Stage
column4: Mines}}/{{Stage
column5: Ashpit}} and Bedroom
column6:
Bedrooms, and normal closed doors).
  - Rocks can be pushed onto holes to cover them as if they were bombed normally.
 - Rock tears randomly deal increased/decreased damage, varying between x0.5 and x2 Isaac's damage per tear.
"," - Despite the chance to deal lower damage per shot, the increase to the damage stat results in a higher average DPS.
 - Terra bypasses Blasters' 75% damage reduction.
 - Terra can destroy the armor of Tuff Twins and The Shell.
",True

column1:
Mars,I593,Double tap dash,"Dash by double-tapping the movement key, becoming invulnerable and damaging enemies. There's a short cooldown before Isaac can dash again.",2,," - Double tapping a direction makes Isaac quickly dash in that direction.
  - Isaac is immune to damage from all sources during the dash, with the exception of Blood Donation Machines, Devil Beggars, and similar self-damage active items.
  - The dash deals damage equal to 4x Isaac's damage + 8.
  - The direction of the dash can be changed by holding another button.
  - The dash has an approximate 3 second cooldown.
"," - The dash can be used to enter Curse Rooms and open spiked chests/mimic chests without taking damage.
 - The dash can destroy Shopkeepers.
 - With a controller, tapping the joystick is rather inconsistent, and the dash can often activate by accident. Using the directional pad instead is recommended.
 - When Mars's dash is charged, Isaac will occasionally flash brightly, and visible steam will emit from his nose.
 - Extra care needs to be taken with this item, as tapping for precise movements too quickly will cause a dash.
 - Mars does not work as intended on xbox.
",True

Jupiter,I594,You're a gas giant!,"+2 red [[Heart container]]s, -0.3 [[speed]]. Isaac builds speed while standing still, and releases [[poison]] gas clouds when he moves afterwards.",2,," - Grants two Red Heart containers, of which half a heart will be filled.
 - -0.3 Speed.
 - Standing still causes Isaac to build up speed at a rate of +0.25 per second, up to a +0.5 speed bonus.
 - Isaac charges up while standing still. Moving releases a fart cloud behind Isaac, damaging and inflicting Status Effects
column2:
Poison on enemies that pass through it and draining the speed buff at a rate of -0.25 speed per second. The fart clouds are left behind for the duration of the speed buff.
  - The fart clouds deal 0.5x Isaac's damage per tick (1.5x Isaac's damage per second), and last ~2.5 seconds.
 - Isaac is immune to Poison from enemies, such as Gasbag.
"," - As the speed buff requires Isaac to stand still, Jupiter is effectively a speed down.
 - The fart clouds are mechanically independent of the speed increase. Even while at max speed, the fart cloud must be charged by standing still.
 - Jupiter acts solely as a flat +0.20 speed boost forTainted Forgotten with no other effects.
",True

column1:
Saturnus,I595,Ring of tears,"Upon entering a room, a circle of tears orbits Isaac. Enemy tears have a chance to be caught in orbit, turning them friendly.",2,," - A circle surrounds Isaac. When entering a room, the circle is filled with 7 orbiting tears that copy Isaac's tear properties.
  - The tears will deal 1.5x Isaac's damage +5 flat damage.
  - After 13 seconds, the tears will automatically fall to the ground.
  - Orbiting tears are spectral tears
column2:
spectral, although they don't visually appear to be.
  - The room does not have to be a new room to renew the 7 orbiting tears.
 - Enemy tears have a chance to be caught in the orbit, making them able to damage enemies.
  - Enemy tears caught disappear after a short time or when you leave the current room.
"," - Any new effect on tears provided by an item or a trinket won't affect Ring tears until getting to a new room.
  - This is the same for lost effects (e.g. by dropping a trinket).
 - When using a teleporter in Mausoleum/Gehenna, the tears won't teleport and instead travel back towards the ring.
",True

column1:
Uranus,I596,Ice tears,"Isaac shoots ice tears, which [[slow]] enemies and [[freeze]] monsters they kill. Frozen enemies slide away and explode into ice shards when touched.",3,," - Isaac's tears become icicles that freeze enemies upon death, turning them into ice statues.
  - Bosses and mini-bosses cannot be frozen.
 - Frozen enemies can be kicked, sliding and leaving damaging creep across the room and shattering when they hit a wall, obstacle or an enemy, releasing 10 icicle tears in a circle.
  - These icicles can either slow enemies for 4 seconds or turn them into ice statues as well if they deal the lethal hit.
 - Killing an enemy by freezing them will prevent any on-death effects to occur (i.e. splitting into other enemies, firing any post-death tears, exploding, etc.), even after shattering.
"," - Isaac's own tears cannot apply a slowing effect on enemies. This property is only available for the icicle burst after shattering a frozen enemy.
 - The on-shatter icicles deal damage equal to 8 + (floor - 1) which is not affected by Isaac's stats.
  - These tears do not inherit any of Isaac's tear effects.
 - The blue creep left behind ice statues while they're sliding across the room rapidly deals 2 flat damage for 11 ticks per second, resulting in 22 damage per second.
 - Ice statues have 10 health points and can be shattered if shot by 10 tears or projectiles.
  - Isaac's damage is irrelevant here and each tear shot will deal only 1 point of damage to them.
  - Enemies ignore the ice statues when targeting Isaac and they can also destroy them if shot enough times.
  - Explosions will shatter the statues immediately.
 - Enemies hit by a sliding ice statue receive 35 flat damage which is not affected by Isaac's stats or the current floor.
 - Enemies killed by hit of a sliding ice statue or the blue creep will not be frozen.
 - Frozen enemies are considered dead by the game, meaning they don't need to be shattered in order for the room to be cleared. If not shattered, they don't disappear until leaving the room.
 - Champion enemies that drop consumables won't drop anything until their ice statue is shattered.
  - As Tainted Keeper, enemies will drop a coin immediately when frozen.
",True

Neptunus,I597,Open the floodgates,"Isaac's mouth fills with tears over time while not firing, up to a cap. Holding the fire button will release all stored tears in rapid succession.",3,," - When Isaac is not firing tears, a charge bar will start to fill up. Holding down the fire button will release all stored tears in rapid succession.
  - The charge time and maximum tears per charge scale with Isaac's tears stat, with higher tears charging faster and having more.
"," - While at 0 charge, Isaac fires at his normal tear delay, essentially meaning there is no downside.
 - Rapidly tapping the fire button will not empty the charge, and can be used as a permanent massive increase to fire rate.
 - This item has no observable effect when used as Tainted Lilith or Tainted Forgotten.
",True

Pluto,I598,Size down,"+0.7 [[tears]]. Significantly shrinks Isaac, allowing him to squeeze between objects and makes some enemy shots pass over him.",3,," - +0.7 tears
 - Significantly shrinks Isaac, allowing him to squeeze between objects and makes some enemy shots pass over him.
"," - With enough speed and the correct angle or being pushed by an explosion, it is possible to cross pits and pass through obstacles, allowing Isaac to reach places he usually isn't able to reach.
 - Pluto can stack with other size reduction effects.
 - May allow Isaac to squeeze through the walls and floors in Crawl Spaces. Passing through the outermost wall in an unintended direction leads to the I AM ERROR room.
 - The decrease in size makes dodging certain tear effects easier, most notably Hush's continuum tears, and Dogma's feather attacks from their respective second phases.
",True
Voodoo Head,I599,Extra curse rooms,Spawns an additional {{R
column2:
Curse Room}} on each floor. Curse Rooms have improved layouts.,1,," - Spawns an additional Curse Room on each floor, if possible.
  - Doesn't work on Greed Mode.
  - Doesn't work on the Ascent.
 - Curse rooms have improved layouts and rewards while Voodoo Head is held.
"," - This item is beneficial for The Lost due to the chance of obtaining Dead Cat or Guppy's Collar in curse rooms. However, use caution as the run can easily end from being hit while fighting any enemies inside. A teleport card, such as 0 - The Fool, would be advised to prevent such situations.
 - The level generation increases the minimum number of dead ends by 1, increasing the likelihood of curse rooms spawning.
  - The level generation does not guarantee an additional curse room can be placed; there is limited space for special rooms, and other types may take priority over it.
   - If a curse room doesn't spawn, it's possible Voodoo Head still increased the dead end count, giving you an extra special room.
",True

column1:
Eye Drops,I600,Tears up,"Increases the [[fire rate]] in Isaac's left eye, causing his eyes to fire at different rates.",3,, - Increases the fire rate of tears fired from Isaac's left eye by 40%.
  - The difference in fire rates causes Isaac's tears to be fired at a staggered rate.
  - The first shot in a while is always a double shot.
," - The listed fire rate on found hud is x1.2 fire rate excluding any items that add to fire rate directly.
 - Every type of attack that does not use both of Isaac's eyes benefits from the fire rate up, but will not have staggered attack rate. These include, for example:
  - All charged attacks such as Brimstone and Monstro's Lung.
  - All tear replacers such as Dr. Fetus and Technology.
  - All one-eyed characters and item effects, such as Cain and Stapler.
  - Attacking via familiars, such as Incubus and Tainted Lilith.
 - Multi-shot attacks such as 20/20 and Mutant Spider ''do'' have staggered firing.
",True
Act of Contrition,I601,"Tears up, you feel forgiven",Increases [[tears]] and grants an {{e
column3:
Angel Room}}s to appear even if a Devil Deal has been taken before. Reduces the Devil/Angel room chance penalty for taking Red heart damage.,3,," - +0.7 tears up.
 - Grants an Eternal Heart.
 - Allows Isaac to take a Devil Room
column4:
Deal with the Devil without being locked out of Angel Rooms.
 - Increases the Devil Room#Conditions to Make Devil Rooms Appear
column5:
chance for a deal to appear by 40% if Isaac has taken Red Heart damage.
  - Additional 15% is added if Red Heart was taken against the boss.
  - Both bonuses are applied after the normal penalty for damage, effectively mitigating them to -24% instead of -64% for taking damage during the stage, and to -44% instead of -99% for taking damage against the boss.
",,True

column1: Member Card,I602,Exclusive access!,Adds a trapdoor to every {{R
column2:
Shop}} that leads to a second shop with a unique stock and marked-up prices.,2,Member Card," - Spawns a trapdoor in each Shop that leads to an additional underground shop that can sell 2-5 of the following:
  - A Trinket for 15 cents.
  - An Item for 15-30 cents. Items will be from the Secret Room (Item Pool)
column3: Secret Room, Shop (Item Pool)
column4: Shop, Devil Room (Item Pool)
column5: Devil/Angel Room (Item Pool)
column6: Angel Room, or Boss (Item Pool)
column7:
Boss Room items; there can be multiple items from different item pools, but items will stay to their chosen item pool if rerolled.
   - Devil/Angel room items can cost up to 50 cents, and Secret Room items can cost up to 99 cents.
  - A Cards_and_Runes#Cards
column8: Card/Cards_and_Runes#Runes
column9: Rune/Cards and Runes#Soul Stones
column10:
Soul Stone for 6-8 cents.
  - A Black Heart/Bone Heart for 8 cents.
  - An Eternal Heart for 15 cents.
  - A Rotten Heart for 5 cents.
"," - The trapdoor spawns even if the shop was replaced by Greed or Super Greed, in which case it won't open until Greed has been defeated.
 - Similar to Crawl Spaces, there is only one secret shop per floor. The trapdoors in extra shops created by Red Key will lead to the same secret shop.
 - If the Member Card was removed from the player's inventory (for example, by playing Tainted Isaac and replacing it with a different item), the trapdoor will still remain open once it has been spawned, even after leaving and reentering the shop.
 - The trapdoor will appear in the Mirrored World version of the shop. Despite the shop itself being empty, the trapdoor will lead to the same secret shop where the items are still for sale. Buying from the secret shop in the Mirrored World will thus remove the bought item from both worlds.
",True

column1:
Battery Pack,I603,Instant energy!,Recharges Isaac's currently held active item and drops 2-4 batteries.,1,, - Fully charges the current activated item.
 - Spawns 2-4 random battery pickups.
,,True
Ocular Rift,I606,Stare into the abyss,"Gives Isaac the chance to fire tears that create rifts where they land, which damage nearby enemies and pull in [[Monsters
column2: enemies]], [[pickups]], and tears/shots from all sources.",3,," - Gives Isaac a 5% chance to fire tears that create rifts where they land, which damage nearby enemies and pull in Monsters
column3:
enemies, pickups, and tears/shots from all sources for 2 seconds.
  - Rifts deal 0.5x Isaac's damage twice each tick (3x Isaac's damage per second), and enemy shots pulled into the rift will damage other enemies.
  - The size of the rift increases with Isaac's damage.
"," - The chance to fire a rift is vaguely affected by Luck, but caps at a certain point, and is never guaranteed to trigger.https://docs.google.com/spreadsheets/d/15K8Xgxoxdx68AIaxuLXgZoJJlG36UPgy3_aeDpAM5tU/edit?usp=sharing
 - Not recommended for Mother fight as the rift accelerates inbound projectiles, making them harder to dodge.
",True

column1:
Boiled Baby,I607,Messy friend,Gives Isaac a [[familiar]] that fires chaotic bursts of tears in all directions.,1,," - Gives Isaac a familiar that fires chaotic bursts of tears in all directions at random intervals while in a room with enemies, shooting faster the closer it is to an enemy, similarly to Boils.
  - Each tear fired by Boiled Baby does either 3.5 or 5.3 damage, with no in-between.
 - {{transf
column3:
item}}
",,True

column1:
Freezer Baby,I608,Iced iced baby,"Spawns a shooting [[familiar]] that has a chance to [[petrify]] enemies, and [[Freeze]]s [[monsters]] upon killing them.",2,," - Gives Isaac a familiar that shoots Icicles that have a chance to petrify enemies they hit and Freeze enemies they kill.
  - Icicles deal 3.5 damage, and are fired once every 3/4ths of a second.
  - Frozen enemies will block enemy shots, and will slide away when walked into by Isaac.
   - After colliding with an obstacle or getting sufficiently shot by Isaac, Frozen enemies will Explode into a ring of 10 ice tears that can Slow and Freeze.
 - {{transf
column3:
item}}
",,True

column1: Bird Cage,I610,Fat buddy,"The first time Isaac takes damage in a room, a [[familiar]] leaps on an enemy, dealing damage and releasing a rock wave. For the rest of the room, it chases enemies similar to {{i
column2:
Dead Bird}}.",1,Bird Cage," - Gives Isaac a fat bird familiar that sits on Isaac's head until he takes damage.
 - Upon taking damage, it will jump off of Isaac's head and land on the nearest enemy, dealing damage and creating a rock line in a random direction. For the rest of the room, it acts like Dead Bird, flying around, albeit slower, and dealing contact damage to enemies.
  - Bird Cage does 45 damage to enemies it lands on and 10 damage per rock wave that hits enemies, then does 3 contact damage per tick while chasing enemies (~6.43 damage per second). The rock waves can destroy obstacles.
"," - If damage is taken in a room with no enemies, the familiar will directly go to the flying phase without performing the jump attack.
 - Contact damage can be dealt to nearby enemies even when the familiar jumps off of Isaac's head.
 - While the familiar is sitting on Isaac's head, it can be affected by certain character appearances. For example, it will appear fully black if obtained by Tainted Judas.
",True

column1: Lost Soul,I612,Protect him,"Creates a ghostly [[familiar]] that closely follows behind Isaac. It dies in one hit, but respawns at the start of the next floor. Each time it survives until the next floor, it rewards Isaac with {{E
column3:
Eternal Heart}}s, or an [[Item]].",2,Lost Soul," - Creates a ghostly familiar that closely follows behind Isaac. It dies in one hit, respawning at the start of the next floor.
 - If Lost Soul survives until the start of the next floor, it rewards Isaac with one of the following:
  - 3 Soul Hearts.
  - 2 Eternal Hearts.
  - A Treasure Room (Item Pool)
column4: Treasure Room item or an Angel Room (Item Pool)
column5:
Angel Room item.
"," - Floors completed during the Ascent count.
 - Waiting until after the floor is cleared before picking up Lost Soul nearly guarantees a reward payout on the next floor.
 - The ghost can take explosive damage from Isaac, e.g. via placing a bomb.
 - If a new floor is entered and Missing No. rerolls into this item, it will immediately give a reward.
 - The ghost will respawn after finishing the chase sequence with Mother's Shadow in Mines/Ashpit II allowing a nearly guaranteed reward if that is completed after the floor is cleared.
",True

column1: Blood Bombs,I614,Bloody blast + HP up,Grants a Red [[Heart container]] and restores 5 hearts. Bombs leave behind damaging [[Creep#Red Creep
column3: bomb}}s at the cost of half a heart if he doesn't have any.,2,," - Gives Isaac a Health#Red Heart Containers
column4:
heart container and heals him for five hearts.
 - Causes Isaac's bombs to leave a pool of Creep#Red Creep
column5:
red creep on the ground when they explode.
  - The creep deals 2 damage per tick (20 per second) and lasts 15 seconds.
  - Leaves one large creep in the middle, and four small creeps on random direction and distance.
   - Multiple creeps do not inflict damage on an enemy simultaneously.
 - If Isaac has no bombs, allows him to place a bomb at the cost of taking half a heart of damage. This prioritizes red hearts over soul hearts.
"," - Placing a bomb using health counts as self-damage, and as such, does not affect the chances for a Devil deal, does not trigger Damocles, nor does it reroll Tainted Eden.
  - The Lost / Tainted Lost will die if a bomb is placed this way.
   - This includes the version of The Lost you turn into after touching the white fireplace in {{Stage
column6: Downpour
column7:
r}} II.
 - Keeper / Tainted Keeper will take 1 Coin Heart of damage in exchange for 1 bomb.
 - You can remain at zero bombs and leave excess drops of bombs and hearts to maximize resource use for the floor.
 - Placing a bomb using health can let Isaac enter/exit a Curse Room without taking soul/black heart damage.
  - But be careful and remember to move quickly upon exiting the Curse room, otherwise you'll take damage from the previous bomb.
",True

column1:
Lil Dumpy,I615,Puffy buddy,"Spawns a Dumpy [[familiar]] that pushes away nearby enemies and projectiles just before Isaac is about to be hit, then falls asleep. He can be awoken by walking to him.",2,," - Gives Isaac a Dumpy familiar, which follows behind him. When Isaac is about to take damage (as with Panic Button), Lil Dumpy farts, pushing nearby enemies and shots away. Enemies that collide with obstacles or walls take damage.
 - After farting, Lil Dumpy goes on cooldown and ""falls asleep"" until Isaac walks up to him to wake him up. Lil Dumpy resets upon entering a new room.
",,True

Bird's Eye,I616,It burns,Gives a chance to shoot fires alongside tears that block enemy shots and deal damage to enemies that touch them.,3,," - Gives Isaac a chance to shoot fires alongside his regular tears that block enemy shots and deal damage to enemies that touch them, similar to those shot by Red Candle.
  - Fires can block up to four shots and/or deal four ticks of damage before being destroyed, and last up to 10 seconds.
  - Fires deal 4x Isaac's damage at full durability, 3x Isaac's damage after taking damage once, and 2x Isaac's damage otherwise, for a max possible damage output of 11x Isaac's damage per fire.
  - Flames will destroy shopkeepers.
  - The chance to shoot fires depends on Isaac's luck stat. The activation rate is equal to 1/(12 - Luck). At base luck (0), the chance is 8.33%, maxing out at 50% at 10 luck.https://docs.google.com/spreadsheets/d/15K8Xgxoxdx68AIaxuLXgZoJJlG36UPgy3_aeDpAM5tU/edit?usp=sharing
  - The size of the flames depends on Isaac's tears size.
  - Any fart related effect that occurs will also generate a flame, like using The Poop or when generating a bomb with Number Two.
  - Converts enemies into their fire-like variations, such as a Clotty into a Grilled Clotty.
   - A Clotty won't be converted if it's in a wet room, such as those found in the Flooded Caves or the one created by an item such as Flush!
",,True

Lodestone,I617,Magnetizing tears,"Gives Isaac the chance to fire tears that magnetize enemies they hit, causing them to attract nearby [[pickups]] and enemies, as well as tears/shots from all sources.",3,," - Gives Isaac the chance to fire tears that magnetize enemies they hit, giving them properties similar to tears fired by Isaac when he has Strange Attractor:
  - Enemies and pickups that are near magnetized enemies are pulled towards them. This includes live bombs.
  - All tears/enemy shots (from Isaac, his familiars, and all enemies, including the magnetized one) will be strongly pulled towards magnetized enemies.
   - Enemy shots that get pulled in will now also damage enemies other than the ones that fired them.
"," - The chance to fire magnetizing tears depends on the luck stat. The activation rate is equal to 1/(6 - Luck). At 0 luck, the chance is 16.67%, maxing out at 100% at 5 luck.
",True
Rotten Tomato,I618,Delicious!,Adds a chance to fire tears that [[Status Effects#Mark
column2: Mark]] enemies. Marked enemies are attacked by other enemies.,2,, - Adds a chance to fire tears that Status Effects#Mark
column3:
Mark enemies. Marked enemies will move slower and be attacked by other enemies until it is killed or the effect wears off.
 - Tears that apply the effect are red.
," - The chance to fire marking tears depends on the luck stat. The activation rate is equal to 1/(6 - Luck). At 0 luck, the chance is 16.67%, maxing out at 100% at 5 luck.
 - Causes pathing issues with segmented bosses, as they attempt to attack their own segments.
 - Most enemies will ignore Isaac in order to attack a marked enemy, making Rotten Tomato an item with both offensive and defensive applications.
 - With a high enough luck stat and piercing effects, the up time of the marked effect can be enough to render some bosses harmless, such as Ultra Pestilence or The Duke of Flies who spawn a multitude of flies that it will then focus on.
 - This item is very effective during Boss Rush. Boss enemies affected by this item will deal massive amounts of damage to each other and Isaac will be less likely to get hurt by their attacks.
 - Due to the nature of Mother's hit box, the marked effect will cause mother to often shoot herself in her second phase causing a lot of her attacks to be nullified.
",True

column1: Birthright,I619,???,Grants a [[character]]-specific effect that enhances their special abilities.,3,Birthright," - Grants a passive ability that varies from character to character. The effect typically enhances/magnifies the character's special traits or helps mitigate some of their downsides.

column2: class=""wikitable striped sortable mw-collapsible"" data-description=""Birthright Effects"" style=""min-width:350px; margin-right:10px;""

column1: ! Character
! class=""unsortable""
! class=""unsortable""

column3: Isaac

column2: All new item pedestals cycle between two options. Previously-seen items are unaffected.

column3: Magdalene

column2: Adds 1 full red Heart Container. Increases the maximum heart limit to 18.

column3: Cain

column2: +1 Luck. Every floor, except for ???, Chest, Dark Room, The Void, and Home, has a very high chance to contain an upgraded Arcade that generally contains more Machines. This includes odd-numbered floors, Cathedral, and Sheol. Arcades will appear even if Cain is not holding at least 5 Coins. Arcades will still not spawn in Greed Mode.

column3: Judas
''Belial incarnate''

The Book of Belial becomes a passive item that can be held beneath other active items, similar to Book of Virtues. May stack with Book of Virtues. If Judas is not currently holding The Book of Belial, he receives it. The damage boost received from The Book of Belial scales with the amount of charges the active item above it has; may not work with one-time-use items, items with unlimited use, timed recharges or items that do not follow normal room charge rules (Isaac's Tears, etc). Has special interactions with certain items - see The Book of Belial#Synergies
column4: The Book of Belial for more information.

column3: Dark Judas

column2: Soul Hearts gained from HP ups are doubled.

column3: Eve

column2: Whore of Babylon is active regardless of health and Dead Bird is active without taking damage.

column3: Samson

column2: Bloody Lust can grant 4 more Damage boosts at +0.2 intervals, for a new maximum total of +14.0.

column3: Azazel

column2: Azazel's Brimstone beam becomes much wider like Mega Blast, with 2x larger collision area. No effect on damage.

column3: Lazarus

column2: No direct effect. The item is triggered if Lazarus dies and becomes Lazarus Risen.

column3: Lazarus Risen

column2: Grants a +7.2 Damage bonus that fades by 0.12 per second. Until the effect completely fades, killing an enemy restores 0.07 damage to the bonus.

column3: Eden

column2: Creates 3 random items from random item pools. Only one can be taken. Ignores item weight and can spawn items that have already been taken during the run. Can also spawn multiples of the same item, if they exist in multiple item pools.

column3: The Lost

column2: Prevents items with the Item Tags nolostbr
column3: nolostbr item tag from appearing. In practice, this automatically re-rolls most items that aren't beneficial to The Lost, namely ones that only give health, flight, and/or spectral tears or activate upon taking damage.
Lilith

column2: Most familiars that normally follow Lilith, including Lilith's innate Incubus, will always be positioned in front of Lilith, creating a stack, facing whatever direction she was shooting. Non-attacking familiars (The Relic, Farting Baby, etc.) will follow Lilith's most recently acquired attacking familiar instead; if the most recent familiar is throwable like Holy Water, familiars following it will also be launched with it. If Lilith has King Baby, it will always be positioned directly in front of Lilith with all other affected familiars forming a semi-circle around it, and will behave normally otherwise. Dry Baby is considered an ""attacking familiar"" and will be within the stack. Lil Portal and Jaw Bone are exempt and behave normally.

column3: Keeper

column2: Adds one Coin Heart and raises Keeper's maximum Coin Heart limit to 4.

column3: Apollyon

column2: Using Void has a 10% chance to spawn one previously destroyed passive item (while keeping the bonus stats). Each absorbed passive item has an equal chance to be spawned. Spawned items can be spawned again even if they are not reabsorbed. Absorbing duplicates of the same item will make it more likely to be spawned, as each duplicate counts as a separate item and thus has its own chance to be spawned. Birthright has no effect if Void is not held.

column3: The Forgotten

column2: The Soul is unchained and free to move. It can move to different rooms, leaving The Forgotten behind, and switching back teleports The Soul back to The Forgotten.

column3: Bethany

column2: Activating an item using Soul Charges is free around 50% of the time.

column3: Jacob and Esau

column2: The character who picks up Birthright gains copies of the three most recent passive items from the other.

column3: Tainted Isaac

column2: Allows up to 12 passive items to be carried at a time. Does not consume a slot itself.

column3: Tainted Magdalene

column2: Adds 1 full red Heart Container and increases the number of non-draining hearts to 3.

column3: Tainted Cain

column2: The amount of pickups dropped from collecting an item is doubled.

column3: Tainted Judas

column2: Increases the range in which Dark Arts hits enemies and tears.

column3: Tainted ???

column2: Increases the maximum number of poop pickups that can be carried to 29.

column3: Tainted Eve

column2: Red Heart Clots now spawn temporary Half Red Hearts on death that last for two seconds before disappearing. Clots spawned from other types of hearts will not drop hearts.

column3: Tainted Samson

column2: The berserk timer gains 3 seconds instead of 1 when Tainted Samson kills an enemy.

column3: Tainted Azazel

column2: Doubles the size of Tainted Azazel's Hemoptysis sneeze attack.

column3: Tainted Lazarus
''Superposition''

The non-active form of Tainted Lazarus will appear in ghostly form, being completely immune to damage and dealing 25% damage (including tear effects such as Holy Light). Holding down the ""drop"" key allows the active form to move independently of the other form, similar to Jacob and Esau. Using Flip will cause the two characters to switch states while maintaining positions. Both characters receive the Birthright effect when one character collects it.
Dead Tainted Lazarus
Tainted Eden

column2: Items gained before Birthright will not be re-rolled, neither by taking damage, nor by items such as D4 and Missing No.. Items gained afterwards will still be affected.

column3: Tainted Lost

column2: Grants an extra life that revives Tainted Lost in the same room and deals 200 damage to nearby enemies. It can hit the same enemy up to 4 times.

column3: Tainted Lilith

column2: Familiars that normally follow Tainted Lilith will instead act like and stack on top of her Gello familiar, disappearing inside of her while she's not firing and swinging out when she attacks. The melee attack gains a flat +3 damage bonus per familiar (regardless of damage multipliers) and if those familiars can shoot, they do so along with the Gello familiar. The Gello familiar gains the properties of King Baby, causing attached familiars to automatically aim and shoot at enemies. Familiars like Jaw Bone or Holy Water still function, but they are bound to the Gello familiar rather than their normal means of movement.

column3: Tainted Keeper

column2: Strongly attracts the coins dropped by defeating enemies from a short distance. No effect on other coins.

column3: Tainted Apollyon

column2: Holding down the fire button causes Abyss locusts to continuously damage enemies instead of returning.

column3: Tainted Forgotten

column2: Tainted Soul is given Recall, an unlimited-use active item, which pulls Tainted Forgotten into his hands automatically from a distance.

column3: Tainted Bethany

column2: Spawns four Lemegeton wisps of items with a Item Quality
column3: quality of 3 or higher. These wisps are much larger and have much higher HP than normal wisps.
Tainted Jacob

column2: Dark Esau splits into two. Both Esaus will always charge at the same time, and one will not charge if the other is not in position. Using Anima Sola chains both Dark Esaus at once and forces them together into one spot. Subsequent uses release each Dark Esau one at a time. Anima Sola's recharge time is reduced to 10 seconds, and chain duration is increased to 6.67 seconds.

}
"," - Birthright effects are stackable when playing as Tainted Lost, Tainted Bethany, or Tainted Magdalene. However, collecting additional Birthrights with Tainted Magdalene will simply add another bleeding heart container.
 - Playing as Magdalene, having more than 12 hearts, and entering the area in which Knife Piece 2 can be acquired will completely remove all hearts above 12.
 - Playing as Keeper, having 4 coin hearts and entering the area in which Knife Piece 2 can be acquired will set your coin hearts back to 3.
",True

column1: Red Stew,I621,Full HP + temporary DMG up,Refills all [[heart container]]s. Grants an enormous [[damage]] boost that wears off over time.,2,Red Stew," - On pickup, fully Health#Red Heart Containers
column2:
heals Isaac and gives him a temporary +21.6 damage up.
  - The damage upgrade scales down to 0 over the course of three minutes. Due to how the Damage#Effective_Damage
column3:
damage formula works, the damage upgrade scales down faster over time, starting at -~0.015 per half second and increasing to -~.1 per half second as the bonus approaches 0.
  - While Red Stew is active, Isaac gains an effect similar to Lusty Blood, gaining a small damage bonus every time he kills an enemy. This damage bonus persists between rooms and floors, allowing Isaac to sustain the temporary damage up for longer than he otherwise would if he manages to kill many enemies. This effect disappears once Red Stew's damage bonus completely runs out.
"," - Due to the high amount of damage you temporarily gain, this item is extremely effective in Greed Mode, as all fights are done within the same room and you are easily able to make the most out of it.
",True

column1: Knife Piece 1,I626,???,"Combined with {{i
column3: n}}, creates a knife [[familiar]] that damages enemies and can open the door to the {{s
column4:
Corpse}}.",0,," - Spawns a knife handle familiar that follows Isaac.
 - Generates a room in Mines / Ashpit II for Knife Piece 2 to spawn in.
 - Combines with Knife Piece 2 to form a knife familiar that launches itself in the direction Isaac shoots, dealing 25 damage to and piercing enemies it hits.
 - Launching it at the red door at the end of Mausoleum/Gehenna II will open the door, destroying the knife in the process.
"," - Isaac will remain as The Lost until after he has cleared a room of enemies; it does not matter whether this room is in the mirror world. His normal form will be restored upon entering any room outside the mirror world. This effect can extend to the next floor.
 - If you don't have Holy Mantle unlocked on The Lost, you don't get Holy Mantle while in ghost form.
 - The knife piece can be rerolled, in the event that Mother is not the desired completion mark.
",True

column1: Knife Piece 2,I627,???,"Combined with {{i
column3: n}}, creates a knife [[familiar]] that damages enemies and can open the door to the {{s
column4:
Corpse}}.",0,," - Combines with Knife Piece 1 to form a knife familiar that launches itself in the direction Isaac shoots, dealing 25 damage to and piercing enemies it hits.
 - Launching it at the red door at the end of Mausoleum/Gehenna II will open the door, destroying the knife in the process.
",,True

column1:
Bot Fly,I629,Defense drone,Spawns an orbiting fly [[familiar]] that fires shielded tears at incoming enemy projectiles.,3,," - Spawns a robotic Pooter familiar that orbits around Isaac and fires shielded tears at incoming enemy projectiles, similar to those from Lost Contact.
  - The shielded tears home in on projectiles, but not enemies.
  - The familiar deals 1 contact damage per tick or 3 damage per second, and instantly kills weak fly enemies on contact.
 - {{transf
column3:
item}}
", - Only 5 Bot Flies can circle Isaac at a time.
,True

column1:
Evil Charm,I632,Luck up + you feel protected,"Increases [[luck]] by 2.0. Provides immunity to [[burn]], [[confusion]], [[fear]], and [[poison]].",2,," - Gives Isaac +2.0 luck.
 - Makes Isaac immune to burn, confusion, fear and toxic gas clouds.
  - This also includes the Godhead aura from Dogma's projectiles.
", - Poison clouds from destroying Rocks#Mushrooms
column2:
mushrooms still affect Isaac. Only lingering toxic gas clouds are rendered harmless.
,True

column1: Purgatory,I634,Help from beyond,"While in a room with enemies, spawns cracks on the ground. Walking over these cracks summons ghosts that launch themselves at enemies and explode.",2,Purgatory," - Spawns a red crack in the ground somewhere in the room while Isaac is in a room with enemies. Walking over the crack summons a Familiar#Ghosts
column2:
ghost that homes in on the nearest enemy, exploding when it hits it. After the ghost is summoned, cracks will keep showing up in the room until it is cleared.
  - The ghost spends one second spawning in before it attacks.
  - The ghost deals double Isaac's damage per tick, up to 4 times.
"," - Only one crack is active at a time.
 - The explosion does not hurt Isaac.
 - If a crack is stepped on and the room is cleared before the ghost spawns, it will fly to a random location and explode there.
 - The explosions from the ghosts will destroy enemy tears.
 - Cracks don't spawn in Challenge Rooms.
 - Friendly enemies can be killed by the ghosts.
 - The ghosts aren't considered familiars, therefore they're unaffected by items or trinkets that alter familiars or their behavior, such as BFFS!, King Baby, Box of friends or Friendship Necklace.
",True

column1: Knockout Drops,I637,They pack a punch!,Adds a chance to shoot a fist tear that has extremely high [[knockback]] and [[Confusion
column2:
confuses]] enemies.,3,," - Adds a 10% chance to shoot red fist-shaped tears that deal extreme knockback and cause confusion for 2 seconds.
  - Enemies will take 10 + 2
 - (floor - 1) damage when they are knocked into a wall/obstacle or when hit by another knocked back enemy.
 - The chance to fire fist tears is affected by luck. At base luck (0), the chance is 10%, maxing out at 100% at 9 luck.
"," - Bosses are also affected by all of Knockout Drops' effects.
 - Fist tears play a unique punch sound effect when they hit enemies.
 - Knockout Drops can be dangerous in The Beast battle, as the Ultra Harbingers may get knocked so far off the screen they become hard to damage further and their attacks cannot be seen properly.
",True

column1:
Akeldama,I641,Spill your guts,"While in an uncleared room, Isaac forms a trail of bloody tears that drags behind him, bursting and dealing damage upon contact with enemies.",2,Akeldama," - While in a room with enemies, creates a trail of tears that Isaac drags behind him.
  - Each tear deals 3.5 damage, regardless of Isaac's damage.
  - The shorter the trail of tears is, the faster it grows.
  - The trail is composed of 20 tears at max length.
 - Once the room is cleared, the trail will remain but will stop regenerating.
 - Another trail of tears may appear if the trail is cut in the middle.
",,True
Revelation,I643,Awaken your faith,"Grants [[flight]] and two {{E
column2:
soul heart}}s. In addition to tears, Isaac can charge up and fire a powerful holy laser.",4,Revelation," - Gives Isaac flight and two Soul Hearts.
 - Continuously firing for 2.35 seconds allows Isaac to fire a powerful holy laser when the fire button is released, similar to the attacks used by the Angel bosses.
  - The laser deals Isaac's damage per tick (up to a maximum of 15 times) and can be aimed diagonally. It lasts for ~1.28 seconds (77 frames).
   - With the EnableMouseControl enabled or an analog controller, the laser can be aimed in any direction, similar to Analog Stick.
  - Tear delay has no effect on the charge time of the laser, it is fixed at 2.35 seconds.
 - {{Transf
column3: Seraphim
column4:
item}}
"," - This item's effects will still work while Blindfolded, which makes it extremely valuable for Lilith and in challenges such as {{chal
column5:
BRAINS!}}.
 - Many of '''Revelation''''s Synergies are similar to Brimstone's
 - Having any charged tear effects like Monstro's Lung or '''Brimstone''' will lower their DPS if their charge time is under 2.35 seconds, in order to use Revelation's laser.
 - Revelation, Maw of the Void and Montezuma's Revenge have the same charge time.
",True

column1: Consolation Prize,I644,+1 to lowest stat,"Increases Isaac's lowest [[Attributes
column3: Penny
column4: display=Coins}}, 1 {{E
column5: bomb}}, or 1 {{E
column6: key}} depending on what Isaac has the least of.",1,," - Gives Isaac one of the following stat boosts, depending on what Attributes
column7:
attribute Isaac has the least of:
  - +1.0 flat damage
  - +0.5 fire rate
  - +0.2 speed
  - +1.5 range
 - Also drops either 3 Penny
column8:
display=Coins, 1 bomb, or 1 key on the ground, depending on what Isaac has the least of.
",,True

column1: Tinytoma,I645,Itching for revenge,"Gives Isaac a {{E
column3: orbital]] that blocks shots, deals contact damage, and splits into smaller versions of itself upon taking damage. The smaller versions break into [[blue spider]]s.",1,Tinytoma," - Grants a large Familiar#Orbital Familiars
column4:
orbital similar to Teratoma that slowly orbits Isaac.
  - The orbital repels enemies that touch it and deals 3.5 contact damage to enemies, once per second.
 - After blocking 3 shots and/or dealing 3 ticks of contact damage, the orbital splits into two smaller ones that orbit opposite of each other. They behave the same as the original, except they are smaller and can only take 2 hits before being destroyed, bursting into 3 blue spiders in the process.
  - 5 seconds after both orbitals are destroyed, the original, full-size orbital respawns.
",,True

column1: Brimstone Bombs,I646,Demon blast +5 bombs,Gives Isaac +5 {{E
column2: bomb}}s and causes his bombs to fire {{i
column3:
Brimstone}} lasers in the cardinal directions upon exploding.,3,Brimstone Bombs," - Gives Isaac +5 bombs.
 - Upon exploding, Isaac's bombs fire 4 Brimstone lasers in the cardinal directions.
  - Each laser deals 8 damage per tick, and can hit up to 19 times.
  - Multiple lasers cannot hit the same enemy simultaneously.
"," - The lasers created by Brimstone Bombs can push other bombs, including Troll Bombs and bombs placed by Isaac.
",True

column1:
4.5 Volt,I647,Beat the juice out of them!,"Active items don't charge when clearing rooms. Instead, they're charged by dealing damage to enemies.",2,," - Causes Isaac's active item to charge when Isaac deals damage to enemies, rather than when he clears rooms.
  - Damage dealt by Status_Effects#Effects
column3:
friendly enemies, active items, orbitals and familiars (including blue flies and spiders) works as well.
 - Charges are gained at a rate equal the following formula: (40 + (20 x stage)). For example:
  - In Basement I / Downpour I, it takes 60 damage to gain 1 charge.
  - In Caves II / Mines II, it takes 120 damage.
  - In Womb I / Corpse I, it takes 180 damage.
  - In Sheol / Cathedral, it takes 240 damage.
  - In Home, it takes 300 damage.
  - Ascent floors use the values of their regular floors, meaning the amount of damage 4.5 Volt needs to gain charges steadily decreases during the Ascent sequence until reaching Home.
 - Multiple charges cannot be gained at once.
 - Overkill damage does not count towards a charge.
", - Tainted characters with active items in their pill/card slot will not have those items charged by 4.5 Volt if their active item isn't already fully charged.
 - Bethany will benefit from 4.5 Volt's effect for regular item charges while retaining her ability to use soul hearts as item charges. This applies to Tainted Bethany with her red heart charges as well.
 - Tainted Jacob will gain charges from 4.5 Volt when Dark Esau damages enemies.
,True

column1: Fruity Plum,I649,Bouncy friend,"Gives Isaac a miniature {{E
column3:
n}} [[familiar]] that propels itself diagonally around the room, firing tears behind itself as it travels.",1,Fruity Plum," - Gives Isaac a familiar that mimics Baby Plum's attack of shooting tears and propelling itself diagonally around the room. It deals 2 contact damage per tick to enemies (6 per second). It fires 15 tears per second behind itself while moving which deals 3 damage.
  - Fruity Plum will prioritize moving towards nearby enemies.
  - If there are no enemies, Fruity Plum loosely orbits Isaac.
 - {{Transf
column4: Beelzebub
column5:
item}}
"," - Since the achievement to unlock explicitly states you must merely '''defeat''' Baby Plum, regardless of the method used, sparing Baby Plum and letting her leave counts towards the unlocking of this item.
",True

column1: Star of Bethlehem,I651,Follow the light,"Spawns a star [[familiar]] that slowly travels towards the {{R
column2: Boss Room}}, giving an aura that increases [[damage]] and [[tears]] and grants [[Tear Effects#Homing
column3:
homing tears]].",3,Star of Bethlehem," - Spawns a star familiar that slowly travels toward the Boss Room, fading through doors as it travels towards it. Once it reaches the boss room, the familiar stands in the center of the boss room for the rest of the floor.
 - The familiar emits an aura that, while Isaac stands inside it, gives him a 1.8x damage multiplier, a 2.5x Tears
column4: fire rate multiplier, and Tear Effects#Homing
column5:
homing tears. It also gives Isaac a chance to block damage similar to Cone Head.
"," - In The Void, the familiar will travel to the boss room that contains Delirium.
 - In ???, the familiar will stay in the first room and will not travel to Hush, rendering it useless.
 - In Greed Mode, the star will travel directly to the position where Isaac spawns upon entering a new floor.
  - On the last floor, it will move to the upper part of Ultra Greed's room.
 - Once the star settles down in the boss room, the damage preventing aura can be used to play Blood Donation Machines and Devil Beggars for free, provided they are spawned via XIV - Temperance or XX - Judgement cards, respectively.
 - The star may travel through Secret Rooms and Curse Rooms on its path to the boss room.
 - The star will travel through Red Rooms if they create an optimal path to the boss room.
  - The star can backtrack into rooms it already went into if a more optimal path is created by a Red Room.
 - The star will travel to the boss room to Mother, but it will not be present during the fight.
 - During the Ascent, the star will linger in the boss room of each floor, and will not progress backwards through the stage.
 - The star will not appear in the fight with The Beast or Mega Satan.
 - For Tainted Forgotten, the bonuses from the star are only applied if Tainted Forgotten is within its aura, not Tainted Soul.
 - If either Tainted Lazarus or Dead Tainted Lazarus have picked up the star, the familiar will spawn in the room where the character holding it becomes active, which may not be the starting room. It will only move while the character holding it is active, effectively making it take twice as long to travel to the boss room unless Tainted Lazarus also has Birthright.
 - During {{chal
column6:
Backasswards}}, the star acts as usual; originating in the starting room and gradually moving towards the boss room.
 - The star will be copied in the Mirrored World and will simultaneously travel in both worlds.
 - Entering and leaving the Knife Piece 2 area will reset the star and make it reappear in the room with the minecart.
",True

column1: Cube Baby,I652,Kick it!,"Spawns an ice cube [[familiar]] that slides around when walked into. It [[slow]]s and deals contact damage, [[freeze
column2:
freezing]] monsters it kills.",1,," - Spawns an ice cube familiar. It cannot move on its own, but slides around when Isaac walks into it or when enemies shoot at it.
 - The familiar damages and slows enemies it touches while moving. It can deal up to 11 damage when it collides with enemies, depending on how fast it's moving.
 - Monsters killed by Cube Baby are Freeze
column3:
frozen.
  - Frozen monsters will follow the same physics as Cube Baby, and will shatter on impact creating ice shards that are capable of freezing other monsters
 - Cube Baby can block enemy projectiles.
 - {{transf
column4: Conjoined
column5:
item}}
",,True

column1: False PHD,I654,Worse pills + evil up,Converts good [[pills]] into bad pills and identifies all pills. Bad pills now have secondary positive effects. Grants one {{e
column2:
Black Heart}}.,2,," - Identifies all pills upon pickup.
 - Grants one Black Heart on pickup.
 - Converts all good pills into their bad counterparts, but gives them positive secondary effects.

column1: ! Pill !! Changes Into

column3: r}} ''Experimental Pill''

column1: ! colspan=""2""

column3: ''I Found Pills''
''Puberty''
''Re-Lax''

column2:
}
 - Stat down pills will also grant +0.6 damage. If it is a Pills#Horse Pills
column3:
horse pill, it will grant +1.2 damage.
 - Other bad pills will also drop a Black Heart upon use.
"," - Bad Trip and Health Down pills will turn into I Found Pills when Isaac is at one heart.
 - Neutral pills will not have a secondary effect.
 - If any stat down pills were taken before picking up the item, a damage increase is given for each pill.
 - Pills are only converted while held by a character with False PHD. For example: If playing as Jacob and Esau and Jacob has this item, pills that got converted into 'bad' pills like a Tears Down pill can be given to Esau to convert them back into a Tears Up pill, or whatever the pill was originally.
 - Losing the item by either dropping it as Tainted Isaac or re-rolling it via D4, etc., causes the damage buffs given to be removed.
 - With Little Baggy and False PHD, the Rocks#Marked Skulls
column4:
Marked Skull in Depths II will drop a ??? pill, making it much harder to open A Strange Door that run.
",True

column1:
Damocles,I577,A king's fortune... but at what cost?,"Spawns a sword above Isaac's head, which doubles all [[item]] pedestals. After Isaac takes damage, the sword can randomly fall at any point, instantly killing him.",2,Damocles," - Upon use, summons a sword that hangs directly above Isaac. As long as the sword hangs above Isaac, all item pedestals are doubled, spawning an additional free item next to them.
  - Items spawned via other means, like Machines, Beggars, and certain items and Cards and Runes
column2:
cards, are also doubled.
  - The extra item will be pulled from the current room's item pool, even if the original item is from a different pool (ex. Beggars or items from Alabaster Box).
 - After Isaac gets hit once with the item activated, at any time with only a brief warning, the sword may fall, instantly killing Isaac regardless of his health. The sword has a 1/10000 chance every 4 frames to fall, so on average, 50% of all Damocles runs will not drop the sword until after at least 15 minutes and 24 seconds have passed.
  - Self-damage (such as from a {{Machine
column3: Blood Donation Machine}}, {{Machine
column4:
Devil Beggar}}, Curse Room, Sacrifice Room, or self-damage Active Items) does not count as damage taken for Damocles, and will not give it the chance to fall.
"," - The chance for the sword to fall does not increase beyond the first hit taken.
 - Items from chests will not be doubled, which greatly limits Damocles' benefit in Chapters#Chapter 6 .28Optional.29
column5:
Chapter 6.
  - The exception to this is Mega Chest
column6:
display=Mega Chests, which will spawn one extra item alongside the 2 original items for a total of 3 items.
