 - In scenarios that have multiple items to choose from (such as rare double Treasure Room layouts and Boss Rush), an additional set of items for Isaac to choose from spawns. Only one item from each set can be taken.
 - Having multiple Damocles active at once does not spawn additional items.
 - The only way Isaac can survive the falling sword is if he's invincible at the time it falls or, by technicality, with a respawn item. After the sword falls, extra items will no longer spawn.
  - Losing a life before the sword falls does not remove the sword or its threat.
 - Items with associated costs, like those in Devil Room or Shop, will not create additional items. This severely limits this item's benefit when used as Tainted Keeper, since most items that are normally created as pedestals are instead Shop items.
 - This can cause items that are in inaccessible spots in certain room layouts to be moved to a more convenient location due to not having space for two pedestals in that spot.
",True

column1:
Vasculitis,I657,Clogged enemies,"Enemies explode into tears upon death, which inherit the effects of Isaac's tears.",2,," - Upon killing an enemy, 1 - 16 tears are released from them in random directions.
  - The amount of tears released from an enemy is based on the enemy's health, and is not affected by Isaac's damage, nor the number of tears hit.
  - These tears are red in coloration, regardless of Isaac's tears, but will inherit the coloration of applied Status Effects
column2:
status effects.
 - Burst tears will do set damage per floor. The formula for this is: (3.2 + 0.3 x stage).
"," - If an enemy is killed while affected by a status effect, the burst tears will inflict the corresponding effect.
 - Tear Effects
column3:
Homing, range and shot speed do not affect Vasculitis.
 - Released tears can be difficult to distinguish from enemy shots, especially from enemies which split in to burst shots upon death such as Red Boom Fly and light blue Monsters
column4:
champions.
 - All forms of damage will cause an enemy to release tears.
",True

column1:
Giant Cell,I658,Micro friends,"Causes Isaac to spawn micro-Isaacs when he takes damage, which chase and shoot at nearby enemies.",1,," - Whenever Isaac takes damage, he summons a micro-Isaac familiar, known as Minisaac, that chases nearby enemies and attacks on its own.
  - Minisaacs deal 1.35 base damage that scales with +0.15 per floor: damage = 1.35 + 0.15
 - (floor - 1)
  - Minisaacs shoot 3 tears per second and their tear delay is not affected by Isaac's stats.
  - Minisaacs persists between rooms and floors.
  - Each Minisaac is spawned with 15 health points that are constantly drained with a rate of 0.4 per second. The draining stops when they reach 0.8 HP.
   - They are healed back to full HP whenever Isaac takes damage, even when the familiars cap is reached.
  - Enemies can damage Minisaacs by shooting projectiles at them or dealing contact damage.
   - Isaac's bomb explosions will also damage the familiars.
   - Minisaacs are immune to spikes and lasers.
"," - The familiar cap for Giant Cell is 16, after which taking damage will not spawn a new Minisaac.
 - Minisaacs will change their skin color based on the character that they were spawned from.
  - Certain items that change skin color can also affect the familiars' appearance.
 - When playing as The Forgotten, the familiars take the style as either The Soul or The Forgotten, depending on who gets hit.
  - If the familiar takes the style of The Forgotten, it will also inherit its bone club attack, dealing 8.1 base damage that scales with +0.9 per floor. It will swing its bone club 1.5 times per second. It can also interact with pickups using the bone club.
 - Minisaacs for Tainted Forgotten will spawn from The Forgotten's body and inherit its skin color but they will shoot regular tears.
 - Familiars spawned for Azazel or Tainted Azazel will not inherit the Brimstone laser and will fire regular tears.
 - If Isaac has any form of flight, the Minisaacs will receive wings and will be able to fly as well.
  - Minisaacs spawned before flight was acquired will not get upgraded, unless the flight is acquired by killing Dogma and starting The Beast fight in which case they will get upgraded.
  - Minisaacs that acquire temporary flight (e.g. from The Bible) will remain permanently upgraded until they die, even after the effect of The Bible expires.
 - There's an unused Shadow-like Minisaac that looks like it should be spawned from Dark Judas, but this isn't the case.
",True

Tropicamide,I659,Tear size + range up,"+1.5 [[Range]], Increases tear size.",1,, - +1.50 Range.
 - +0.22 tear size.
,,True
Card Reading,I660,A link to your future,"Spawns two portals at the beginning of each floor that each lead to either the {{R
column3: Treasure Room}}, or {{R
column4:
Secret Room}}.",3,," - At the beginning of each floor, spawns 2 portals that each lead to either the Boss Room, Treasure Room, or Secret Room.
  - The Boss Room portal is red, the Treasure Room portal is yellow, and the Secret Room portal is blue.
  - From Chapter 4 onward, only 1 portal will spawn.
 - The portals will disappear once the starting room is left, whether a portal was taken or not.
"," - During the Ascent, the portal will spawn in the ""starting room"" that leads to the next floor.
 - Entering the starting room in the Mirrored world will cause the portals to spawn there, leading to the mirror's treasure, secret, or boss room.
 - If the run is exited, the portals will not be there upon continuing.
 - In {{Stage
column5:
The Void}} the boss portal will lead to a random boss, not necessarily Delirium.
 - Entering a portal with Curse of the Maze active on the current floor has a chance of teleporting Isaac to a random room instead.
 - The Treasure Room portal will not lead to a Planetarium if available, unlike XVII - The Stars.
",True

column1:
Tooth and Nail,I663,You feel prickly,"Isaac periodically turns into a spiked statue, briefly becoming invulnerable and dealing contact damage.",2,," - Every 6 seconds, Isaac turns to stone and sprouts spikes for 1 second. While Isaac is in this state, he is immune to damage and deals 40 contact damage.
  - Isaac flashes white four times before turning to stone on the fourth flash. The first three flashes are accompanied by a ""ticking"" sound, the final one with the spike extension sound of a mimic chest.
  - Unlike Gnawed Leaf, Isaac can still move and shoot tears.
"," - Blood Donation Machines and Devil Beggars will still deal damage while Tooth and Nail is active.
 - With proper timing, Curse Rooms can be both entered and exited without taking damage.
 - When invincible, Spiked Chests/Mimic Chests can be opened without taking damage.
 - When under the effects of the Pills#Paralysis
column2:
Paralysis pill Isaac cannot change into a statue.
",True

column1: Binge Eater,I664,All you can eat,+1 Red [[Heart Container]] and fully heals Isaac. Item pedestals also offer a random food item. Picking up a food item temporarily grants +3.6 [[damage]] and permanently boosts 2 [[Attributes
column2:
stats]].,4,," - Grants one Red Heart Container and fully heals Isaac.
 - Item pedestals cycle between the initial item and one of several food items.
 - Upon picking up an affected food item, in addition to their normal effects, Isaac gains a temporary +3.6 Damage boost (which fades over 30 seconds), a permanent boost to 2 Attributes
column3:
stats depending on the food item consumed, and a permanent -0.03 speed reduction.
 - Affected food item heal 3 Red Hearts instead of 2.
"," - Food items that Binge Eater affects and can cycle between, and their bonuses, include:
  - Breakfast: +0.2 Shot Speed, +1.5 Range.
  - Dessert: +1.0 Damage, +0.2 Shot Speed.
  - Dinner: +0.5 Tears, +0.2 Shot Speed.
  - Lunch: +0.5 Tears, +1.5 Range.
  - Midnight Snack: +1.0 Damage, +1.0 Luck.
  - Rotten Meat: +1.0 Damage, +1.5 Range.
  - A Snack: +0.2 Shot Speed, +1.0 Luck.
  - Supper: +0.5 Tears, +1.0 Luck.
 - The temporary Damage boost cannot be stacked, and picking up additional food items resets it to +3.6.
 - Has no effect on certain items that are required to progress through the game, such as The Polaroid, Knife Piece 1, or Dad's Note.
 - No bonuses are granted from other items alluded to be edible, such as MEAT!.
 - Removing collected food items or Binge Eater itself will also remove associated stat bonuses.
 - Because this affects items in Devil Rooms and all of them cost 1 Red Heart Container, Devil Deals can be used as free stat upgrades.
",True

column1: Guppy's Eye,I665,An eye for secrets,"Shows the contents of {{E
column3: Fire Place}}s, {{E
column4: Grab Bag
column5: n}}s, and {{E
column6:
Shopkeeper}}s before they're opened/destroyed.",2,Guppy's Eye," - Shows the contents of Chests, Fire Places, Grab Bags and Shopkeepers before they're opened/destroyed.
 - {{transf
column7: Guppy
column8:
item}}
"," - Guppy's Eye does not show the contents of tinted rocks, Poops, and other obstacles.
 - Guppy's Eye does display enemies that can be contained within chests.
 - Chests and Grab Bags can only display up to four pickups at a time. If there are more than four, higher-value pickups like Bombs, Keys, and Soul Hearts will have priority on the display.
 - If a Red Chest looks like it doesn't have anything in it, it will teleport Isaac to the floor's Devil Room / Angel Room.
 - Due to how Trinkets generate, if a Chest displays a trinket, all future Chests will also display/give that trinket until it spawns in some way, at which point all Chests will display a new trinket.
 - Mimic Chests will change their contents whenever their spikes pop out. The unchanged drops can still be obtained by:
  - Opening them with Flat File or Magneto.
  - Using swing attacks (such as The Forgotten, Notched Axe, Spirit Sword, etc.)
 - This effect works on all non-ending chests, including Mom's Chest.
 - This item is substantially less useful in Greed Mode, due to the scarcity of chests.
 - The contents of Sacks or Chests that haven't spawned yet will still be revealed (for example, in rooms that spawn such Chests or Sacks when Isaac pressed a hidden switch, etc.).
",True

column1: Strawman,I667,A helping hand,"Spawns a controllable {{c
column2: Keeper}} to fight enemies alongside Isaac, functioning similarly to {{c
column3:
Jacob and Esau}}. If Keeper dies, he spawns 5 [[blue spider]]s and Strawman is removed from Isaac's inventory.",2,Strawman," - Spawns Keeper as an extra character alongside Isaac, who is controlled exactly like Esau.
  - Keeper will have his base stats, except speed, and use coins as health.
  - He will not receive any of his starting items, such as Wooden Nickel or Store Key.
 - When Keeper dies, he spawns 5 blue spiders and Strawman is removed from Isaac's inventory.
 - Grants 1 Bomb upon pickup.
"," - Keeper's health is displayed at all times above his head.
  - If {{Curse
column4:
unknown}} is in effect, his health bar will be hidden the same way as Isaac's.
  - Keeper will start with 2 coin hearts or 3 if the Keeper now holds... A Penny! achievement is unlocked.
 - Keeper is able to pick up items independently from Isaac. He has his own inventory.
  - This inventory is not displayed on the HUD.
  - When Keeper dies, the items he obtained are permanently removed.
   - This includes quest items like The Polaroid, potentially leaving you unable to progress.
 - Keeper is not able to pick up any active items, trinkets, or consumables.
 - Keeper cannot pick up any type of hearts, except for Gold Hearts.
  - Eternal Hearts can also be picked up, but to no effect, effectively wasting them.
 - Keeper's speed syncs with Isaac's, as with Jacob and Esau.
 - Devil Room items will cost money instead of health as long as Keeper is alive.
 - When placing a bomb, Keeper will place another at no cost.
 - Keeper can be used to play Sacrifice Rooms at the cost of coins instead of hearts.
 - Boss Challenge Rooms will be closed unless Keeper is also at 1 coin heart.
 - Keeper is not able to walk through doors or into Crawl Space, although he is able to enter the beam of light that takes Isaac to the next floor after the Mom's Heart / It Lives fight, the one spawned by Genesis, as well as entering the big chest after defeating bosses in later stages.
 - Respawn items work as normal for Keeper. (see Interactions)
 - If Keeper plays a {{Machine
column5:
Blood Donation Machine}}, it will pay out with 0-1 coins.
 - Keeper unlocks cannot be earned using Strawman.
 - Similar to Jacob and Esau, it is possible to take both items between item choice pedestals with careful positioning.
 - Even though Keeper is considered a second character, the run ends if Isaac dies.
 - Technically, Strawman is marked as a familiar item in the game's files, although most familiar-modifying items, such as BFFs! don't have any effect on Keeper.
 - Unlike Jacob and Esau, invincibility frames are not shared between Keeper and Isaac.
 - If collected in a challenge where Isaac is blindfolded, Keeper will be blindfolded too.
 - Re-emerging from the part of Mines II where Knife Piece 2 is hidden will cause Strawman to be regenerated from scratch. This permanently remove all items the summoned Keeper had collected up until that point.
 - If Strawman is picked up during the second lap of a Victory Lap, he will become The Lost alongside Isaac on every subsequent lap.
",True

column1: Dad's Note,I668,...,Sends Isaac on an [[Ascent]] toward {{s
column2:
Home}}.,0,, - Initiates the Ascent sequence.
," - Dad's Note cannot be rerolled or destroyed in most ways, such as with The D6, Void, or Abyss.
 - Dad's Note cannot be duplicated via Crooked Penny, even if other items in the same room would be duplicated. Other duplication items such as Diplopia work as normal.
 - The boss room containing Dad's Note cannot be exited once entered, similar to the Mom boss fight. The only way to exit is through teleportation.
 - The only item that can be taken in the boss room of this special version of Mausoleum/Gehenna is Dad's Note. No other items will be spawned.
  - Treasure Room and Shop will still generate in this special floor as in usual floors, giving Isaac more options.
  - Lemegeton pulls from the Boss (Item Pool)
column3:
Boss Pool when used.
 - If Dad's Note is obtained outside of the special boss room via cheats or by using Spindown Dice on Sausage, the music will slowly fade out, but the Ascent will not start.
",True

column1: Sausage,I669,All stats up,"Adds a Red [[Heart Container]], fully heals Isaac, and gives +0.2 [[Speed]], +0.5 [[Damage]], +0.5 [[Tears]], +1.5 [[Range]], +0.2 [[Shot Speed]], and +1.0 [[Luck]]. Increases the chance of encountering a {{r
column3: Angel Room}}, and/or {{r
column4:
Planetarium}} each by 6.9%. ",3,, - Fully heals Isaac.
 - Gives Isaac one Red Heart Container.
 - +0.2 Speed.
 - +0.5 Damage.
 - +0.5 Tears.
 - +1.5 Range.
 - +0.2 Shot Speed.
 - +1.0 Luck.
 - +6.9% Devil Room / Angel Room chance.
 - +6.9% Planetarium chance.
,,True

column1:
Options?,I670,There might be options,"If a room gives a reward when cleared, there will be two different rewards to chose from. Taking one causes the other to disappear.",2,Options?," - Upon completing a room, if a room clear reward would spawn, another different reward spawns next to it. If Isaac takes/opens one, the other disappears.
"," - If one of the rewards is a troll bomb, picking up the other reward will not make the troll bomb disappear.
 - If one of the consumables generated by this effect is a heart, converting it with Apple of Sodom or Keeper will not cause the other consumable to disappear.
 - If one of the consumables generated is a Haunted chest and is picked up and thrown by the Polty (thus opening it), picking up the contents of the chest will not make the other consumable disappear, and taking the other consumable will only make the opened chest disappear.
 - If one of the consumables is a Bomb Chest, blowing it to open it and picking up its contents will not make the other consumable disappear, and taking the other consumable will only make the opened chest disappear.
  - However, this doesn't apply if the Bomb Chest has an item in it. Taking the other consumable will cause the Stone Chest item to disappear and vice versa.
",True
Candy Heart,I671,Power of love,Gives Isaac a permanent [[Attributes
column2: stat]] boost whenever he heals with {{E
column3: Red Heart}} pickups.,2,Candy Heart, - Gives Isaac one of the following Attributes
column4:
stat boosts per half heart healed with Red Heart pickups:
  - +0.02 speed.
  - +0.05 tears.
  - +0.10 damage.
  - +0.15 range.
  - +0.02 shot speed.
  - +0.10 luck.
 - Spawns a red heart when picked up.
," - Items/effects that directly heal Isaac (such as Yum Heart, XIX - The Sun, Charm of the Vampire, etc.) do not trigger stat boosts from Candy Heart.
 - Healing using Rotten Hearts triggers the stat boosts for Candy Heart.
 - This item does not give stats when adding to Tainted Bethany's blood charges.
 - This item is useless for characters that can't have red hearts (e.g. The Lost, Keeper, ???, etc.).
 - Any healing prior to picking up Candy Heart will not provide stat boosts.
 - The stat bonuses are ""stored"" on the Candy Heart. Dropping or losing it in any way won't immediately revert the bonuses gained, only when Isaac's stats are updated again. The respective stat changed is the one that loses the Candy Heart bonuses.
  - The bonus stats will be lost if Isaac's stats are updated by dropping out of the game or if the game crashes.
 - The stat bonuses are seeded, meaning the same stat ups will apply in the same order in the same seed.
",True

column1: A Pound of Flesh,I672,Blood money,"[[Devil Room
column3: Penny
column4: display=Coins}}, {{r
column5: Shop}} items now cost [[health]], and [[Pickups
column6: consumables]] in shops are free but surrounded by spikes.",1,A Pound of Flesh," - Devil Room
column7: Devil Deals and Black Market items can now be paid with Penny
column8:
display=Coins.
  - Anything that generates Devil Deals (such as Satanic Bible or the special chests in Dark Room) will also create items that cost coins.
 - Items in Shops now cost health.
 - Pickups
column9:
Consumables in shops have no cost, but are surrounded with spikes and can't be pushed out with an explosion.
"," - Buying shop items for health does not prevent Angel Rooms from appearing.
 - Taking a health consumable surrounded by spikes at a single heart or less will still result in Isaac's death.
 - Immunity to spikes does not prevent damage when taking consumables in shops.
 - Shop consumables cannot be taken during invincibility frames, e.g. from taking another consumable.
 - When transformed into a ghost in Downpour II, shop consumables can be taken for free even without Holy Mantle.
 - The item is not available to Keeper and Tainted Keeper normally. If acquired through Spindown Dice, Death Certificate or such, it has no effect.
",True

column1: Redemption,I673,Deliver me from evil,"If Isaac enters a {{r
column2: Devil Room}}, but leaves without taking/opening anything in it (including {{e
column3: Black Heart}}s, etc.), he gets +1 [[Damage]] and a {{e
column4:
Soul Heart}} at the start of the next floor.",2,Redemption," - Upon entering a Devil Room, a white inverted cross will appear above Isaac's head. If Isaac goes to the next floor with the icon still above his head, he will gain a soul heart and +1.0 damage.
 - Taking anything generated by the room (items or consumables) will result in the icon going away.
  - Opening Red Chests will also make the icon go away.
   - However, getting an item from a Red Chest will keep the icon.
   - Opening Red Chests that have been spawned after room generation, e.g. as a room clear reward or enemy drop, won't remove the icon.
  - Taking A lump of coal or Head of Krampus after Krampus fight will keep the icon.
"," - After Isaac has taken a Devil Room#Deals with the Devil
column5: Devil Deal, while a Confessional or Sacrifice Room would give an Angel Room (Item Pool)
column6:
Angel Room item, it has a higher chance to spawn Redemption instead. This is the only way Redemption can be naturally generated during a run.
  - Other reliable ways includes using Death Certificate, or using Spindown Dice on Spirit Shackles.
  - Redemption has a small chance to be a starting item as Eden, Tainted Eden, or any character with Eden's Blessing.
  - Using Birthright as Eden has a small chance to spawn Redemption.
  - If Act of Contrition was taken after taking a Devil Deal, Redemption is not guaranteed to spawn.
 - Picking up items made free through usage of items such as Coupon or a Credit Card will still remove the icon and provide no benefit.
  - However picking up a free active item and swapping it with one you have will not affect the icon.
 - Red Treasure Rooms created by Devil's Crown also count as Devil Rooms for the purposes of this item.
 - Taking pickups dropped by Fire Places will not remove the cross.
 - Taking items inside the Devil Room spawned by Devil Beggars will not remove the cross.
 - Taking items from a Black Market will not remove the cross.
 - Taking the boss's item affected by Satanic Bible will remove the cross.
 - When playing as Tainted Lazarus, the holder must enter the Devil room to trigger the cross; it will not work if you transform inside. The character with the inverted cross must be the one to travel to the next floor.
 - When playing as Jacob and Esau, the cross won't disappear if the character without redemption takes the items/loot in the devil room
",True

column1: Spirit Shackles,I674,Unfinished business,"On [[death]], Isaac's ghost is chained to his dead body and he can continue to fight with 1/2 of a heart, returning to life after 10 seconds. After it activates, it must be recharged by picking up a {{E
column2:
soul heart}}.",2,Spirit Shackles," - Upon death, Isaac turns into a ghost that is linked to Isaac's dead body, similarly to The Soul, and can continue fighting with 1/2 of a heart. Isaac comes back to life 10 seconds after this effect occurs if he doesn't take damage while in ghost form.
  - Isaac has flight in ghost form, but no Tear Effects#Spectral
column3:
spectral tears unlike other ghostly forms.
  - After this effect occurs, Spirit Shackles cannot activate again until Isaac gains a half or full Soul Heart or a Black Heart. Soul Hearts that are used to charge Spirit Shackles will not be added to Isaac's health.
"," - When the Shackles are ready, their costume on Isaac's arms is light blue. When they are drained and cannot protect from death, they are gray.
 - The entire heart gained is used to charge the item, although only a half heart is required.
  - In the case of blended hearts, Spirit Shackles will only be recharged if the blended heart would give Isaac soul health.
 - If Spirit Shackles is uncharged, items that add soul hearts directly to Isaacâ€™s health (such as Rosary, Cancer, or Book of Revelations) will recharge Spirit Shackles and give one less soul heart.
 - Isaac will have invulnerability frames for 1/3rd of a second after reviving, allowing him to get off of spikes he stepped on if they were what killed him.
 - Spirit Shackles can be recharged while it is active, but it cannot re-activate until its effect ends.
 - When Isaac returns to normal, he will be placed where his body was.
 - If Isaac leaves the room while in ghost form, he will not be chained to anything and can move freely. He will also come back to life at his current location rather than where his body was left.
  - Isaac can be trapped by this if he's in the middle of a pile of rocks when this happens. This can be fixed by save-quitting, then continuing the run.
 - If Isaac dies while in ghost form and is brought back to life by a respawn item, he will have flight and spectral tears until it would normally be removed.
 - Spirit Shackles cannot activate in the Mirrored World, nor can the ghost form given by it be used to enter the Mirrored World.
 - Spirit Shackles will trigger if a fatal Devil Room#Deals with the Devil
column4:
Devil Deal is taken.
",True

column1:
Cracked Orb,I675,Shards of knowledge,Unlocks doors and reveals a random room on the map when Isaac takes damage.,1,Cracked Orb," - Upon taking damage, activates the following effects:
  - Unlocks all locked doors in the room (doors that need the room to be cleared are not affected).
  - Opens the Secret Room and the Super Secret Room if adjacent to the room you are in.
  - Reveals a random unmapped room on the floor.
  - Destroys all tinted rocks and rocks with Crawl Spaces in the room.
", - The effect is able to reveal the Ultra Secret Room.
 - The unlocking effect is able to open:
  - The golden door to Mega Satan;
  - Doors leading to Downpour / Mines / Mausoleum;
  - The entrance to the Mom's Heart fight in the Mausoleum and Gehenna;
  - A Strange Door.
 - The effect will not open the doors to:
  - Challenge Room from the outside;
  - Regular doors in Chest / Dark Room.
  - Boss Rush / ??? doors even after the fight.
,True

Empty Heart,I676,It multiplies,"If Isaac has one red heart or less at the beginning of a floor, he gains an empty red [[heart container]].",2,Empty Heart," - If Isaac has one red heart or less at the beginning of a floor, an empty heart container is added.
"," - As there is no special exception, this item will have no effect for characters that cannot have red hearts : Dark Judas, ???, The Lost, Keeper, The Forgotten, The Soul, Tainted Judas, Tainted ???, Tainted Lost, Tainted Keeper, Tainted Soul and Tainted Bethany.
 - The empty heart containers will replace any other heart containers if the maximum has been reached.
",True
Astral Projection,I677,The true out-of-body experience!,"Causes Isaac to turn into a ghost if he gets hit while in an uncleared room, giving him [[flight]] and [[Tear Effects#Spectral
column2: spectral tears]] and blocking the next hit he takes.",2,Astral Projection," - The first time Isaac takes damage while in an uncleared room, time is stopped for 2 seconds and Isaac becomes a ghost and leaves his body behind, which drops to the floor. While in ghost form, Isaac has flight and Tear Effects#Spectral
column3:
spectral tears and the next hit he takes is negated.
  - Isaac's tears and speed are greatly increased while time is stopped, although this is not shown on the HUD.
  - Isaac's ghost re-enters his body after the room is cleared or if he gets hit again.
"," - The damage blocked by being in ghost form also affects self-damage and red-heart draining sources, like Devil Beggars, IV Bag, etc.
 - Receiving lethal damage can potentially save Isaac's life if he manages to heal before the ghost reenters the body.
 - Astral Projection has no effect onThe Lost.
 - Dull Razor may be used to safely activate Astral Projection as The Lost.
 - It's also possible to leave the room while the ghost is outside the body, either by bombing it or having items that keep doors open, such as Door Stop or Mercurius. This grants Isaac an additional chance to heal.
  - Teleporting outside of the room will not work.
 - Astral Projection cannot be triggered inside of Boss Rush.
",True

column1:
C Section,I678,Fetus shots,Replaces tears with fetuses that chase down enemies and deal contact damage. Each shot requires a brief charge up.,4,C Section," - Isaac gains a short delay charge attack that fires homing, piercing, spectral fetus tears.
  - The fetus tears do Damage equal to Isaac's, about 5 times per second, until they run out of Range.
  - The fetuses will automatically fire when Isaac is at full charge, meaning the charge cannot be held.
  - Charge time is quantized based on Tear Delay.
   - \text{Fetuses per Second} = \frac{30}{Roundup(\text{Tear Delay} \times 3) + 1}
   - Fetuses per second is capped at 15.
"," - Fetus size scales with damage.
 - The fetuses slow down upon contacting enemies, making its homing effect more powerful.
",True
Lil Abaddon,I679,Abyssal friend,Spawns a [[familiar]] that charges a miniature {{i
column3:
force=n}} attack while Isaac shoots.,3,Lil Abaddon," - Gives Isaac a familiar that creates a fluctuating black ring after a 1 second charge time that damages enemies that touch it, similarly to Maw of the Void.
  - The black ring deals 3.5 damage per tick, up to 15 times per ring, for a total of 52.5 damage.
 - {{transf
column4: Conjoined
column5:
item}}
",,True

column1: Montezuma's Revenge,I680,Oh no...,"While firing, Isaac charges up a short-ranged {{i
column2:
Brimstone}}-like diarrhea beam that shoots behind him.",3,Montezuma's Revenge," - Continuously shooting for 2.35 seconds allows Isaac to fire a short-ranged brown Brimstone laser and corn shots behind himself by releasing the fire button.
  - The laser deals Isaac's damage per tick (15x Isaac's damage per second), ticks up to 19 times and lasts ~1.28 seconds (77 frames).
  - Corn shots deal 6 damage, and a random amount are created each blast.
 - {{transf
column3: Oh Crap
column4:
item}}
",,True

column1:
Lil Portal,I681,It hungers,"A [[familiar]] that flies forward, consuming [[pickups]] in its path. Each one will increase its size and damage and spawn a [[Blue Fly]]. Every four pickups, it opens a portal that leads to an unexplored room.",1,Lil Portal," - Summons a portal familiar that launches itself in the direction Isaac shoots to deal contact damage to enemies.
 - The portal will consume all pickups and trinkets in its path, converting them into blue fly
column2:
blue flies and causing the familiar to become larger and deal more contact damage.
  - Lil Portal deals contact damage equal to (2x consumables destroyed count + 2), and ticks up to 10 times per second.
  - When the familiar consumes four pickups, it will summon a portal that leads to an unexplored room on the current floor and its damage bonus is reset.
   - The portal cannot lead to the floor's Devil Room/Angel Room, Ultra Secret Room, entrance to the alt-path, Black Market, or I AM ERROR Room.
   - The portal cannot lead to Mega Satan.
"," - Lil Portal doesn't consume pickups or damage enemies it passes over while trailing behind Isaac; it only does so while being launched.
 - Lil Portal doesn't consume poop pickups when playing as Tainted ???.
 - Lil Portal cannot be launched over Obstacles
column3:
Rocks or Metal Blocks.
 - The room portals take Isaac to is determined at the time they're created; if Isaac clears the room the portal would take him to, he will still be taken to that room if he uses it.
 - If every room has been explored, portals summoned by the familiar will do nothing and Isaac will jump up and down in them. This effect appears to be cosmetic only, but it will provide brief invincibility frames equivalent to two Ventricle Razor portals stacked on top of one another.https://youtu.be/An0IFYflYDc Same effect occurs if a portal is summoned in rooms that don't appear on map, as Mom's Heart room in Mausoleum/Gehenna II.
 - Portals can lead to Curse Rooms, forcing Isaac to take damage in order to leave.
 - Secret Rooms and Boss Challenge Rooms can be entered for free by making a portal after all other rooms on the floor are cleared.
 - Portals will persist after Isaac uses them or leaves the room, and will always lead to the same room.
  - Portals do not respect pathing rules, and can spawn on single-tile walkways and in front of doors, forcing Isaac to use them and preventing him from leaving the room through that door. This can cause a softlock depending on what door it blocks and where the portal leads.
  - Softlocks can occur, however if the player has items like Pluto or has consumed enough ""One Makes You Small"" Pills then it is possible to avoid being softlocked as pushing up against walls of any kind will still allow passage through doors and with enough speed, pitfalls and obstacles as well. Because of this, It is highly and commonly advised to make your character small and relatively fast wherein possible when using Lil Portal for any extended amount of time.
  - Entering portals during Ascent that were created during the first clearing of a floor in Boss Rooms or Treasure Rooms may cause the game to crash.
",True

column1: Worm Friend,I682,Clingy buddy,Gives Isaac a {{E
column2: Nerve Ending}} [[familiar]] that burrows out of the ground to grab and deal damage to enemies over time.,3,Worm Friend," - Gives Isaac a Nerve Ending familiar that burrows out of the ground to grab enemies for 4 seconds. Grabbed enemies take damage over time, are slow
column3:
slowed, and are unable to move.
  - Worm Friend deals 4 damage per tick (8 per second), for a total of 32 damage per grab.
  - Worm Friend can target and restrain bosses in addition to normal enemies, even including endgame bosses such as Ultra Greed.
"," - Enemies can avoid/escape being grabbed if they move fast enough, jump, or teleport.
 - Worm friend must wait 5 seconds after losing/killing/releasing its target before it can attack another enemy.
 - When playing as Tainted Lazarus / Dead Tainted Lazarus, entering a room with Worm Friend active and then using Flip to swap to the other character will keep Worm Friend active for the remainder of the room.
",True

column1:
Bone Spurs,I683,Break your enemies,"Enemies spawn floating bones on death, which block shots and damage/repel enemies that touch them.",2,Bone Spurs," - Enemies spawn 1-2 floating bones on death, which block enemy shots and damage/repel enemies that touch them.
  - Bones block 2 shots and/or deals 2 ticks of damage before breaking.
  - Bones deal contact damage equal to Isaac's damage in the moment they were created.
   - This means that if the damage stat was changed, the bones that were already present on the screen will use Isaac's old damage stat.
",,True

Hungry Soul,I684,Out for blood,"Enemies have a chance to spawn ghosts on death, which chase and deal contact damage to enemies and explode after a short time.",3,Hungry Soul," - Grants enemies a chance to spawn a friendly ghost upon death, which rapidly chases down and deals contact damage to enemies.
  - The chance to spawn a ghost is 33% and is not affected by luck.
  - Ghosts deal contact damage equal to half of Isaac's damage, 4 times per second (2x Isaac's damage per second).
 - After 7 seconds, the ghost explodes, dealing 7 flat damage to nearby enemies up to 3-4 times.
  - The explosion cannot damage Isaac or the environment.
"," - Enemies killed by ghosts are unable to spawn more ghosts, except for those killed by the ghost's final explosion.
 - The ghost's explosion is capable of damaging friendly monsters, such as Bony
column2:
display=Bonies summoned by Book of the Dead.
 - Ghosts cannot be taken outside the room they spawned in.
 - The ghosts are not considered to be familiars and as such aren't affected by any items that modify the behavior of familiars.
  - This also means that Isaac can have more than 64 ghosts at a time and this won't override other familiars.
",True

column1: Soul Locket,I686,Power of faith,Gives Isaac a permanent [[Attributes
column2: stat]] boost whenever he picks up a {{E
column3: soul heart}}.,2,Soul Locket, - Gives Isaac one of the following Attributes
column4:
stat boosts per half heart gained by picking up soul hearts or black hearts:
  - +0.04 speed.
  - +0.1 tears.
  - +0.2 damage.
  - +0.3 range.
  - +0.04 shot speed.
  - +0.20 luck.
 - Spawns a soul heart when picked up.
," - Black Hearts give the same stat boosts as normal soul hearts.
 - If a character can only have soul hearts for health (such as ???), picking up two eternal hearts will count as giving one soul heart's worth of stat boosts.
 - Soul Locket only activates when picking up actual Soul Hearts, not if they're directly added to Isaac's health (such as by a Pills
column5:
Balls of Steel pill or Book of Revelations).
 - This item gives stats when adding to Bethany's soul charges.
 - The Lost and Tainted Lost can use this item normally, despite not having health.
 - This item is useless for Keeper, since he cannot encounter soul hearts.
 - Hearts acquired prior to picking up Soul Locket will not provide stat boosts.
 - If Soul Locket is removed (such as with Tainted Isaac), stat boosts will not be removed.
",True

column1: Inner Child,I688,Let him free,"Upon [[death]], Isaac respawns in the current room with half of a {{E
column2:
Red Heart}}, a massive size down, and +0.2 [[Speed]].",2,Inner Child," - Gives Isaac an extra life. Upon death, Isaac respawns in the current room with half of a Red Heart, a massive size down, and +0.2 Speed.
  - If Isaac doesn't have any Red Heart Containers, he will respawn with a Half Soul Heart instead of a Half Red Heart.
 - When Isaac respawns as the inner child, he emits a blood explosion that deals 35 flat damage to all nearby enemies.
"," - Resurrection items activate in a :Category:Revival items
column3:
set order. Inner Child is 5th in this order after Soul of Lazarus, 1up!, Lazarus' inherent extra life, and Dead Cat.
 - Once this item has been unlocked, if the current character's Tainted Characters
column4:
Tainted version was already unlocked or the current character is a Tainted character, it is guaranteed to spawn in the hidden closet in Home.
  - This item will appear even if Inner Child had been obtained earlier in the run, allowing Isaac to have two copies of the item.
  - Despite being hard-coded not to appear anywhere else for him, this specific occurrence of Inner Child will still spawn for Tainted Lost.
  - If this item is obtained in Home, a viable strategy is to intentionally die towards the end of the fight with Dogma. Isaac will be respawned with the size down and Speed up, and these effects will carry over to the Beast fight along with the healing provided by Dogma, making Isaac much harder to hit for the fight.
 - The size down from being revived by Inner Child is the same as if Isaac had collected Pluto.
",True

column1:
Glitched Crown,I689,?????,Item pedestals cycle between 5 random items before being picked up.,4,Glitched Crown," - New item pedestals cycle very quickly between 5 random items.
  - The 5 items will cycle in the same order every loop.
  - Items are rerolled at a rate of once every 0.2 seconds.
  - Plot-related items (i.e The Polaroid/The Negative, Broken Shovel 1/Broken Shovel 2, Knife Piece 1/Knife Piece 2, etc.) are unaffected by Glitched Crown.
"," - One of the items will be the initial one spawned/rerolled, while the other four will be from the item pool of the room the item is in.
 - Items spawned from chests normally have a small delay between when they spawn and when Isaac can pick them up; if Isaac has Glitched Crown, this delay is removed and he can pick up the item the moment it spawns, effectively forcing him to get a random item.
  - Chests have to be lightly tapped and immediately walked away from to avoid accidentally picking up the item so Glitched Crown can be used properly.
 - Isaac's Birthright effect and Tainted Isaac's inherent ability are overridden by this effect.
 - Items seen as options will count as picked up items, meaning they cannot appear again later in a run. This effect depletes item pools 5x faster.{{reconfirm}}
 - A good strategy to get a specific item is to remember the one that becomes before it in the cycle. Stand as close to the pedestal as possible and move towards the pedestal when the item that comes before the desired one appears.
",True

Belly Jelly,I690,Bounce away!,"Causes enemies to bounce off of Isaac, dealing damage to them if they hit an enemy or obstacle. Also gives Isaac the chance to deflect enemy shots.",3,Belly Jelly," - Enemies that touch Isaac will bounce off him and propel in the opposite direction. If they hit an obstacle or wall while bouncing, they will take damage.
  - If an enemy bounces into another enemy, the second enemy will also take damage.
 - When an enemy bounces off of Isaac, there's a 50% chance that Isaac won't receive contact damage.
 - Additionally grants a 50% chance for projectiles to bounce off of Isaac without taking damage.
"," - The damage enemies receive when they get bounced into a wall or an obstacle is equal to 8 + 2
 - floor.
  - The same damage value applies when an enemy gets bounced into by another enemy.
 - Enemies that don't deal contact damage cannot be bounced off.
 - Bounced off projectiles deal a flat damage that doesn't scale with the current floor or Isaac's stats. This damage is usually 6, but can slightly vary depending on the enemy that shot the projectile.
  - Lasers cannot be bounced off.
 - The bouncing effect also works against Fire Places and spiked enemies such as Poky, Slide, and Grudge, granting a chance to avoid unintentional damage.
 - Isaac can also bounce off Fly Bombs spawned by Blasters and even deny damage from their explosion.
 - Bombs and Troll Bombs cannot be bounced off.
 - Belly Jelly can prevent Tainted Jacob from being turned into his Lost form by Dark Esau.
",True

column2: quality]] of items received from all [[item pools]]. [[Item_Tags_quest
column3: Quest items]] are unaffected.",4,Sacred Orb," - Prevents low-quality items from appearing, greatly increasing the Item quality

quality of items received from all item pools.
  - Items with a quality of 0-1 are automatically rerolled.
  - Items with a quality of 2 have a 33% chance to be automatically rerolled.

column5:
Quest items cannot be rerolled.
 - {{transf

item}}
"," - Due to being quality 0, Skatole cannot be obtained from Shell Games after Sacred Orb has been picked up.
",True

column1: Sanguine Bond,I692,He awaits your offering,Spawns a special set of spikes in the {{r
column2:
Devil Room}}. Taking damage from the spikes has a chance to grant a reward.,1,Sanguine Bond, - Spawns a special set of spikes in the Devil Room. They deal 1 full heart of damage per use.
 - Taking damage from the spikes has a chance to grant a reward.
," - The spikes will not appear if the current floor's Devil Room was entered before picking up Sanguine Bond.
 - The spikes will deal damage to enemies that walk or fly over them, including Krampus.
  - As Krampus often spawns in the center of the room, it will deal a significant amount of damage to him, almost killing him completely.
",True

column3: Blue Flies]] after they block a shot. Each time a room is cleared, spawns another orbital fly.",2,The Swarm," - Gives eight Familiar#Orbital Familiars

orbital flies when picked up.
 - Each time a fly blocks a projectile, it will turn into a blue fly.
 - Each time a room is cleared, spawns an orbital fly.
  - The maximum number of orbital flies Isaac can have is 16.

column1: Heartbreak,I694,Eternal sorrow,Grants 3 [[Health#Broken Hearts
column3: broken heart]] Isaac has. Every otherwise fatal hit will add 2 more until Isaac has nothing but broken hearts.,3,Heartbreak," - Grants +0.25 damage for every Health#Broken Hearts
column4:
broken heart Isaac has.
 - Immediately grants 3 broken hearts.
  - Every otherwise fatal hit will add 2 more, replacing other types of hearts if necessary, and deal 40 damage to all enemies in the room.
  - Once Isaac has no non-broken hearts left, he dies. Extra lives will apply at this point.
  - The effect does not save Isaac from fatal devil deals.
",,True

column1:
Bloody Gust,I695,May your rage bring haste,"The first 6 times Isaac takes damage on a given floor, he gains [[Speed]] and [[Fire Rate]] for the rest of the floor, up to a maximum of +1.02 and +3.00, respectively.",3,Bloody Gust," - When Isaac takes damage, he gains Speed and Fire Rate for the rest of the floor.
  - Speed gained per hit is (0.04x previous hits taken) +0.07.
  - Fire Rate gained per hit is (0.1x previous hits taken) + 0.25.
   - Both effects stack up to six times, for a total of +1.02 speed and +3 fire rate.
   - Fire rate bonuses can exceed the normal maximum fire rate limit.
",,True

Salvation,I696,Divine protection,Gives Isaac a halo that summons beams of light on enemies inside it. The halo grows larger the more times Isaac has taken damage this floor.,3,Salvation," - Isaac receives an angelic halo around him.
 - When an enemy comes in contact with the halo, a beam of light starts to form above them. If they stay in the halo for about a second, a beam of light will strike down on them, dealing 3.5 damage and creating 4 more beams that shoot out in all cardinal directions.
  - The initial beam of light does 3.5 damage per tick (up to 15 times) and the others deal 1.75 damage per tick (up to 15 times).
   - If an enemy is standing in the center of all the light beams, they will take a total of 152.5 damage.
 - Each time Isaac takes damage, the halo will grow in size, up to a maximum of 10 times. The halo size will reset after leaving the floor.
 - {{transf
column3:
item}}
",,True

column1: Vanishing Twin,I697,He wants revenge,Spawns a [[familiar]] that becomes a clone of the floor's [[boss]] when entering the {{R
column2:
Boss Room}}. Defeating it drops an extra [[item]].,3,Vanishing Twin," - Spawns a flat, rotating fetus familiar that follows Isaac.
 - After entering a Boss Room, the familiar will move closer to the center of the room, and become a clone of the boss. Isaac must defeat both bosses.
  - The Vanishing Twin and original boss will be set to 75% of their maximum health, and their movements and attack patterns will be slightly slowed.
 - Upon death, the clone boss will drop an item pedestal from the Boss (Item Pool)
column3:
boss item pool, even if the fight isn't over yet.
  - The effect doesn't occur against mini-bosses and end-chapter bosses such as Mom, Mom's Heart, Isaac, Satan, etc.
 - The Vanishing Twin familiar will return when Isaac reaches the next floor.
"," - If Vanishing Twin becomes a clone of a boss with a hardcoded item drop, such as Gish or one of the Harbingers, the second item pedestal will be from the Boss (Item Pool)
column4:
boss item pool instead of the boss' regular drop.
 - Managing to defeat the boss before the twin has transformed into it will not prevent the twin from doing the transformation, and the boss fight will continue.
 - Obtaining Vanishing Twin in the boss fight itself will not take effect immediately. The boss room must be re-entered in order for the twin to transform.
 - On floors with multiple bosses (e.g. The Void) or when getting {{Cu
column5:
Labyrinth}}, the twin will only act on the first boss encountered.
 - The twin will not transform into bosses that are randomly found in some default room layouts.
 - This item has no effect in Greed Mode and will not normally spawn in this game mode.
 - If it becomes a clone of Great Gideon, 2 extra waves of enemies are added to the battle.
 - If Vanishing Twin turns into Clutch, the clone will immediately enter its second phase due to not having any Clickety Clacks to possess.
",True

column1:
Twisted Pair,I698,Double trouble!,"Spawns two [[familiar]]s that float on either side of Isaac and fire tears that use his [[tears]], [[range]], [[shot speed]], and [[tear effects]], and scale with [[damage]].",4,Twisted Pair," - Spawns two demon familiars that float by Isaac's side, and fire tears that use Isaac's tears, range, shot speed, and tear effects, and scale with Isaac's damage.
  - Each familiar deals damage equal to 0.375x Isaac's damage.
 - {{transf
column3:
item}}
"," - Twisted Pair is very similar to the item Incubus. It provides the same total damage per second increase in the form of a familiar (familiars in this case).
 - When playing as Lilith or Tainted Lilith, the demon familiars will deal 50% of Lilith's damage each.
 - Holding the up/down + left/right attack buttons will make one demon go further behind and the other one in front of Isaac.
 - Because the demons need time to adjust their position while firing, the left\right directional buttons can be tapped to shoot more precise, straight lines of tears.
",True

column1: Azazel's Rage,I699,Ancient power,"Isaac builds rage every time a room is cleared. After four rooms, fires a large {{i
column2:
Brimstone}} laser when entering the next room.",3,Azazel's Rage," - Isaac builds up rage every time he clears a room, which is indicated by the patch of skin that spreads around his face, as well as the four sections of the horn lighting up red one at a time.
 - After four rooms, Isaac's head will start to flash red; upon entering a room with enemies, he will fire a large Brimstone laser for ~3.33 seconds.
  - The laser deals Isaac's damage per tick (15x Isaac's damage per second).
"," - The counter for activation will go up during Greed Mode, Challenge Rooms, Boss Challenge Rooms and Boss Rush waves. If the Brimstone laser is ready, it will fire automatically after clearing a wave.
",True

column1:
Echo Chamber,I700,I can see see the future future future,"When Isaac uses a [[Card]], [[Pill]], or [[Rune]], he also uses a copy of the previous three Cards/Pills/Runes he used after picking up Echo Chamber.",2,Echo Chamber," - When Isaac uses a Card, Pill, or Rune, he also uses a copy of the previous three Cards/Pills/Runes he used after picking up Echo Chamber.
"," - Previously used cards, pills, and runes are effectively used again, meaning items that modify the effects of cards, pills, or runes will also modify the effects that Echo Chamber activates.
  - As a result, previously taken golden pills and blank runes will activate a random effect each time Echo Chamber activates them.
 - If Isaac uses cards that convert/destroy pickups (such as Ace of Spades, Black Rune, IX - The Hermit?, etc.), any other cards Echo Chamber activates that generate pickups have a high chance to have their pickups converted.
 - It is advised to avoid using cards that teleport Isaac, as he will be teleported to a specific room the next three times he uses a consumable. This effectively negates any current-room effects from consumables, such as XV - The Devil or Rune of Algiz, during that period, as Isaac is teleported after they activate.
  - Similarly, it is also advised to avoid using unidentified pills, as Isaac runs the risk of activating either a stat down or Telepills for the next three consumables he uses.
 - When obtained on Tainted Lazarus, Echo Chamber will only duplicate the last three cards or pills previously used on the Lazarus state with Echo Chamber. As a result, teleport cards or Telepills can be freely used on the Lazarus state without Echo Chamber.
 - If this item is somehow removed and reobtained during the run (such as when obtained from Lemegeton or Modeling Clay), the last three consumable types used during the time Isaac had Echo Chamber will be remembered. Genesis and Victory Laps will erase all of the remembered consumable types, however.
 - A card, rune, or pill must be '''consumed''' for the effect of Echo Chamber to trigger. That means using Blank Card, Placebo, or Clear Rune will not trigger Echo Chamber.
 - While Cracked Key will activate the effect of Echo Chamber and trigger the last three consumables used, using a different consumable near a wall that a red room could be created on will not create a red room, even if a Cracked Key has been used before.
 - Getting automatically revived by Soul of Lazarus does not add it to the queue, and directly using the soul stone will not allow you to get automatically revived in the future.
",True
Isaac's Tomb,I701,Buried memories,Spawns an {{E
column3:
n}} at the start of each floor.,3,Isaac's Tomb," - Spawns an Old Chest at the start of each floor.
 - Old Chests are similar in appearance to Locked Chests and likewise require a Key to unlock, but have the color of a normal Chest and a worn-down appearance. When opened, they contain one of the following:
  - 1-3 Soul Hearts (43% chance)
  - 3 trinkets (42% chance)
  - An Old Chest (Item Pool)
column4:
Old Chest item (10% chance)
  - An Angel Room (Item Pool)
column5:
Angel Room item (5% chance)
"," - The chest also spawns in the mirrored floor of Downpour II and Dross II if picked up before entering.
 - During the Ascent, the chest spawns in the original starting room of each floor, right above the beam of light to the floor above.
 - The chest does not spawn in {{Stage
column6:
Home}}.
 - Does nothing on Tainted Lazarus if the new floor is entered by the character without Isaac's Tomb.
",True

column1:
Vengeful Spirit,I702,Hot blooded,"After taking damage, spawns an orbital wisp that lasts for the entire floor, up to a maximum of six. They fire tears but do not block shots.",2,Vengeful Spirit," - When Isaac takes damage, spawns a red wisp that fires spectral tears and deal contact damage to enemies (but does not block projectiles). These red wisps last for the entire floor, and Isaac can have up to 6 red wisps at a time.
  - Wisps deal 3 + 0.1
 - (current_floor - 1) damage per tear, and fire tears once per second.
  - Wisps deal contact damage equal to 0.5x Isaacs's damage per tick (15 ticks per second = 7.5x Isaac's damage).
"," - The wisps share the first layer of Book of Virtues wisps so combined with them, you can't have more than 8.
",True
Supper,I707,HP up,Grants one full Red [[Heart container]]. Heals 1 additional {{e
Stapler,I708,DMG up,"+1 [[Damage]]. Prevents Isaac from firing tears from his left eye, like {{c
column2:
Cain}}.",3,," - +1 Damage
 - Prevents Isaac from firing tears from his left eye, similar to Cain.
",,True

column1: Keeper's Sack,I716,Spending power,"Gives [[range]], [[speed]], or [[damage]] when buying things from a shop. Also spawns three [[coins]] and a {{E
column2: Key}} on pickup.",3,Keeper's Sack," - Gives Isaac Attributes
column3:
stat upgrades when he buys items. The three possible stat upgrades Keeper's Sack can give are +0.5 damage, +0.25 range, and +0.03 speed.
"," - Every 3 coins spent will give boosts to a specific stat, going in the order of damage-range-speed. Buying 15 coin items give the same amount of stats as buying five 3-coin items.
 - Keeper's Sack works with anything that costs coins, including Devil deals/Black Markets as Keeper / affected by Keeper's Bargain or A Pound of Flesh, items or pickups created by Keeper's Box, the Angel shop created by The Stairway, and the second shop created by Member Card.
 - All stat upgrades are tied to the item itself; losing Keeper's Sack somehow will result in the loss of all obtained stat upgrades.
",True

column2: blue spiders]] over time while in a room with enemies, and spawn two blue spiders when destroyed.",2,Keeper's Kin," - If Isaac is in a room with enemies, rocks and rock-like obstacles will occasionally spawn Familiar#Blue Spiders
column3:
blue spiders.
 - Causes all rocks to spawn 0-2 blue spiders when destroyed.
 - {{transf
column4: Spider Baby
column5:
item}}
",,True

column1:
TMTRAINER,I721,ZZaZZ ZZdZZiZZmZZhZZ ZZvZZ ZZoZZ ZZ ZZsZZlZZhZZsZZoZZaZZiZZ,"Causes all future [[items]] to be ""glitched"", granting them completely random effects.",2,TMTRAINER," - When picked up, all future items become ""Glitched"", causing them to become random combinations of 2-3 effects based on other items as well as effects that are not normally controlled by the player, such as enemy spawning and other behind-the-scenes effects.
  - ""Quest"" items do not become glitched. This includes: The Polaroid, The Negative, Key Piece 1, Key Piece 2, Knife Piece 1, Knife Piece 2, Dad's Note
  - Additionally, the currently playing music will fade out. The silence will remain until another music track plays.
  - Any enemies in the room will also become simultaneously frozen and set on fire.
 - ""Glitched"" items can be passive or active and are completely randomly generated with practically infinite possibilities.
 - Random effects combine effects that exist on other items, and assign them to a random event (e.g. on enemy death, on room clear, on damage taken etc.).
  - These effects may also be derived from installed modded items.
 - Glitched items sold for money cost a random amount of pennies up to 99 pennies.
"," - Once Corrupted Data
column2:
link is unlocked, the TMTRAINER effect may be randomly applied to items found in Secret Rooms and I AM ERROR rooms.
 - Items affected by TMTRAINER may take the effect of rerolling all of your items. This includes TMTRAINER itself, meaning any future items you encounter will not be under its effect, nor will the items obtained by rerolling due to the glitched item.
 - All glitched items appear as Mega Blast in Isaac's Last Will or the In-game Pause Menu.
 - If an item held by Isaac is rerolled into TMTRAINER (Either by D4 or a 1-pip Dice Room), all items after it will be rerolled into glitched items.
 - A majority of the random item effects include farts, including active items.
 - Due to the sheer randomness of glitched items, some may cause the game to either crash or lag to the point of unplayability.
  - However, some may spawn entities that are normally only accessible using the Debug Console, including the Challenge Trophy that spawns at the end of Challenges and the Big Chest that spawns after most major bosses. Touching either of these on a floor that would not normally spawn them will instantly end the run and send the player back to the title screen (unless a challenge is currently being played, in which case the player will receive unlocks as if they had completed the challenge normally). Touching a Big Chest on any floor that can spawn them will NOT give the player the respective completion marks but will still end the run (unless Isaac has either The Polaroid or The Negative and is on either Cathedral or Sheol, respectively.)
",True

column1: Hypercoagulation,I724,Thick blooded,"After Isaac takes damage from an enemy or donates health, launches {{E
column2:
red heart}}s from Isaac that despawn after 1.5 seconds. ",3,Hypercoagulation," - After Isaac takes damage from an enemy or donates health, he drops a red heart that despawns after 1.5 seconds.
  - The heart dropped depends on the source: half-hearts of damage taken drop half red hearts, and full hearts of damage taken drop full hearts.
  - The hearts will get launched out of Isaac with momentum, making them difficult to pick up.
"," - Damage sources that scale up from half a heart of damage to a full heart of damage starting on Womb/Corpse will still only cause Hypercoagulation to spawn half a heart.
 - Red hearts are not spawned when Isaac loses heart containers (such as through health down pills, buying Devil Room items, using Guppy's Paw, etc), with the only exception being Potato Peeler.
 - Red hearts will still drop regardless of the type of heart being subtracted from damage, making the item generally useless for characters who cannot utilize red hearts.
 - The following damage sources will activate Hypercoagulation:
  - Enemy attacks
  - Normal spikes
  - Rocks#Spiked_Rocks
column3:
Spiked rocks
  - Fire places
  - Explosions
  - Blood Donation Machines
  - Devil Beggars
  - Confessionals
  - Hell Games
  - Razor Blade
  - Blood Rights
  - Dull Razor (despite it not taking health)
  - Potato Peeler
  - Extra damage taken from holding Glass Cannon
 - The following damage sources will not activate Hypercoagulation:
  - Curse Room doors
  - The door to Mausoleum
  - Sacrifice Room spikes
  - Spiked Chests/Mimic Chests
  - Bad Trip pills
  - Golden Battery
  - Kamikaze!
  - Breath of Life
  - A Pound of Flesh shop spikes
  - IV Bag
  - Sharp Plug
  - Shard of Glass
  - Blood Bombs
  - Blood Oath
",True

column1:
IBS,I725,Your stomach rumbles,"Causes Isaac to throw poop, create buffing [[creep]], or drop [[bombs]] while fighting enemies.",2,IBS,," - The chance for IBS to activate is dependent on the damage Isaac deals to enemies; the more damage an attack deals, the more likely it is to activate IBS.
 - If IBS triggers while Isaac is charging a shot (with items such as Brimstone, Monstro's Lung, Chocolate Milk, etc.), the charged shot will only fire after IBS's effect activates. In the case of thrown poops, the charged shot only fires after Isaac throws the poop IBS gives him.
 - Poops spawned by IBS can give pickups.
 - If Isaac is currently holding a poop, IBS cannot activate until he throws it.
 - Isaac can carry poop he is holding between rooms.
 - If Isaac takes damage while holding a poop/bomb, he will drop it where he is standing.
 - If Isaac hits an enemy with a thrown poop, it will immediately break.
",True

Hemoptysis,I726,Double tap sneeze,"Double-tapping a fire button causes Isaac to sneeze blood, dealing damage to enemies in front of him.",2,Hemoptysis," - Double-tapping a fire button causes Isaac to sneeze blood, dealing damage to enemies in front of him. The sneeze deals damage equal to 1.5x Isaac's damage, knocking enemies and projectiles back. Enemies knocked back take 10 damage when hitting a wall or obstacle and deal 10 damage to other enemies they hit.
  - The sneeze has a cooldown of 1 second.
 - The sneeze applies a curse to enemies. Enemies under the curse will take more damage from Brimstone-like laser attacks and violently explode on dying to these attacks, damaging and spreading the curse to nearby enemies. Any enemies spawned by those under the curse will also be cursed.
  - The following attacks will deal increased damage (2x damage +3 flat damage):
   - Brimstone attacks from Azazel/Tainted Azazel
   - Athame
   - Brimstone
   - Brimstone Bombs
   - Lil Abaddon
   - Lil Brimstone
   - Maw of the Void
   - Montezuma's Revenge's brimstone (not tears)
   - Mega Blast
   - Shoop Da Whoop!
   - Trisagion
  - However, the Brimstone ball from The Forgotten/Tainted Forgotten with Brimstone does not get the damage bonus.
  - The curse lasts for 5 seconds.
"," - Tainted Azazel begins with an inherent version of Hemoptysis that allows him to deal full damage to cursed enemies.
 - The sneeze's range is affected by the shot speed stat, and not by the range stat itself.
 - The sneeze can push Bombs, pickups and enemy shots.
 - The collision damage can be used to damage Hosts while their skulls are lowered.
",True
Ghost Bombs,I727,Spooky blast +5 bombs,+5 {{E
column3:
spectral]] and spawn ghosts that deal contact damage to enemies and explode after 10 seconds.,2,Ghost Bombs," - Gives Isaac 5 bombs.
 - Isaac's bombs create ghosts when they explode, which rapidly chase and deal contact damage to enemies.
  - The ghost deals contact damage equal to half of Isaac's damage per tick (2x Isaac's damage per second).
 - After 10 seconds, the ghost explodes, dealing 7 damage to nearby enemies up to 3 times and destroying nearby projectiles. Isaac does not take damage from the explosion.
  - If there are no enemies in the room, the ghost follows Isaac. However, it cannot follow Isaac between rooms.
", - Friendly enemies can be killed by the ghosts.
,True

 - When unlocking the item, coins do not actually have to be spent, just removed. Actions such as donating to a Donation Machine or items like Magic Fingers will also count as long as the coin amount goes from 99 to 0.
